loans.name: Aldemar Manuel

texts.es:
Al hablar de Aldemar no se puede obviar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de nuestro país. 

Aldemar no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor decidió montar un negocio de distribución de Plátano complementar sus actividad ya que encontraba mucho tiempo muerto y si hay algo que caracteriza a un agricultor es que no puede estarse quieto tiene que estar trabajando constantemente y es por esta razón que el señor Aldemar solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de plátano, los cuales complementarían muy bien los ya conocidos productos que cultiva en su tierra, su sueño es que Dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos para comprar una bodega y almacenar allí sus productos
texts.en:
When we speak of Aldemar, it cannot be omitted that he is a born farmer, raised and shaped by the beautiful values of the fields, which are humility and hard work, these being the two traits most common in the farmers of our country. 
Ademar, not satisfied with the income he obtained as a farmer, decided to start a business of banana distribution, adding to his activities, because he found himself with a lot of time with not much to do, and if there is something that characterizes a farmer, is that he cannot stay still. He has to be constantly working, and it is for this reason that Aldemar asks for a loan, for the purchase of a stock of bananas, which will go together very well with the other known products he farms in his land. His dream is that God allows him to have health to work tirelessly and be able to generate good income to buy a warehouse and store his products there.

loans.use: to purchase stock of bananas.

loans.name: Karanjung Indah Group

texts.en:
With good communication among group members of Karanjung Indah and also with MUK, Karanjung Indah group has finished repaying their fifth loan with good results and satisfaction. They managed to raise pigs and got a high selling price. Karanjung Indah group members were very happy with the results obtained, and all family members feel the benefits from the results of raising pigs. Ni Komang has had success with the sale of her piglets which she fattened as planned. Ni Komang sells her pigs at a high price so that she can save money and also meet the needs of her family.

Having achieved satisfactory results, the Karanjung Indah group will now resume borrowing to further improve their business of raising pigs. This loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed and to repair the pig cages. Ni Komang will use the loan to buy feed and improve the cage for her pigs, since she already has a sow. She is preparing the for piglets that will be born, and she hopes for all the piglets to be born alive. Currently the price for a two-month-old piglet is very high. Ni Komang hopes that she gets maximum results. She plans to save all the profits from this venture.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and improve her pig's cage

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy, 29 years old, lives in Katipunan, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married and gifted with 3 children. Daisy's husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural commodities. Daisy has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member helps her husband to plow the rice field and to plant corn and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Daisy decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 9,500 to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. Daisy has been able to manage her income and to provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte. For more than three years, she has earned a living through her hog raising business, which is her main source of income. Emelita is asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. A loan will enable Emelita to improve her business’ productivity and stability. Emelita’s future plans include the expansion of her piggery and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a 40-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. For more than five years, she has run a small sari-sari (convenience store) business, selling various goods and food items to the people in her neighborhood. Esterlita is requesting a loan to buy more stock such as rice, bread, biscuits, soap, detergents, soft drinks, beverages, condiments, etc. to sell. This loan will enable Esterlita to improve her inventory, allowing her to attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Esterlita dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, bread, biscuits, soap, detergents, soft drinks, beverages, condiments, etc. to sell

loans.name: Santos Honorato

texts.es:
Santos tiene 38 años de edad, es casado. Vive con su cónyugue y sus seis hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales de este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café. Cuenta con 06 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas experiencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de productos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, como abonos y fertilizantes, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para el período de cosecha. De esta manera Santos espera mejorar la calidad del producto que ofrecerá a sus clientes, así como también logrará tener una cosecha oportuna, por ende tendrá una mayor producción, aumentando sus ingresos y con esto su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 38 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and 6 children in his own house made of rustic materialsl in the district of Pucará, Jaén province in the Cajamarca region, on the North Coast of Peru. The main businesses in this district are agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Santos works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 6 year experience in the field and has good personal and labor references in the area. The loan will be used to buy agricultural products to maintain his crops like manure and fertilizers. Also he will pay for labor for the harvest. In this way Santos hopes to get a higher quality of product to offer to his clients and he would also like to have an acceptable harvest, in the end higher production, increasing his income and with this enjoy a higher quality of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy products to maintain his crops and to pay for labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Alex Manuel

texts.es:
Alex tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero. Vive con sus padres y sus tres hermanos menores en una casa de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio. Cuenta con 02 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Además también se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas como peón para así obtener ingresos adicionales. El préstamo será utilizado en reparaciones y compra de materiales para el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, con esto Alex espera mejorar las condiciones en las que brinda el servicio de transporte, satisfaciendo así las necesidades de sus clientes lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y por ende aumentará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alex, 23, is single.  He lives with his parents and his three younger siblings in a house made of rustic materials in the Pucará district of the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.  The residents of the district work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

He provides public transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi.  He has two years of experience in this line of work as well as very good personal and work references in the region.  He also works as a day laborer doing agricultural work as a way to earn additional income.

The loan is for repairs and to purchase materials to maintain his vehicle.

Alex hopes to improve the conditions in which he provides his transportation service so he can satisfy his customers' needs.  This will have a big impact on his income level and improve his quality of life as a result.

loans.use: to make repairs and to buy materials for maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: Clelia de 62 años de edad es soltera. Ella forma parte del grupo “Crecer” y está constituido por 05 socias solidarias y responsables. Clelia se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio. Tienes planeado continuar implementando su negocio lo cual tiene buena acogida. Producto a su constancia a logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, fólderes, lapiceros y plumones. El grupo “Crecer” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios. Clelia se encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado izquierdo
texts.en:
Clelia is 62 years old and single. She is part of the group “Crecer”, which is composed of five supportive, responsible women.

Clelia earns a living selling stationery supplies. She plans to continue implementing this business which has been welcomed. Through perseverance she has managed to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy notebooks, folders,  ballpoint pens and felt-tip pens.

The "Crecer" Group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity to grow in their businesses. Clelia is seen in the back and first on the left side.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, folders, ballpoint pens and felt-point pens.

loans.name: Yehowa  A Dzo Wo Group

texts.en: These women are part of Yehowa A Dzo Wo (God bless all) Group and have an average age of 40 years and three children at home. They all live in traditional extended families in Chorkor, Ghana. These women are neighbors who work by buying and selling porridge, vegetables, grocery, maize groundnut, kenkey (cooked corn dough) and fish. After successfully repaying their previous loans, these women of the Yehowa A Dzo Wo Group are on their fourth loan. Esther is the woman standing in the middle of the photo. She intends to use this loan to buy more vegetables to sell to customers. She buys her supplies locally at the main market, and makes her sales to diverse clients, both women and men, in cash and often on credit. She hopes to make a very good monthly profit, which she will use for school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her business. She is married and has four children who are attending school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, a hardworking and diligent widow, is from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has never tired of supporting her family, especially her grandchildren. Loreta is engaged in a snack vending business selling rice cakes. Her business is doing well and she doubles her time perfecting her own rice cake recipe. Loreta has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

Loreta has taken another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes in order to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make another snack recipe to increase sales. Today, Loreta is able to help others do retail business with her rice cakes and they also earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes in order to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 35años de edad, no estudió, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando educación básica y el menor de ellos aún no tiene edad para que estudie.

José, trabaja desde que estaba muy pequeño, ya que su padre falleció y él, junto a sus hermanos se dedicaron a trabajar en la agricultura, desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 p.m. y les pagaban $2.50 diario.- Cuando el cumplió 11 años, decidió trabajar en sus propios cultivos; empezó cultivando maíz, hoy en día trabaja dos tipos de cultivos maíz y frijol, el que más cultiva es el frijol, ya que tiene dos hectáreas sembradas.

El crédito será invertido para comprar una vaca, la cual pasteará en los terrenos donde cultivo el maíz y frijol, ya que hay bastante pasto de la cosecha antes cosechada.

El sueño que tiene José, es que sus hijos estudien y tengan mayores oportunidades de empleo que las que él tuvo.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and never went to school. He is in a relationship and has 3 children, 2 of whom are are studying in public school and the other isn't old enough to be studying.

José has worked since he was very small as his father died. He and his brothers worked together in agriculture. They worked from 6am until 12 noon and they got paid $2.50 daily. When he turned 11 he decided to grow his own crops and started growing corn.

Today he works two kinds of crops corn and beans. He grows more beans with two hectares planted. The loan will be invested in buying a cow which will graze on the land where he grows beans and corn as there is plenty of grass here before the harvest. José's dream is for his children to study and have better opportunity for employment than what he had.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sadio's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place depuis le novembre 2004, le banc villageois regroupe des femmes d’un même village et hameaux environnant. Elles entretiennent de très bon rapport de voisinage et ont pour la majorité une longue et riche expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce et la transformation.

Madame Sadio  (assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33ans, mariée  et mère de trois enfants âgés de 03 à 12 ans dont 02 garçons et une fille, elle s’active dans la vente d’huile de palme qu’elle  achète au marché international de la sous région par fût de 100  litres pour la revente par bidon de 20 litres ou  bouteille d’un litre. Elle a une bonne expérience du milieu d’activité pour l’avoir fréquenté pendant plus de 5 ans. 

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle comme acheter au moins 02 fûts pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices lui permettront en plus des épargnes pour agrandir ses investissements, elle compte assurer les besoins familiales (habillement, santé, scolarité, nourriture).
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created in November 2004, and it is composed of women from the same village and surrounding hamlets. They maintain a very good relationship, and most of them have had an extensive and rewarding experience with the system of the bancs villageois. Their activities are small trade and processing. 

Mrs. Sadio (sitting second from the right in the group photo) is the featured borrower from this group. She is 33 years old and married with three children aged 3 to 12, two boys and one girl. She sells palm oil that she buys at the international market of the sub-region in casks of 100 liters for resale in 20-liter jugs or one-liter bottles. She has a good command of this activity having done this for over 5 years.  

She will use this new loan to buy at least 2 casks of palm oil to sell at retail. 

The profits earned will help to bolster her savings and to expand her business. She also plans to help provide for her family’s needs (clothing, healthcare, tuition, food).

loans.use: to buy at least two casks of palm oil for resale at retail.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is a 40-year-old married rice farmer with four children in her care. She lives in Takeo province in Cambodia. Two of the children work in a factory. Her husband (with the borrower in the photo) is 44 years old and he is also a rice farmer. They can make around USD 14 a day. 

Oun doesn’t have enough money to buy lumber to build a house, so she has decided to apply for a loan. This loan will provide her and her family with a proper house to live in. As for her future plans, she is going to expand her rice farming and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina is a married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. Her husband is a farmer. Felomina is asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. The loan will enable her to raise more pigs to be sold to the market after several weeks. In the future, Felomina dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander, 45 years old, is married and a resident of Poblacion, Sibutad, ZDN, Philippines. He and his wife are blessed with 4 children. Because it is hard for his family to survive if only he is working, Alexander decided to engage in selling and started a sari-sari (convenience store) with 3,000 PHP of capital. The store's primary customers are their neighbors. 

Alexander has been able to manage the store successfully and to finance his family's daily needs with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which he joined in April 2012. Alexander was able to avail himself of two loans and repaid them religiously. He has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to finance additional stock for the store. He is looking forward to expanding his sari-sari into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of basic commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn, 34 years old, is a rice retailer from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has three children. Genelyn has been in  the rice retailing business for more than 4 years. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell. This will enable her to increase her stock, allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Genelyn hopes to make her business more profitable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en:
Chhea is a 58-year-old married rice farmer with four grown-up children. She lives in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. So far she has been in rice farming for over 30 years. One of the children works in a factory, two are waiters, and one is a construction worker. Her husband (with her in the photo) is a 58-year-old rice farmer. Together, they can earn approximately USD 21 a day. 

Chhea would like to request a loan to build a bathroom with a toilet. This loan will provide her and her family with hygienic living conditions. In additional to rice farming, she also wants to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to build a bathroom with a toilet

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 28 años, es casado. Su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y su hija en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la ganadería, agricultura y al comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, con más de 18 meses de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de materiales como cemento, madera, pintura, para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, la cual actualmente se encuentra en mal estado. Esta inversión le permitirá vivir en mejores condiciones y desarrollar sus actividades con mayor comodidad, logrando así incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is 28 years old and married.  He has a very close family and lives in his own home with his spouse and daughter. They live in a community in the district of Cayaltí of the Chiclayo province, Labayeque region in the north coast of Perú.  The people of this district work mainly with cattle, agriculture and sales. He raise and sells pigs. He has more than 18 months of experience in this business and has good personal and work references.  

The loan will be used to buy materials such as cement, wood and paint to improve his home which is currently in bad condition.  This investment will allow him to have better living conditions, work more comfortably and improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, wood and paint to improve his home.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc, Leyte. She used to operate a small sari-sari (convenience store) but decided to stop after it was ruined by a super typhoon. Herminia wants to start her business again in order to earn a living. She is now requesting a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, beverages, soap, bleaching agents, cooking oil, condiments and animal feed to sell.  A loan will enable Herminia to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Herminia hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, beverages, soap, bleaching agents, cooking oil, condiments and animal feed to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc, Leyte. Imelda earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business, selling snack foods, rice, detergents and others. This has been her main source of income for the past 15 years now. 

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, chips and snack foods. A loan will allow Imelda to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Imelda has hopes of making her sari-sari store more profitable and stable. She also wants to save some of her daily earnings to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, chips and snack foods

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from Ormoc, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods to the people in her place. This has been her  source of income for the past 15 years now. 

 Isabelita is asking to take out a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, candies and coffee, eggs and others. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store.  In the future, Isabelita wants to improve her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, rice, candies and coffee, eggs and others

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, a woman in her early 50s, is a food vendor. She is married and has three children. Lucia cooks and sells food to the people in her place. She has a small store in which she displays her products. She has been in the business for more than five years now. 

Lucia is asking to take a loan to buy ingredients, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice, and other items. With this loan, Lucia will be able to cook and sell more food, thus augmenting her sales and income. Lucia believes that this loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Jhonny Alexander

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajador, así es Jhonny, un hombre guerrero que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Medellin, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en una zona comercial.
Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.
Jhonny ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas y compra de un mesón en acero.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a este hombre con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hard-working is how Jhonny is, a determined man who has dedicated much of his life taking care of his children. He lives in the municipality of Medellin, where he makes a living preparing a variety of foods like lunches and breakfast in a small restaurant located in a commercial area. His foods are known by his neighbors in the sector who visit his restaurant because they know that they can eat something delicious.

Jhonny has decided to improve his restaurant and increase his sales. So he has turned to a loan to buy ingredients and supplies for his recipes and to buy a steel table. This loan will allow him to progress with his business to create the income needed to have the opportunity to continue to sustain his family and his business.

Support this man with a loan and make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for his recipes and buy a steel table.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides tiene 48 años de edad, es casado. Vive con su cónyuge y sus 03 hijos en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino y aves como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo y venta de cacao. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en este rubro, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, y para la compra de alimento balanceado de engorde para estos. Con esto Leonidas espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio, aumentando de esta manera su nivel de ingresos y con esto su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonides is 48 years old and married. He lives with his wife and 3 children in his own house made of rustic materials. They live in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. The locals works mainly in agriculture and raising livestock.

He works raising and selling goats and poultry like chickens, ducks, turkeys amongst others. He also raises and sells cocoa. He has 15 years experience in this field and has good personal and labor references in the area.

The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals like chickens, ducks and turkeys amongst others and to buy balanced feed to fatten them. With this Leonidas hopes to improve the production of his business, thus increasing his level of income and improving his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals like chickens, ducks and turkeys and buy balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Anorld

texts.en:
Anorld is a single man and has no children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and no piped water. His monthly expenses are food.

For the past three years he has operated a motor vehicle business in the neighborhood. He faces a challenge of competition in his business. With the loan he is requesting of 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase motor bike spares.

He decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase motor bike spares.

loans.name: Esmerita

texts.es:
Esmerita tiene 31 años, es casada. Su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo ,región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como borregos, patos, gallinas, entre otros, con más de 05 años en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esta inversión Esmerita espera aumentar la producción de su negocio para poder satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, aumentando de esta manera su nivel de ingresos y su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Esmerita is 31 years old and married. Her family is united and she lives in her own home with her husband in Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The people of this district work primarily in business, farming, and cattle.

She has been raising and selling small animals such as yearling sheep, ducks, hens, and others for more than 5 years. She has good personal and work references from the area. The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them. With this loan Esmerita hopes to increase production in her business and meet the likes and needs of her customers, thus increasing her level of income and her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals as well as balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es:
Urbano tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive con su familia en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Urbano se dedica a brindar servicios de sastrería, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como herramientas de costura, máquinas, tijeras, tela, hilos, etc. Dicha inversión le servirá para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades, lo que tendrá una gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Urbano is 55 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his family in a rural part of the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

Urbano works offering sewing services. His business is located in his house. He has 10 years experience in the field and has good personal and work references. He is requesting the loan to buy materials for his business like sewing instruments, machines, scissors, fabric, thread, etc. This investment will help him to provide better service to his clients, satisfying their tastes and needs. This will have a great influence on his level of income and in the end his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy material for his business like sewing instruments, machines, scissors, fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 65 años de edad, es casada. Vive con su esposo en casa propia en una comunidad del distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Es una comunidad tranquila, la población de este distrito se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros. Cuenta con más de 12 años en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros. De esta manera Santos espera hacer crecer su negocio aumentando el stock de productos de su tienda, lo que le permitirá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 65 years old and is married. She lives with her husband in their own home in a community in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. It is a peaceful community, and the district's population work in farming, ranching and commerce.

She makes a living selling groceries such as rice, sugar, oil and noodles, among other things. She has had the business for over twelve years and has good personal and professional references in the area.

She has requested a loan to buy a larger quantity of products for her store, such as rice, sugar, oil and others. In this way, Santos hopes to make her business grow by increasing the stock of products in the store, which will allow her to satisfy the needs of her customers, obtain a higher income and finally improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products for her store, such as rice, sugar, oil and others.

loans.name: Los Siervos De Jesus Group

texts.es: Alejandra de 50 años de edad es madre soltera y con 2 hijos, pertenece al grupo de Alcancía Comunal “LOS SIERVOS DE JESÚS” lleva el cargo de Presidenta  por mas 7 años en el grupo y lo conforman 8 mujeres emprendedoras que viven por la misma zona uniéndose para poder crear la Alcancía Comunal. Tiene como fuente de trabajo la venta de productos de belleza, además vende comida en un colegio de la zona y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de periódicos. Nos cuenta que su calidad de vida ha mejorado, incrementando sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos y así atender sus necesidades, es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio. La Sra. Alejandra es la persona que se encuentra de pie al costado  de las demás señoras sentadas.
texts.en: Alejandra is 50 years old, a single mother of 2 children. She belongs to “LOS SIERVOS DE JESÚS” community group. She has been President of the group for more than 7 years and the group consists of 8 enterprising women who live in the same area and are unite in order to create their community bank. She has as her source of income a business selling beauty products. In addition she sells food in a school in her area and on the weekends she sells newspapers. She tells us that her quality of life has improved, increasing her sales and thus her income and can meet her needs. She is seeking a loan to invest in her business. Alejandra is the person standing to the side of the seated women.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sari Indah Badung Group

texts.en:
Raising pigs is an activity carried out by the members of the Sari Indah Badung group. It is a job that can be done while primarily working as a farmer; however, with maximum results, this effort could be the main way of providing for the family. Ni Nyoman and members of Sari Indah Badung managed to sell their pigs with satisfactory results. They met the needs of their families and saved money. Ni Nyoman has sufficient funds to finance her children's school needs.

To further improve their businesses raising pigs, the group has reapplied for a loan. This time the group has focused on using the loan to buy superior quality piglets since their price is stable and they are more resistant to disease. Ni Nyoman will use the loan to buy 3 superior quality piglets and feed. In addition to farming with her husband, Ni Nyoman was greatly helped by the results obtained from this pig business. Her dream is to become a successful pig farmer and to sell pigs in large numbers. She has done all this to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior quality piglets and feed.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a businesswoman from Ormoc, Leyte. She is  39 years old, married, and has two children. Liza has operated her sari-sari or variety store for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Liza is asking to access a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, candies and others. This loan will enable Liza to improve her stock thus allowing her to attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Liza wants to expand her store in order to generate more revenue. Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, candies and others

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 27-year-old married woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She earns a living through retail sales of rice and peanuts. Maricel has been in the business for more than three years now. 

Maricel would like to access a loan to buy more rice to sell. A loan will enable her to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.  In the future, Maricel has hopes of making her business more profitable and sustainable. Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Chrep

texts.en:
Chrep, 37 years old, lives in a community of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she  operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for almost twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

Chrep wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is asking for a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages  9, 8, and 4. She is engaged in retail sale of various goods and food items to her customers. Melona has been in the business for more than a year now. 

Melona is standing next to sacks of rice and animal feed. She is requesting to take out a loan to buy more stock like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents, and animal feed. A loan will help Melona improve her business and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents and animal feed

loans.name: Yerli Aslin

texts.es:
Yerli ha sido una mujer muy luchadora a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Medellin con su esposo y su hija de 21 meses.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de frituras. 

Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de estos snacks. Ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuando un cliente le hace un pedido, intenta satisfacer su necesidad a toda cabalidad. 
Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su condición de madre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para compra de surtido de snacks al por mayor.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para el sostenimiento de su hija.
texts.en:
Yerli has been a fighter all her life. She lives in the municipality of Medellin with her husband and 21 month old daughter. She is a hard-working woman who for some time now has been working in her business of selling snacks.

Her business consists of buying and selling these snacks. She offers her products itinerantly and when a customer makes a request she tries to fill it completely. She states that it is an easy to do, her being a mother.

She is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of snacks wholesale. The loan will give her the opportunity to capitalize her business and give a considerable boost to her business. this will allow her to create resources to support her child.

loans.use: to buy a variety of snacks wholesale.

loans.name: Ndoreratujane Group

texts.fr:
Antoine fait partie du groupe  Ndoreretujane et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 43 ans et est marié Gisele ,un  fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 1 à 12 ans,dont  3 étudient. 

Il fait lla fabrication et la commercialisation des  chaussures  depuis  11 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  un grand cuire, et des semelles, pour la fabrication de beaucoup de paires de chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  agrandir son marché d’écoulement, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Antoine, age 43, is a member of the Ndoreretujane group, and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to Gisele, a public servant, and they have six children aged 1 to 12, three of whom go to school.  

Antoine has been making and selling shoes for the past 11 years. This is his first loan cycle with Turame, and he plans to use the funds to strengthen his capital; he will buy a large piece of leather and a supply of soles to make lots of pairs of shoes, which he will sell to bolster his revenue.  

In the coming years he plans to expand his sales market, and he also wants to see his children pursue their studies.

loans.use: to buy a large piece of leather and a supply of soles to make lots of pairs of shoes, which he will sell to bolster his revenue.

loans.name: Ngala Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Tom is a 35-year-old male Ugandan, and is a resident of Ngala Kyanaisoke. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 2 and 12.
Tom is a farmer, and sells agricultural products such as corn, millet, and beans. He targets the harvest season, and buys from farmers at a very cheap price, then saves them and sells when the prices rise. Tom will use the loan proceeds to buy corn and millet now that it is the harvest season. He is hard-working and thankful to fellow group members and UGAFOE for the good service, and their commitment to fight poverty, especially in the rural areas. He anticipates making a good profit.
Tom's dreams for the future are to build a family house, and educate all of his children to university level. He describes himself as hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy corn and millet

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 61-year-old, married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She used to operate a small sari-sari or retail business, but decided to temporarily stop after it was ruined by a typhoon. Now, Josefina wants to open her store again to earn an income. She also earns additional income through hog-raising. 

With this in mind, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), a microfinance institution near her place that offers loans to small entrepreneurs to start and finance businesses. 

A loan will be used to buy stocks, like canned goods, rice noodles, soft drinks, and beverages, as well as piglets to raise. Josefina hopes that this loan will contribute to the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks, like canned goods, rice noodles, soft drinks, and beverages, as well as piglets to raise.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moises, de 64 años, inicio con un negocio de asesoría contable hace aproximadamente 14 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.
En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en su hija y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.
Hoy en día su hija tiene 30 años y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un PC y programa contable.

Con este préstamo podrá trabajar mejor y así sostener su negocio y a su familia brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Moises para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Moises is 64 years old. He began an accounting business approximately 14 years ago with the desire to find an activity that would generate income and make it possible for him to survive.

At present, his motivation to work tirelessly is focused on his daughter and the desire to offer her the best for her life and development. Now Moises' daughter is 30 years old and has become the delight of this hard-working man.

Moises is requesting a loan to purchase a personal computer and an accounting program. With this loan he will be able to work better and, thus, sustain his business and his family, offering them a better quality of life.

Please help Moises so that he can continue with his activity!

loans.use: buy a personal computer and an accounting program for his business.

loans.name: Yehowa A Dzo Wo 2 Group

texts.en: These members are part of the group called Yehowa A Dzo Wo 2 (God bless all). They are on their seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include selling jewelry, groceries, foods, African fabric, body creams, and second hand clothing. The loan that they receive will benefit micro businesses like Victoria's. This is Victoria's tenth year with ID-Ghana. She joined after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business selling jewelry. She began this business through a cousin, who showed her how to acquire and sell this product. The loan that she has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase more jewelry to sell to both men and women. She will purchase the product from the main market, and later sell to customers. This job allows her to generate income to support herself. She is single, and lives alone. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are kind, and very determined to improve their condition.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell to both men and women.

loans.name: Agustin Raul

texts.es: Agustín, tiene 24 años de edad soltero, ahora se encuentra en el último siglo de su carrera de mecánica en un instituto particular. El trabaja como mecánico de planta logrando así realizar sus prácticas pre-profesionales dedicando  42 horas semanales para sus estudios en una empresa muy reconocida en el país. Nos cuenta que el préstamo lo utilizara para pagar las últimas cuotas del instituto, una de sus metas y anhelos es poder implementar su propia mecánica y así poder sacar adelante a su familia mediante el esfuerzo que realiza. Agustín está muy agradecido y también motivado con las personas de KIVA que depositan la confianza en él y espera que esto  continúe no solo con el sino también con muchos jóvenes que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Agustín is 24 years old and single. He is now in the last cycle of his mechanics program at a private institution. He works 42 hours per week as a plant mechanic for a company that is very well-known throughout the country. This is to fulfill his requirement for a pre-professional internship as part of his studies.

He tells us that he will use the loan to make his final tuition payments. One of his goals and challenges is to be able to establish his own mechanic shop and help his family get ahead through his efforts. Agustin is very grateful and also motivated by the people of Kiva who have shown confidence in him. He hopes that this will continue not only for  himself but also for many young people who need assistance.

loans.use: to make his final tuition payment.

loans.name: Tedson

texts.en:
Tedson is a 33-year-old Ugandan man married to Justine with whom he has 4 children, ages between 12 and 1; three of them attend school.

Tedson is a businessman who deals in electronics and other household items. His shop is located in Kagadi town. The major challenges that he faces are inflation and competition. Tedson has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to add more stock of electronics into his business in anticipation of the high demand during the Christmas season. His plans for the future are to expand his business and also construct a family house for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy television sets, radios and other electronics

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru:
Гулистон жительница южного района Кубадиён, где она живет с мужем и детьми. Она очень энергичная, трудолюбивая и отзывчивая женщина. Ей 32 года. Гулистон два года назад начала свой бизнес в сфере животноводства, чтобы улучшить жизненные стандарты. Она разводит коров и быков в скотном дворе своего дома. Гулистон ведет эту деятельность при поддержке мужа. Эта деятельность ей очень по душе, так как она не трудоемкая. 
Гулистон сейчас за счет кредита хотела бы увеличить поголовье скотов. Она собирается купить пару молодых бычков и от их дальнейшей продажи увеличить бюджет семьи. Гулистон верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Guliston is a resident of the southern region of Qubadiyon, where she lives with her husband and children. She is a very energetic, hardworking and responsible woman of 32. Two years ago she started her own business in animal husbandry in order to improve her living conditions. She raises cows and steers in a cattle yard on her own property. She runs this business with her husband's support. It suits her well as it is not very time-consuming.

Guliston is currently requesting a loan to increase her number of livestock. She wants to buy a pair of young steers and, from their later resale, increase her family's income. She puts her trust in your support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of young steers

loans.name: Jonathan Erick

texts.es: Jonathan de 23 años de edad es soltero y esta laborando como asistente contable de 2 personas naturales que solicitan su servicio, todavía sigue estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad en la Universidad del Callao llevando 4 años y medio a pocos meses de culminar, piensa trabajar en una empresa del sector industrial en el área de contabilidad para así aprender y desarrollarse en su rama ganando toda la experiencia que necesita para poder abrir una empresa comercial que el mismo administraría brindando así una mejor calidad de vida no solo para el sino también para su familia. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar una computadora que es muy útil para que realice sus estudios y trabajos que le demandan, Jonathan se siente contento por el apoyo que le brindan y desea que estas buenas personas de KIVA sigan apoyando a más jóvenes como él en logar sus sueños.
texts.en: Jonathan is 23 years old, single, and working as an accounting assistant for two people who seek his services. He is still studying accounting at the University of Callao. He has been there 4 and a half years and within a few months of finishing. He plans to work in the industrial sector in the area of accounting in order to learn and develop in his field all the experience that he needs in order to open a commercial business that he will own. This will provide a better quality of life not only for him but for his family. The loan will be used to buy a computer which is very useful to do his school work and work that is demanded of him. Jonathan feels content for the support that is provided to him and he wishes that the good people of Kiva continue supporting more young people like him to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy equipment for school.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is a 55-year-old married woman, with two dependents, from Ormoc, Leyte. Merlita's source of income, for more than 5 years, has been her hog raising business. Merlita is asking for a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business, as well as increase her profit. In the future, Merlita dreams of improving her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Mezeil

texts.en:
Mezeil is from Calaca-an, Plaridel, in the Philippines. She and her husband have a livestock business. They raise ducks for egg-selling. 

Recently, Mezeil availed herself of a loan to purchase nails, sticks, and nipa thatch to build a big pen for her ducks. Mezeil deeply wishes to sell more eggs from her ducks, to save enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase nails, sticks, and nipa thatch to build a big pen for her ducks.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a farmer from Ormoc, Leyte. She is 30 years of age, married, and has four children. Nancy grows various kind of vegetables, such as eggplant and tomatoes.  She helps her husband in tilling their farm. This is their main source of income. Nancy would like a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. This loan will enable Nancy and her husband to grow more vegetables, thus improving the productivity of their farm. In the future, they want to expand their farm lot, so that they will be able to grow more vegetables and increase their harvest and profit. Nancy also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Olmedo

texts.es:
Olmedo tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero. Vive en casa familiar de material rústico de un piso ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimor, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de productos como fertilizantes y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Con esto Olmedo busca mejorar la calidad de su producción para las próximas campañas, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas, por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Olmedo, 28, is single.  He lives in the family home, a single-story house made of rustic material located in the Santo Tomás district of the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru.  The residents of the district work mainly in agriculture and ranching.

He has earned a living for four years growing the Catimor variety of coffee and has a lot of experience in this line of work.  He also raises and sells cattle and small animals, including chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

Olmedo will use the loan to buy products such as fertilizer and soil amendments to maintain his coffee crop.

With this he hopes to improve the quality of his crop for future seasons, which will be reflected in more sales.  He'll earn more income as a result and be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products such as fertilizer and soil amendments for his coffee crop

loans.name: Yaya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est mis en place en Août 2009 est composé de  femmes très actives dans  leurs activités génératrices, malgré les difficultés liées à l’enclavement. Elles habitent toutes le même village et entretiennent de bonne relation de voisinage. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation.

Madame Yaye  (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants  (02 garçons et 01 fille). Elle est vendeuse de produits de consommation courante  à savoir savon, thé vert sucre et divers autres produits.. Elle a une parfaite maîtrise de ce type d’activité. 
   
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle prévoit d’acheter 02 cartons de savon, 03 à 04 paquets de thé vert et divers autres produits. 

Les bénéfices lui serviront à mieux participer à la prise en charge des enfants surtout sur le plan de la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was created in August 2009, and it consists of women who are very committed to their income-generating activities despite the challenges caused by isolation. They all live in the same village and maintain a good relationship. Their activities are small trade and processing. 

Mrs. Yaya (sitting on the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower from this group. She is 43 years old and married with three children, two boys and one girl. She sells everyday consumer goods such as soap, green tea, sugar, and various other items. She fully masters this type of her activity.  

Yaya will use this new loan to buy 2 boxes of soap, 3 or 4 packages of green tea and various other goods.  

The profits earned will help her to better support the children’s needs, especially in regards to food.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of soap, 3 or 4 packages of green tea and various other goods.

loans.name: Croc De Lisset

texts.es:
Croc es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 1 hijo y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlo adelante.
Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos, adicional a esto trabaja en producción y venta de comidas que ella misma prepara en su casa. 
Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.
Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras, además desea comprar insumos para su producción de alimentos.
Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Croc is a very patient and wise woman with a lot of experience. She has one child and has worked almost her whole life to provide the best for him.

She has a small place where she sells snacks, candy and sodas. In addition to this, she works making and selling food that she herself prepares at home. 

She works everyday from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm in order to have her products fresh and ready for her customers, who are mainly her neighbours.

She wants to invest in her business and have a big stock of products and ingredients. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy assorted sodas and snacks and also to buy ingredients for her food production.

One of the main difficulties is the lack of money to invest in her business. But she counts with the help of Corporation "Interactuar" and with the good heart of Kiva's lenders to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy assorted beberages and snacks, and also to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Aladino

texts.es:
Aladino tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres en una casa de material rústico de dos pisos y techo de calamina ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Es una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimor, con 03 años de experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente cría ganado vacuno y animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, entre otros. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, asegurando una buena producción para sus próximas campañas, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Aladino is 29 years old, and he is single with no children. He lives with his parents in a two-story house made from rustic material with a corrugated iron roof.  It is located within the district of Santo Tomás in the province of Cutervo, which lies within the Cajamarca Region of  Peru’s Northern Sierra.  It is a small community devoted mainly to agriculture and livestock-raising.

He has been growing Catimor Coffee for three years, and he also raises cattle and small animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs, among others. He has very good personal and employment references.  

The loan will be for the purchase of fertilizer and compost for maintaining his coffee crop. This will assure a good production in his next seasons, which will be reflected in higher sales volume.  Thus, he will earn more income and be able to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for maintaining his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is a 40-year-old food vendor from Ormoc, Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has three children. Nerissa sells pork and chicken barbecue. Nerissa has been in this business for more than eight years. Nerissa is asking for a loan to buy more meat, condiments and rice for her business. A loan will enable her to cook and sell more products, thus allowing her to increase her income. Nerissa hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more meat, condiments and rice for her business.

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Virgen De Chapi” conformada por 06  mujeres dinámicas y emprendedoras. Luisa  de 55 años de edad es separada con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida de manera ambulatoriamente. Gracias a su perseverancia puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Tiene el anhelo de contar con su local propio para así dar un mejor servicio a sus comensales. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de arroz, papa, pescado y pollo. El grupo “Virgen De Chapi” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado. Luisa es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo rosado.
texts.en:
This is the group “Virgen De Chapi” and is made up of 6 dynamic and enterprising women. Luisa is 55 years old and separated with 3 independent children. She makes a living selling food as a street vendor. Thanks to her perseverance she can cover her costs of living. 

She longs to have her own space to provide better service to her diners. The loan will be used to buy rice, potatoes, fish and chicken. The group “Virgen de Chapi” thanks the lenders at Kiva for the credit provided. Luisa is pictured second from the left in the pink shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, fish and chicken.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a female Ugandan, 39 years old, who is a resident of Kagadi town in the Kibaale district. Her major source of income is the sale of second-hand clothes, but she also does small-scale farming.

She has applied to UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 to buy a stock of second-hand clothes to add to her business in order to make more sales so that she can earn more profits. She has promised to pay it back in time.

She says her dream for the future is to expand her business and also educate all her children. She is grateful for the financial boost.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Merilen

texts.en: Merilen, the breadwinner in her family, is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 42 years old and married. She never tires of tending her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is adequate enough to support her family. Merilen is a full fledged member of PMPC (Kiva partner) and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales. Merilen continues to look for better business ideas and opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 33 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene un hijo, trabaja como agricultor, solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, actualmente está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene un hijo.

Luis, hace seis años trabajaba como mecánico en un taller de reparación de vehículos, pero desde que se mudó a la zona rural, se dedicó al trabajo agrícola, sembrando maíz, frijol, y jícama, de esta actividad genera el sustento necesario para su familia.

El dinero lo necesita para comprar sacos para depositar los granos y para pagar la mano de obra, que le ayudará a sacar la cosecha de maíz y frijol 

El sueño que tiene Luis, es trabajar muy fuerte para construir su vivienda de ladrillo ya que la que posee actualmente es de lámina y no es segura.
texts.en:
Luis is 33 years old and a farmer, he has a child and a partner who works in housekeeping.

He only managed to study until ninth grade. Six years ago, he used to work as a mechanic in a car repair shop. But since he moved to the rural area, he has made a living in farming, growing corn, beans and jicama (yam bean). With this occupation, he meets his family's needs.

He needs this loan to buy sacks for the grains and to pay hired labor to help him with the corn and beans harvest.

Luis's dream is to work very hard to be able to build a brick house, since the one he has now is made of sheets of metal and is not safe.

loans.use: to buy sacks for the grains and to pay hired labor to help him with the corn and beans harvest.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, de 63 años de edad, tiene cuatros hijos, 2 están casados.- Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina, pero solo por temporada y lo hace cinco veces al mes.- De esta manera María, satisface las necesidades básicas de la casa.
 
María, vende sus tamales en las comunidades cercanas, aparte de la venta de tamales ella compra y vende tamarindo en el mercado de su departamento.

María, solicita el crédito para comprar tamarindo y procesarlo para venderlo por libras en el mercado.

El sueño de María, es mejorar su vivienda y poner un negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
María, 62, has four children, two of whom are married.  She sells chicken tamales, but only seasonally, five times a month.  In this way, María takes care of her household’s basic necessities. 

María sells her tamales in neighboring communities, and she also sells tamarind in the marketplace of her department (an administrative division, like a state).

María is requesting a loan to purchase tamarind to process and sell by the pound in the marketplace. 

María’s dream is to improve her home and install a business in her house.

loans.use: to purchase tamarind.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.en:
Napoleon is a farmer who grows rice. He is a 29-year-old married father of three children ages 4, 3 and 1, and lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

He is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, rice seedlings and pesticides. These supplies will improve the yield of his farm. He could grow a higher volume of rice to increase his income and enable him to provide his family with nutritious food.
 
In the future, Napoleon would like to manage his farm for a sustainable livelihood and for the welfare of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, rice seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Chhil

texts.en: Chhil is a 55-year-old married mother of two children. She is a rice farmer who resides in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2000. Her husband is a 64-year-old fortune teller and her children are workers. Together, they can earn around $14 (USD) per day. To improve her family's finances, Chhil would like to secure a loan to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell. Her next plan is to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men and women's underwear to sell.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as confectionery, fish sauces and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as confectionery, fish sauces and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is aged 27 years, with 2 children aged 4 and 2 years; neither of them goes to school. He deals in poultry and tomato growing, a business he started in 2000. 

He was given a loan of UGX.1,500,000 (One million five hundred thousand shillings) to buy feed for his poultry birds. 

He is greatly affected by poultry diseases, like coccidiosis, that kills his birds. He will soon overcome this challenge soon with continuous financial support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011,il regroupe des femmes qui sont liées par une responsabilité solidaire.Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Mariama qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette.
Elle est âgée de 56 ans est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Elle a comme activité le commerce de céréales et de légumes.Elle dispose d'une expérience avérée pour ce type d'activité.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit  du mil à 175f le kg soit 05 sacs vendus unitairement à 8750f pour une valeur de 43750f,de l'arachide pour une valeur de 40000f soit 04 sacs de 50kg vendu unitairement à 10000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer les besoins vitaux des enfants tels que:la nourriture,la scolarité et la santé.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011, and it consists of women who are bound by joint liability. They practice small trade activities. 

Mariama is the featured borrower for this group. She is the member seen at the far right in the group photo and raising her arm. She is a 56-year-old married mother to five children.

Mariama sells cereals and vegetables. She has a solid experience of this type of activity.

She plans to use this credit to buy 5 sacks of millet at 175f per kg and sold in sacks worth 8,750f apiece for a total of 43,750f, and 4 sacks of groundnuts priced at 10,000f per sack of 50 kg for a total of 40,000f.

Her goal is to provide for her children’s vital needs such as food, tuition and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Relwende 2 De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur ETIENNE  est le représentant du groupe RELWENDE II DE TANGHIN. Marié, il est  père de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé à 20 ans et le moins âgé a 01 an. 03 vont à l’école. 
Monsieur est éleveur et vendeur de céréales depuis 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  02 moutons ; 05 poules ; 01 sac de mil ; 01 sac d’haricot.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Mr. Etienne is the group representative for Relwende II of Tanghin. He is married and a father of eight. His oldest is twenty and his youngest one. Three of the children currently go to school.

He has been a breeder and a cereal seller for three years. He procures his supplies from local markets.

He wants to purchase two sheep, five hens, one bag of millet, and one bag of beans.

His goal is to use profits to grow his business. His ambition is to become a major breeder.

loans.use: to buy two sheep, five hens, one bag of millet, and one bag of beans

loans.name: Gidget

texts.en:
Gidget has been a licensed esthetician and business owner since 1999. She started Xscape Day Spa in Hawaii and was very successful for many years. In 2006, Gidget moved to San Diego to find more opportunities to support her three children as a single mother. 

Immediately after relocating to San Diego, Gidget started her Master Esthetician’s certification process. She also participated in several internships and worked part time in various massage spas and doctors' offices to get a feel for the industry in San Diego.  

Gidget opened Xscape Day Spa in Chula Vista in 2012, providing therapeutic massages, spa body treatments, and skin care treatments. The business first operated out of a space within a hair salon to keep overhead costs low. Gidget received a Kiva loan in early 2014 to purchase an infrared machine to expand her services for clients. After receiving her first loan, the hair salon where her business was located went out of business and Gidget needed to find a new space. Despite this hurdle, she recently found a new and bigger location to work out of.

She will use her new Kiva loan to cover relocation costs and for working capital.

Gidget is committed to providing customized services thanks to her advanced training. She is excited to attract more clients in her new location and to continue growing her business in the future.

loans.use: to cover relocation costs and for working capital.

loans.name: Nhóm 14-Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en: Hien, pictured second from the left, is 34 years old. She works as a farmer and makes about VND 800,000 monthly. She is married with four children who are still in school. She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 2000. Now, she has to support an old mother. Due to the family's economic hardship, her household does not have a sanitary toilet yet. With this loan, she can purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a septic tank latrine  to improve the family's living conditions and contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Kam

texts.en: A local farmer living in Siem Reap province, Kam is 21 years old and a mother of two young children. She earns income by rice cropping and growing cassava. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. Kam will spend her entire loan portion to buy a tractor to support her farming. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a tractor to support her farming.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid has over 24 years of experience working as a hairstylist and has worked at her current salon for 11 years. She is a well-rounded hairdresser with experience in cuts, coloring, extensions, and blow-outs. In 2013, Ingrid decided to start her own salon geared towards providing hair extensions for clients in order to support for her two children for years to come.

Ingrid participated in the Accion Academy for entrepreneurs, an eight-week class that takes potential business owners through the process of launching a new business.  After the Academy, she was able to put her ideas together and create a solid business plan. 

Ingrid’s salon is a non-traditional “mini-salon” with only two chairs and very little overhead costs. Ingrid recently found a location for her business that is next door to a spa, which will help draw new clientele. Given her two and a half decades of experience, Ingrid also has a very loyal client base from her current salon that she will transfer over to her new business. 

She will use her Kiva loan to purchase equipment and initial inventory and to conduct marketing.

What Ingrid enjoys the most about working as a hairstylist is being able to interact with all different types of people. The most rewarding experience for Ingrid is providing hair extensions to sick patients and women and children with unwanted hair loss. She loves being able to help these women and children regain their confidence and self esteem through her services.

Ingrid’s dream is for her business to be successful and to transition to working at her own salon full time.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and initial inventory, and to conduct marketing.

loans.name: Noelia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Noelia tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera. Vive con sus padres en casa familiar en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de venta de comida preparada (menús), con más de 8 meses en el negocio, el cual está ubicado en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mobiliario como mesas, sillas y material de cocina, para ampliar su negocio. De esta manera Noelia espera hacer crecer más su negocio, atendiendo a una mayor cantidad de clientes y satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades, lo cual tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingreso, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Noelia, 30, is single.  She lives with her parents in the family home in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents of the district work primarily in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

She earns a living selling prepared food (meals).  She has had her business in her home for more than eight months.  She has very good personal and work references in the region.

She's requesting the loan to buy a large quantity of furniture such as tables, chairs, and kitchen items to expand her business.

Noelia hopes that will make her business grow more, by serving more customers and satisfying their tastes and needs.  This will have a positive impact on her income level, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of furniture such as tables, chairs, and kitchen items to expand her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a 45-year-old married woman from Ormoc, Leyte, and a mother of two children. She is engaged in selling food like hotdogs and sausages, among others. Yolanda has been in the business for more than five years now. As of this time, Yolanda is asking to take a loan to buy more hotdogs, sausages and other processed or frozen goods to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Yolanda hopes of making her business a success.
