Вот уже на протяжение двадцати с лишним лет Абдулотип занимается земледелием.Любовь к природе он привил в детстве,когда еще сам со своим отцом работал на поле и ухаживал за скотом.После смерти отца он решил продолжить его дело и вот сейчас у него участок земли в пятнадцать с лишним гектаров ,где он выращивает фрукты и овощи:картошку,морковь,помидоры,дыню,абрикосы и урюк.Весь урожай после сборки он сам отвозит на рынок и продаёт.Несмотря на его возраст Абдулотип всегда бодрый и полон сил.Он хочет закупить семена для посадки и купить органику для обогащения земли.Но у него нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Абдулотип благодарит  организацию Арванд  за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Abdulotip is a 55-year-old man. He is married and a father to five children and a grandfather to ten grandchildren. For the past twenty some odd years, Abdulotip has practiced crop farming. He has had a love of nature since he was a child, when he and father would work in the fields and take care of cattle. After the death of his father, Abdulotip decided to continue his business. Now he has over 15 hectares of land on which he grows fruits and vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, melons, and apricots. After gathering the crops, he transports the entire harvest to the market and sells it. Despite his age, Abdulotip is always spry and full of strength. He wants to buy seeds to plant and organic fertilizers for treating the soil. However, he does not have the entire amount of needed money. This is why he turned to MDO Arvand for financial support. Abdulotip thanks Arvand in advance for their trust and support.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant and organic fertilizers for treating the soil.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a Peruvian weaver who specializes in alpaca apparel and throws. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Nestor has been selling through Novica since 2002. This is his story:

"I hail from Peru's Puno region, renowned for quality alpaca and sheep wool. When I first began to weave, I worked on the rustic looms I built, along with other family members. We sold our wares at local markets until we were able to acquire modern machinery which, in turn, allowed us to develop newer designs.

"Many thanks to you all. This microcredit will help me grow my business and create new designs that I hope all of you will appreciate."

Use the link below to view Nestor's alpaca apparel and throws on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/3463

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in hand-crafted wall mirrors. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of high quality wood.

Marcos has been selling through Novica since 2004. This is his story:

"I am a self-taught artist who began to work at the age of 17 at a neighbor's workshop. After only a year, I decided to venture on my own, gradually gaining renown for the beauty and quality of my work. I have been dedicated to this craft for over 35 years and, to me, it feels like only yesterday when I began. Woodwork makes me feel good about myself because it means it's a way of preserving an aspect of Peruvian artistry.

"Due to the heavy rains that fell this winter, I had to build a roof over my workshop. This has really hurt my cash flow and so I come to you with this microcredit request, knowing that you believe in us artisans and are always there to help us grow our business. I have an opportunity, right now, to acquire high quality wood at a very good price, and doing so will really help get my business flowing again."

Use the link below to view Marcos' hand-crafted wall mirrors on the Novica site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/4505

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of high quality wood.

loans.name: Farzonai

texts.ru: Фарзонаи молодая жена и мать двоих детей. Ей 23 года. Она с мужем, детьми и свекровью проживает на районе Шахритус. Фарзонаи дома занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды. Она работает на дому. Она начала эту деятельность год назад. В работе ей помогает свекровь. Сейчас Фарзонаи необходимо купить новую машинку из-за того что ее нынешняя машинка не выполняет свои функции очень хорошо Фарзона видит выход из этой ситуации только в получении кредита. На заемные деньги Фарзонаи сразу купит новую машинку. Она заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Farzonai is a young wife and mother of two children. She is 23 years old. She lives with her husband, children and mother-in-law in the Shahrituz District. Farzonai sews Tajik-style women's clothing at home. She works out of her home. She started this business one year ago. Her mother-in-law helps her with this business. Now Farzonai needs to buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is not fulfilling its function very well. Farzonai sees taking out a loan as the only solution to her situation. With the lent money, Farzonai will immediately buy a new sewing machine. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Nolvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nolvia, de 35 años de edad, está acompañada, es ama de casa, por la extrema pobreza en que vivía con sus padres le fué imposible estudiar, por eso no tiene ningún grado académico.- Cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad decidió acompañarse, ahora tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela, el primero va a segundo grado y el ultimo a kinder; su compañero de vida tampoco tiene ningún grado académico y se dedica a la agricultura y a  la venta de pan.

Nolvia, se ha dedicado por muchos  años a los oficios del hogar, así mismo cuando se acompañó su compañero de vida le enseño como se cultiva y así fué como aprendió la agricultura, ahora también se dedican a la venta de pan.- Se levanta muy temprano a realizar los oficios domésticos y luego a las 6 de la mañana se dispone ir a vender pan a las casas vecinas, su esposo también va a vender pan y lo hace en otra zona para generar mas ingresos para así poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

El crédito será utilizado para comprar una motocicleta, para ir a vender pan a las comunidades vecinas, y así se le haga mas fácil transportarse a su compañero de vida.

El sueño de Nolvia, es aumentar las ventas de pan, para generar mas ingresos y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo tener una panadería propia, ya que en la que trabaja es de una vecina.
texts.en:
Nolvia is 35 years old, married, and a housewife. Due to the extreme poverty in which she lived with her parents, it was impossible for her to study.  For that reason, she does not have an academic degree. When she reached legal age, she decided to get married. Now she has two children who go to school. The first goes to second grade and the last to kindergarten. Her husband does not have an academic degree either, and he works in agriculture and selling bread.

Nolvia has worked for many years taking care of the home and, at the same time, when she got married to her husband, he taught her how to farm and in that way she learned about agriculture. Now they also work selling bread. She gets up very early to carry out the household chores and later at six in the morning she goes to sell bread to neighboring homes. Her husband also goes to sell bread and he does it in another zone in order to generate more profit and cover the basic needs of the household.

The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to go sell bread to neighboring communities, and in that way make it easier for her husband to transport himself.

Nolvia’s dream is to grow her bread sales, to generate more profit, and to be able to give her family a better quality of life, and also to have her own bakery, since the one she works in now belongs to a neighbor.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio tiene 65 años, es viudo. Vive solo en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en mototaxi, cuenta con más de 02 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para invertir en la reparación de su vehículo, con esto Eladio espera mejorar la calidad del servicio de transporte que brinda a sus clientes, aumentando de esta manera su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eladio, 65, is a widower. He lives alone in his own home in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The population of the district makes a living in agriculture, ranching, and commerce. 
He makes his living offering transportation services in mototaxi, and has more than two years of experience in this sector with very good personal and work references in the zone. The present credit will be used to invest in the repairs of his vehicle. With this, Eladio hopes to improve the quality of the transport service that he offers to his clients, increasing in this way his level of income and ultimately the quality of his life.

loans.use: to invest in repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Pendarima De Koanga Group

texts.fr:
Madame KOTIM ODETTE est la représentante du groupe PENGDARIMA DE KOANGA. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé à 27 ans et le moins âgé à 12 ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Madame  dolotière (prépare et vend bière de mil) depuis 30 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de mil germé; 04 charrettes de bois.
Madame compte utiliser ses bénéfices pour  investir dans con commerce. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande dolotière.
texts.en: Ms. KOTIM ODETTE is the representative of the group PENGDARIMA DE KOANGA. A married woman, she is the mother of five children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 12. Three go to school. Ms. KOTIM ODETTE has been making and selling millet beer for thirty years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. She wants to purchase 2 sacks of geminated millet and 4 carts of firewood. She plans on using her profits to invest in her commerce. Her ambition is to become a major brewer.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of germinated millet and 4 carts of firewood

loans.name: Neb Laboum De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur ADAMA est le représentant du groupe NEBLABOUM. Marié, il est  père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 12 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il veut s’acheter  08 moutons ; 05 poules.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour la scolarisation de ses enfants et agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne être autonome.
texts.en:
Monsieur Adama is the representative of the group called Neb Laboum. He is married and the father of four children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest eight years old. Two of them go to school. 

Adama has been a livestock raiser for five years. He buys his livestock in the market in his neighborhood. He wants to buy eight sheep and five chickens. He wants to use his profit to pay his children's school fees and expand his business. His ambition is to be independent.

loans.use: to buy eight sheep and five chickens

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” es un grupo conformado por mujeres trabajadoras y ansiosas por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Valeria tiene 58 años de edad es casada con hijos independientes. Ella expende abarrotes golosinas productos lácteos útiles de limpieza en su bodega que implemento en su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas abarrotes golosinas útiles de limpieza y frutas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Valeria viste polo a rayas negro y plomo.
texts.en: “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” is a group made up of hardworking and enthusiastic women improving their families' quality of life. Valeria is 58 years old and is married with independent children. She sells groceries, candy, dairy products, and cleaning supplies in her store that she built in her home. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more groceries, cleaning supplies, and fruits. The group appreciates the Kiva lenders for the loan that was granted. Valeria is wearing a t-shirt with black and gray stripes.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, candy, cleaning supplies, and fruits

loans.name: Esperanza Y Amor Group

texts.es: Rosa tiene 49 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de verdura picada y menestras precocidas  hace más de 15 años. Y a la vez presta servicios de domestica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas menestras y verduras al por mayor para expenderlos por kilos. El grupo “ESPERANZA Y AMOR” cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la que se encuentra sentada en medio viste polo marrón con estampando.
texts.en:
Rosa tiene 49 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de verdura picada y menestras precocidas  hace más de 15 años. Y a la vez presta servicios de domestica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas menestras y verduras al por mayor para expenderlos por kilos. El grupo “ESPERANZA Y AMOR” cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la que se encuentra sentada en medio viste polo marrón con estampando.

Rosa is 49 years old, and is married with 2 dependent children. She has made a living selling precooked diced vegetables and lentils for over 15 years. She also provides domestic services. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more lentils and vegetables in order to sell wholesale. 

She serves as president of the group "ESPERANZA Y AMOR". The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan provided. Rosa is the one in the middle, wearing a brown t-shirt, with a printed design.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and lentils

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
A married mother of ten children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales. Lorna is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to replenish her stock of charcoal to sell.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lauriano

texts.es:
Lauriano tiene 63 años de edad, es viudo. Vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades que se desarrollan principalmente en este distrito son la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros y al cultivo y venta de fruta (lima). Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de fruta, con lo cual Lauriano espera aumentar su producción y mejorar la calidad de esta para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lauriano is 63 years old. He is a widower. He lives in his own house, made out of rustic material, in the rural district of San Felipe, in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, in the north mountain range of Peru. In this area the main occupation are agriculture and ranching.

He sells groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and he grows and sells fruit (lime). He has 6 years of experience in this business, and he has really good personal and professional references in the area.

 He'll use the loan to buy compost and fertilizer for his fruit. He wishes to increase the production and quality of the crops, to satisfy his clients' needs. 

This will translate into a positive impact in his income and the quality of his life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to cultivate fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add to his working capital and buy a camera for his studio.

loans.name: Paling Wende De Koanga Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur LALLE est le représentant du groupe PALINGWENDE DE KOANGA. Marié, il est  père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  10moutons ; 10 poules.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne être un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Mr. LALLE is the representative of the group PALINGWENDE DE KOANGA. A married man, he is the father of five children. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 2. Two go to school. Mr. LALLE has been a livestock farmer for ten years. He gets his supplies from nearby market. He wants to purchase 10 sheep and 10 hens. He wants to use his profits to expand his business. His ambition is to be a major livestock farmer.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and 10 hens

loans.name: Penda's Group

texts.fr:
Créer Le 07 Mai 2009, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans l’agriculture de leur village, elles sont d’une solidarité sans faille. Elles se sont engagées dans le petit  commerce afin de réduire les obstacles à l’obtention des produits de consommation courante, elles font aussi de la transformation.

Madame Penda (assise à  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41, est mariée, mère de 02 filles et 04 garçons. C’est une femme très active et rigoureuse dans la gestion de ses activités génératrices de revenu. Elle compte plusieurs années d’expérience dans la vente de produits alimentaires et la transformation de pâte d’arachide. 
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 35 sacs de graines d’arachide non décortiquées pour la transformation.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer son épargne d’une part et d’apporter son soutien à  son mari dans la prise en charge des soins des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on May 7, 2009, this group is composed of women who are very active in farming in their village. They have an unassailable solidarity and are dedicated to small-scale commerce to reduce the obstacles to obtaining typical consumer goods. They also work in processing.

Ms. Penda (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 41 years old and a married mother of two girls and four boys. This woman is very active and strict in managing her revenue-generating businesses. She counts several years of experience in selling food items and in processing peanut butter. 

With her new loan, she is going to purchase 35 sacks of unshelled peanuts for processing. 

The profits will enable her to bolster her savings, as well as to do her part in supporting her husband to care for the children.

loans.use: to purchase 35 sacks of unshelled peanuts for processing

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Créer Le 07 Mai 2009, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans l’agriculture de leur village, elles sont d’une solidarité sans faille. Elles se sont engagées dans le petit  commerce afin de réduire les obstacles à l’obtention des produits de consommation courante, elles font aussi de la transformation.

Madame Adama (assise à droite avec la une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont deux garçons et deux filles, elle est une femme très dynamique dans le banc villageois car ayant adhérer depuis plus de cinq ans. Son activité s’inscrit dans l’achat et la revente de produits agricoles plus particulièrement l’arachide, qu’elle achète auprès des producteurs pour la revente au marché international de la sous région. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

 Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter au moins 12 sacs pour stockage en vu de revendre à un prix plus intéressant.

En plus de développer son activité, les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux prendre soins de ses enfants sur le plan sanitaire et éducatif et surtout de soutenir son mari dans la gestion quotidienne du foyer.
texts.en:
Created on May 7, 2009, this group is composed of women who are very active in farming in their village. They have an unassailable solidarity and are dedicated to small-scale commerce to reduce the obstacles to obtaining typical consumer goods. They also work in processing.

Ms. Adama (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of four children (2 boys and 2 girls). She is a very energetic woman in the 'banc villageois’ for having joined over five years ago. Her business involves the buying and selling of farm products, especially peanuts, which she purchases from producers and then resells at the international market in her sub-region. She enjoys good experience in this domain. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase at least 12 sacks of peanuts to store with the aim of reselling at a better price. 

In addition to developing her business, the profits will enable her to do better at caring for her children with regard to healthcare and education, and especially to help out her husband in managing the household day to day.

loans.use: to purchase at least 12 sacks of peanuts to store and then resell at a better price

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay laborers to maintain his coffee fields and  help with the harvest.

loans.name: Orozbek

texts.ru: Орозбек, 55 лет, женат, воспитывает 2 детей. У Орозбека высшее образование, на протяжении 14 лет он занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок. Благодаря упорному труду Орозбека, его ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса, а также накопить на покупку автомобиля для сына.
texts.en: Orozbek is 55 years old, married and is raising two children. Orozbek has a higher education. For the past 14 years, he has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. He has 1 dairy cow and 1 bull on his farm. Thanks to Orozbek's hard work, his average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the further development of his business, he turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan for 30,000 som (KGS) to buy feed and hay for his cattle. He plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase his business. He also intends to save money to buy a car for his son.

loans.use: to purchase feed and hay for his cattle.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda, age 46, is happy tending her little store. She is married with two kids, and her husband is a carpenter. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales. Daylinda continues to run her store well, even though she faces increased competition from other stores. Daylinda believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain a competitive advantage.

Daylinda has reached her third year of membership in Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain her position as a member in good standing. "It's already tested," she said. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional basic commodities to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Tet Fret De Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Antoine est le coordinateur de son groupe Tet Fret de Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4. Il habite dans la région de Dumas où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Antoine a dirigé son commerce de produit divers et charbon pendant 14 années. Des autres membres et Antoine terminent leur prêt d'obtenir un autre pour les ventes de Noël, ils se servent de ce prêt pour acheter des vêtements, des chaussures, cosmétiques, produits alimentaires et autres.

Antoine will invest this loan to buy different products like shoes and clothes, because this product give great sales in December. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.  Antoine dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Antoine is the coordinator of his group “Tet Fret de Dumas 1, 2, 3 & 4”. He lives in the Dumas area, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Antoine has been running his business selling general goods and charcoal for fourteen years. Other members and Antoine are finishing their loan to obtain another for Christmas sales. They are using this loan to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetic products, grocery items, etc.

Antoine will invest this loan to buy different products like shoes and clothes, because these products sell well in December. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Antoine says that his main goal and his dream is to own a big business with his funds and by God's grace.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, clothes, shoes etc.

loans.name: Hacia El Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HACIA EL MAR” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luzmilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca, venta de condimentos, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, venta de puertas de madera, venta de ropa, venta de camas, venta de quesos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luzmilda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar la carencia de este negocio en su zona decide emprenderlo con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el ahorro, el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “HACIA EL MAR” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional hub. It is formed by eight members and is governed by an executive board in which señora Luzmilda is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry forward are varied and among them are: coca leaf sales, condiment sales, skirt sales, neighborhood store, vegetable sales, wooden door sales, clothing sales, bed sales, and cheese sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where señora Luzmilda is a member. It is her first time with Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a promoter of the institution who went to visit her in her home. She currently has a neighborhood store business. She launched this business after observing the lack of this business in her zone and she decided to undertake it with the first loan obtained from Pro Mujer.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase the capital (purchase of wholesale canned food) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, and later she will sell it in her selling space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family, since she is a widow and has eight children. 

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the trainings, the savings, the loan, and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale canned food.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de 47 años de edad, está casado, es agricultor, estudió hasta segundo grado, por la falta de recursos económicos le fué imposible continuar, tien un 1 hijo, que está estudiando.

Daniel, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, sus padres añ ver la gran necesidad y pobreza  no tuvieron otra opción que enseñarle este trabajo, para que tuviera ingresos y pudiera defenderse en la vida.- En temporada  de la cosecha le toca muy duro ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ir a sembrar y luego cuidar el cultivo ya que de eso depende la calidad y los ingresos que tendrá.- El terreno donde tiene la cosecha se encuentra a un kilómetro aproximadamente.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar 5 sacos de abono, veneno para la plaga y también para pagar la mano de obra.

El sueño de Daniel, es que su cultivo sea de calidad para venderlo a buen precio, pagar a tiempo su crédito y preparar académicamente a su hijo para que tenga mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Daniel, 47, is a married farmer.  He studied up to the second grade.  Due to the lack of economic resources, it was impossible for him to continue.  He has one son who is studying.
Daniel has made a living in agriculture since he was very young.  Because of great necessity and poverty, his parents had no other option than to teach him this work so he would have an income and be able to fend for himself in life.  During the growing season, it is very difficult for him since he has to get up very early to go plant and later care for the crop since the quality and the income he will have depends on this.  The land where he has his crops lies approximately one kilometer away.
The loan will be used to buy five sacks of fertilizer, poison for the blight and also to pay the labor.
Daniel's dreams are that his crop be of the quality to sell it for a good price, to pay his loan on time, and to prepare his son academically so he will have greater opportunities for work.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer, poison for the blight and also to pay the labor.

loans.name: Tujijuke Group

texts.fr:
Rodrigue fait parti du groupe Tujijuke et habite à Bujumbura.Il a 30 ans et est marié à Pascaline, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 1 à 4 ans.

Il fait le commerce des habits depuis 4 ans.

Il est à son deuxième crédit à turame , avec   le crédit kiva  qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’ habits à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait être un dirigeant  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rodrigue is part of the group called Tujijuke and lives in Bujumbura. He is 30 years old and married to Pascaline, a small-scale businesswoman. Together they have two children, aged one and four years old. Rodrique has been selling clothing for four years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he will increase his working capital and buy a lot of clothing to resell so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to be a manager and see his children get an education.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy lots of clothing to resell so as to earn more.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, de 72 años de edad, está acompañado, es agricultor, no cursó ningún grado académico, por la falta de recursos económicos, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos están casados y y la tercera vive con ellos; también, vive con ellos una nieta, su pareja tiene un pequeño negocio en el mercado, en donde vende verdura entre estos están : tomates, chiles. Cebolla, pipianes, zanahoria, ejotes, entre otros.

Guadalupe, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, sus padres al ver la gran necesidad y pobreza no tuvieron otra opción que enseñarle este trabajo, para que tuviera ingresos y pudiera defenderse en la vida.- En temporada de la cosecha, le toca muy duro ya que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ir a sembrar y luego cuidar el cultivo ya que de eso depende la calidad y los ingresos que tendrá.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar 4 sacos de abono, veneno para la plaga y también para pagar la mano de obra. 

El sueño de Guadalupe, es que su cultivo sea de calidad para venderlo a buen precio, pagar a tiempo su crédito y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 72 years old and in a relationship and has 3 children. He never attended school for lack of economic resources. Two of his children are married and the third lives with them and a granddaughter lives with them too. His partner has a small business in the market where she sells vegetables like: tomatoes, chile, onion, squash, carrots, corn amongst others.

Guadalupe has worked in agriculture since he was quite small. His parents given their great need and poverty had no choice but to teach him this work so that he could have income and make a living. During growing season it is difficult as he has to get up very early to go and plant and care for the crop. The quality depends on this and also his income.

The loan will be used to buy 4 bags of manure, pest control and to pay for labor. Guadalupe's dream is to have a high quality crop to sell at a good price, pay off the loan on time and get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of manure, pest control and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a lot of shoes to resell so as to earn more.

loans.name: Inmaculada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Inmaculada está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores quieren conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Leónidas, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio de pobreza. Ella tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere seguir esforzándose y creciendo.
La Sra. Leónidas pide de este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, embutidos, panificados y demás para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Inmaculada" association is in the first cycle of the women's committee program. They also belong to the poverty elimination program, which through a 50-indicator survey is aiming to know the living situation of each member.

Leonidas is one of the association members. In the last survey, she was classified as being in level 2, which is the medium poverty level. She has a store which she opens early every day. She is a determined and tenacious woman that wants to continue working hard and growing.

Leonidas is requesting this loan to buy supplies to be able to stock her store. She would like to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, cold cuts, bread and other items for sale, which will help her accomplish her business plan and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, cold cuts, bread and other items for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil soltero. Vive en casa familiar en el caserío de Laynas, en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el caserío se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores como patos, gallinas, cerdos, entre otros.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cerveza, así como muebles para su negocio (sillas y mesas). Con esto Gloria espera mejorar la calidad de su producto y atender a una mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así su nivel de ingresos y con esto su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old, and unmarried.  She lives in her family’s home in the village of Laynas, La Matanza district, Morropón province, Piura region in Peru’s northern coast.  Life in the village unfolds quietly; the inhabitants are mainly engaged in farming, ranching, and breeding small animals such as ducks, chickens, pigs, and others.

Gloria sells beer and “chicha de jora” [corn beer], an activity she has been engaged in for over two years.  She has many good personal and work references in the area.  The purpose of the loan is to purchase a greater amount of beer, as well as furniture (tables and chairs) for her business.  Gloria hopes to improve her product’s quality, and serve a greater number of customers, thus improving her income level and consequently, her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of beer, as well as furniture (tables and chairs) for her business.

loans.name: Luz De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, elaboración de empanadas, venta de estuco, venta de lubricantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frescos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar el amplio mercado de este producto. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de duraznos secos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LUZ DE LOS ANDES” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub. It is formed by eight members and is managed by an executive board in which señora Rosa is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry forward are varied and among them are: neighborhood store, vegetable sales, blanket making, empanada making, plaster sales, and lubricant sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises in which señora Rosa is a member. This is her first time with Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a promoter of the institution that went to visit her in her home. She currently has a business selling natural drinks. She launched this business several years ago by her own initiative after observing the wide market for this product.

The loan she will now take out is to increase the capital (purchase of wholesale dried peaches) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and later she will sell it at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family, since she is married and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the attention the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale dried peaches.

loans.name: Bahagaze Group

texts.fr: Parmis les 3 principales ressources agricoles qui procuraient de l'argent à la population insulaire d'IDJWI,deux ont été détruites par des maladies (banane et manioc), il n'en reste que le café même s'il n'est pas totalement épargné. Ce crédit  permettra à Jean, président du groupe BAHAGAZE, à entretenir sa plantation dans le but d'améliorer sa production et d'assurer finalement la scolarité de ses enfants et leur bonne santé. Il n'est pas resté insensible à l'action de PAIDEK dans son soutien aux paysans à travers le crédit agricole. Sur la photo, Jean porte un bonnet sur sa tête et a une machette à la main.
texts.en:
Among the three principal agricultural resources that bring in money for the isolated population of Idjwi, two have been destroyed by plant diseases: bananas and manioc. Only coffee remains, even though it is not totally spared. 

This loan will allow Jean, the president of the group called Bahagaze, to maintain his plantation so as to improve his production and finally ensure his children's schooling and their good health. He has not failed to notice the work of PAIDEK in supporting farmers through agricultural loans. In the photo, Jean is wearing a knitted cap and holding a machete.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee plantation

loans.name: Jepopyhy Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jepopyhy está integrado por 17 mujeres que están en su ciclo 11 del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, ellas presentan excelente actitud, ya que ponen todo de si para poder ir superándose cada día para dar lo mejor a sus familias.
Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Marina, quien se dedica a la venta de leche por su barrio y otras zonas. Ella comenta que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y que hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela. Todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano para que sus clientes ya tengan su producto para el desayuno.
Sueña con poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo, y es por ello que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar leche y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y no fallarles. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called 'Jepophy' is made up of 17 women, who are in their 11th cycle with the entrepreneurial women's committee program run by Fundación Paraguaya. They demonstrate an excellent attitude, as they do everything in their power to improve day by day, in order to give the best they can to their families.

One person who stands out is Marina, who sells milk in her neighborhood and in other areas. She says that the way opened up little by little, and that now she has a very good customer base. Every day she starts work very early so that her customers will have their product in time for breakfast.

Marina dreams of being able to help her family by means of her work, and this is why she is requesting a loan, to buy milk and in this way be able to fulfill the demand of her customers, instead of failing them. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives to keep on growing.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera. Reside en casa propia con su nieta en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, las actividades principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura, ganadería, comercio y transporte.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, tuberculos, verduras y carne de res y de cerdo, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 6 años, cuenta con clientela fija en la zona y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una congeladora para así poder conservar en mejor estado los productos que ofrece en su tienda. Con esto Marilu espera brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, aumentando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marilu is 45 years old and is a single mother. She resides in her own house with her grandson in the Buenos Aires district, Morropon province, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru. Life in the community is quiet, and the main businesses that flourish there are agriculture, raising livestock, stores, and transportation. 

She makes her living selling groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, vegetables, beef, and pork. Her store is located in her home. She started this business more than 6 years ago, counting on her regular local clientele and good personal and work references. 

This loan will be used to buy a freezer, so she can keep her store's products in better condition. With this, Marilu hopes to provide a better service to her customers, thus increasing her sales and improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to be able to keep her store's products in better condition.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 62 years old, married, and has three children. She is a resident of Poblacion, Sibutad, ZDN, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. In addition to financial assistance, she has been able to generate savings and she enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2012 and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 11,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
“Hardworking mother” best describes Mila, 36 years old and residing in Poblacion Municipality in Sibutad, ZDN, Philippines. Mila has two children and is married to a carpenter. Because her husband’s income wasn’t enough to sustain their family’s daily needs, Mila opened a carenderia, or food stand over a year ago.

Mila wants to expand her business and profits so she makes enough to support her family, especially her children. In order for Mila to do so, she is applying for a 14,900 PHP loan to be used to improve her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and more ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed for her stand.

Mila hopes to send her son to college and live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed for her carenderia.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago vive en una comunidad de Sololá, él tiene 40 años de edad,  vive feliz mente con su familia. 
Para la generación de ingresos  Santiago, se dedica a dos actividades, él cultiva diversidad de verduras, pero otro negocio que él realiza es comprar verduras por cuerda,  según la experiencia de Santiago esta segunda actividad es rentable ya que genera ganancias.
Santiago previo al prestamo al primer prestamo, solo sembraba poco, porque no contaba con suficiente capital de trabajo, ahora su siembra ha incrementado y compra más cuerdas de verduras, para Santiago los préstamos son muy buenos ya que solo así uno puede escalar en la vida y cubrir otras necesidades. 
 Ahora él quiere un nuevo prestamo que lo utilizara, para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos para mantener el cultivo que tiene ahora para que pueda dar una buena cosecha. Y otra parte de este prestamo lo utilizara para  la compra de más  cuerdas de verdura.
texts.en:
Santiago lives in the community of Sololá. He is 40 years old. He lives happily with his family. In order to generate income, Santiago makes a living in two ways. He grows a variety of vegetables, and he also buys vegetables by the acre. In Santiago' experience, this second activity is cost-effective because it generates profit. 

Prior to borrowing his first loan, Santiago only planted a little, because he lacked sufficient working capital. Now his planting has increased, and he has bought more acres of vegetables. The loans are very good for Santiago, because only by this, can one climb in life, and meet other needs

Now he wants a new loan, that will be used, to purchase fertilizer and other supplies, to maintain the crop that he has now, so that he can yield a good harvest. Additionally, the other part of the loan will be used for purchasing more acres of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and acres of vegetables

loans.name: Marilu Del Pilar

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera. Vive en casa propia en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La comunidad es pequeña, los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y a la siembra de arroz.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallos, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas, gelatinas, jugos y otros). El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de gaseosas y productos de belleza, lo que le permitirá aumentar el stock de productos de su tienda y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, logrando un incremento en su nivel de ventas y mejorando sus ingresos, con esto aumentará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marilu is 30 yaers old and single. She lives in her own home in Morropon province, Piura regiona on the northern coast of Peru. The community is small; the inhabitants work raising cattle, growing rice, and business.

She raises small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs and other. In addition, she sells beauty products and beverages (soda pop, gelatins, juices, and other items). The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of soda pop and beauty products, which will enable her to increase the stock of products in her store and meet the likes and needs of her customers, ,thus achieving an increase in her sales level and improving her income, which will result in an increase in her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of soda pop and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to make the products she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela  Las Orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne un grupo mujeres emprendedoras quienes tienen las ganas de salir adelante con la ayuda y el apoyo que la fundación les brinda. 
Doña Carla tiene 21 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos es  consultora de la marca Leudine hace dos años, son productos naturales de belleza como de salud, esto lo realiza todos los días.
El negocio lo empezó hace dos años con la ayuda del Crédito que la Fundación le dio y cada día esta agradecida de lo bueno que es ya que recupera la inversión mas su ganancia.  El Crédito que le fue otorgado es para invertir en más productos que son solicitados por sus clientes a diario, ella les da facilidades de pago.
Le gusta el Grupo, la Organización, la Unión y sobre todo la facilidad que brinda la Fundación.
texts.en:
In the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, a group of enterprising women meet. They share a drive to succeed with the help and support that the Foundation [Fundación ESPOIR] offers them.

Carla is 21 years old, single, and has no children. She has been a consultant for the brand Leudine for two years. Leudine products are natural beauty and health products. She does this every day.

She began the business two years ago with the help of a loan given to her by the Foundation, and she is grateful every day for how good this is, as she is recouping the investment as well as profiting. The loan given to her is to invest in more products that are requested every day by her customers. She gives them payment arrangements.

She likes the group, the organization, the union and above all the opportunity that the Foundation offers her.

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Shown in the picture above, Elizabeth is representing her group comprised of twelve farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is 38 years old, a married mother of five children and is often described as a very experienced farmer.

Although Elizabeth has been a farmer for ten years, she is new to One Acre Fund. She decided to join this year because she wanted to earn more and spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Elizabeth hopes to be able to save more money for the future.

With this 85,960 KES loan, her group will receive farming inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. Five of the farmers in the group (not including Elizabeth) will also be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Santa Ana” está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 17 Señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en un nivel extremo de pobreza.
Maria integra este grupo, ella es una persona muy entusiasta, pone lo mejor de sí para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Maria es también la presidenta de este grupo, y siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras del grupo, por su parte ella vende prendas varias y con ello lucha para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, como ser camisas, pantalones, jeans y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group, called "Santa Ana," is in their second round of a program committed to women, where every member of the group commits to working and helping each other in order to get ahead. They are on a mission to eliminate poverty, and two of the 17 women in the group are below the poverty line (and are said to be at an extreme level of poverty).

Maria is a member of this group; she is a very enthusiastic woman who is doing the best she can to improve her and her family's life. Maria is also the president of the group, and is always trying to motivate her peers. She sells various goods and is always fighting to help her family and loved ones.

She is asking for the loan to be able to buy various goods, such as shirts, pants, jeans, and more; in turn, the group will be able to continue with their sales.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, jeans, and more to sell.

loans.name: Anne Janine

texts.es:
El Grupo se reúne en la Capital de Manabí en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como los reales tamarindos (producto comestible con un saber acido característico de color café).característico de la zona, en la ciudadela llamada las Orquídeas, en casa de una de las socias
La señora Anne tiene 34 años está casada y de este matrimonio tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años,  estudian en la escuela y el colegio; su esposo trabaja en el Consejo  Provincial y la casa que viven es propia.
Doña Anne es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta sabanas y ropa (camisetas, camisas, ropa de dormir, etc.) Vende en su casa los siete días de la semana. Las ventas de las sabanas y ropa la inicio con su primer crédito que le dio la Fundación Espoir hace cinco años  en el banquito Comunal; el crédito que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería y ampliar la variedad.
Le gusta la organización del grupo y la facilidad que brinda la Fundación para dar los créditos y lo más importante estar con su familia unida.
texts.en:
The Group meets in the capital city of Manabí, Portoviejo, which is known as "los reales tamarindos" (the royal tamarinds) (tamarind is an edible local product which is the same colour as coffee and has an acidic taste). The Group meets in the residential area called "las Orquídeas" in the house of one the its members. 

Anne is 34 years old and is married. She and her husband have 2 children of 14 and 11 years old who both go to school. Her husband works for the Provincial Council and they have their own home.  

Anne is a housewife that also works selling sheets and clothing (t-shirts, shirts, pyjamas). She does this in order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses. She sells from her home seven days a week. She started selling sheets and clothing using the first loan that she was given five years ago through the small Communal Bank by the Fundación Espoir. The loan that she is asking for is to increase her stock and its variety. 

She likes the group's set-up and the ease at which the Fundación provides loans. Most importantly, she likes being together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and sheets.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Narciso es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, tiene experiencia en este rubro y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
24-year-old Narciso lives in his own home made of rustic materials with his wife and children in a rural area in the district of Pomahuaca, located in the province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, in Peru's northern highlands. This district's population mainly works in agriculture, cattle-raising and commerce.

Naciso works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has experience in this activity and has good personal and work references in the region. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for the adequate maintenance of his crops, as well as to hire laborers during the harvest. This will help him improve his crops' physiology, morphology and productivity, and to have a timely harvest, which will lead to increased production, a higher income level and will improve his life quality and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to take care of his crops, as well as to pay for laborers during the harvest.

loans.name: Cañaveral De Villa Dolores Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAÑAVERAL DE VILLA DOLORES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rafaela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de arroz, venta de aceite, venta de comidas, venta de verduras, venta de fideo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rafaela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de arroz por mayor; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar el amplio mercado de este producto decide emprenderlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Cañaveral de Villa Dolores” begins its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The association is comprised of eight members and is managed by a board of directors where Rafaela is president.  The members of the association are engaged in varied businesses such as a neighborhood store, and selling rice, oil, food, vegetables, and noodles.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small business women where Rafaela is a member.  She says that she recently joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a member if the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling wholesale rice, and relates that she started this business through her own initiative several years ago.  Noting the market growth of this product, she decided to establish her business.

The loan that she is taking out now is for capital growth (the purchase of wholesale rice), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in La Paz, and later sell at her sales stand.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale rice.

loans.name: Vilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Vilma de 60 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos independientes y con hogar propio, vive únicamente  con su esposo y nadie depende de ella. Es docente y tiene más de 20 años trabajando con estudiantes de educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad, también es comerciante y vende productos cosméticos de revista para jóvenes.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar cosméticos y ropa para aprovechar los últimos días del mes para hacer negocio. Vilma piensa al jubilarse hacer de su casa un pequeño almacén donde venda de estos productos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 60, is married and has two children who live independently in their own homes. She lives just with her husband and no dependents. She is a teacher and has worked for more than 20 years with primary school students in the community. She is also a shopkeeper and sells children's cosmetics from a magazine. 

She asks for this loan to buy cosmetics and clothing to take advantage of the last days of the month to do business. Vilma plans to retire and to make her home a small store where she can sell these products.

loans.use: to buy makeup and clothing.

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela las orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen el grupo que tiene el mismo nombre Las Orquídeas, en casa de una de las socias quienes se reúnen cada quince días. 
La Señora Carmen  tiene 53 años es ama de casa y mantiene unión libre, su pareja es Chofer, de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive en su casa que es propia.
Hace siete años tiene su negocio de venta de agua y gas, la venta la realiza a  domicilio, da trabajo a tres personas más, su negocio funciona de lunes a sábado y este está ubicado en su domicilio. El crédito que está solicitando es para invertir en más agua y gas para ampliar su mercado de ventas y llegar a otros lugares.
Ella tiene su negocio desde hace 10 años con el apoyo económico de la Fundación a través de los créditos de banca Comunal.
texts.en:
In the "Orchids" neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo meets a group that has the same name "Las Orquídeas" ["The Orchids"].  They meet in the home of one of the members every 15 days.

Carmen is 53 years old. She is a housekeeper and lives with her partner, a chauffeur, in their own home. They have 4 grown children. She has been selling water and gas for seven years. The sale is done at her home and she employs three others. Her business operates from her home Monday to Saturday.

This loan is to invest in more water and gas to increase her sales market and reach other places. She has had her business for 10 years with the financial support of the loans through the community bank.

loans.use: to buy water and gas.

loans.name: Inés Domitila

texts.es:
En la ciudadela las Orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen un  grupo de mujeres de empuje, constructoras de mejores días para su familia y el propio. Lugar de clima cálido y de gente amable, expertos en gastronomía. 
Aquí vive la señora Inés, tiene de 63 años, es viuda  desde hace ocho años y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive con una hija que tiene casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas (anillos, pulseras, cadenas, etc.) y productos naturales por catálogo, lo realiza en compañía de una sobrina recorriendo dos días a la semana por cinco horas diarias.  El crédito otorgado lo utilizara en compra de mercadería por temporada de navidad, espera tener buena acogida en dicha venta y así salir adelante y seguir siendo productiva.
Bendice cada día a la fundación por la oportunidad que tiene ella y sus compañeras del grupo comunal ya que desde hace ocho años recibe los créditos con la Fundación, le gusta todo lo que realiza la fundación (charlas educativas, etc.)
texts.en:
In the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, a group of forceful, active women meet. They are builders of better days for their families and themselves. A place of warm climate and friendly people, experts in gastronomy. 

Ines lives here. She is 63 years old, was widowed eight years ago, and has four adult children. She lives with one of her daughters who has her own house. Ines sells jewelry (rings, bracelets, chains, etc.) and natural products by catalog. She does this together with a cousin, making a route two days a week over five hours a day. She will use the loan that she has been given to buy merchandise for the Christmas season. She hopes to have a good reception of those sales, and so to continue moving forward and being productive.

Every day she blesses the foundation [Fundación ESPOIR] for the opportunity that she and her fellow group members have, since she has been receiving loans from the Foundation for eight years. She likes all the things that the foundation does (educational talks, etc.)

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, necklace chains, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products in bulk that are repackaged in individual packets, then sold at retail.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN CHANCA,la  socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, la socia continua vendiendo la ropa a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares, entre otros, la socia es una persona  responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en: Maribel is a member of the communal bank VIRGEN CHANCA. She still has her business of selling clothing and is very grateful of investors for the loan and she is happy to receive their support. Maribel sells clothing to her clients who are friends and relatives among others. She is a responsible and diligent person, and because of this, she has been able to provide for her family. The member is asking for a loan to purchase sweaters and other items.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and other items.

loans.name: Elsita Briselda

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela las Orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen mujeres luchadoras con ganas de salir adelante, emprendedoras llenas de virtudes, a la hora de ayudar a su familia a tener  calidad de vida.
La señora  Elsita tiene 56 años, está separada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive con una hija que es casada y tiene casa propia quien la acoge ya que tiene casa propia.
Doña Elsita se dedica a la venta de encebollados los días sábados y domingos desde hace 10 años y es ayudada por su hija, se siente afortunada de contar con su ayuda cada día y le da gracias por contar con la ayuda que obtiene de la Fundación.
El crédito que recibió es para invertir en su negocio ya que cada fin de semana tiene mayor demanda de encebollados y necesita mesas, sillas, platos, cucharas, etc.
Elsita tiene en la Fundación 15 años solicitando los Créditos que le han hecho la vida feliz junto a su familia.
texts.en:
In the Orquideas citadel within the city of Portoviejo, many hardworking women meet with the aim to get ahead; they are entrepreneurs that are full of virtue when it comes to helping their family obtain a better quality of life.

Elsita is 56 years old; she is separated and has four grown children. She lives with one of her daughters, who is married and has her own home (yet accepts and welcomes her mother in it).

Elsita makes a living selling fish stew on Saturdays and Sundays. She has done this for the past ten years and is helped by her daughter. She feels fortunate to count on her help each day, and also gives thanks for those who fund and donate to "la Fundacion" (Kiva's partner).

The loan she is requesting will be used to invest in her business; each week, the demand for her fish stew is growing and she needs more tables, chairs, plates, spoons, etc.

Elsita has 15 years of getting loans from "la Fundacion," and they have greatly increased her (and her family's) happiness.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, plates, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Celina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo la capital de los Manabitas quienes son luchadores y emprendedores, se  ha extendido la venta y compra de mercadería de todo tipo por temporadas  (carnavales, semana santa, escolares, navideñas, etc.)  Los créditos son los mejores amigos de los comerciantes y amas de casa que se han unido a la lucha para salir adelante con su familia.
La señora Esperanza tiene  de 72 años, casada y con 3 hijos mayores de edad, el  esposo no trabaja ya que se encuentra jubilado, ella tiene casa propia.
Doña Esperanza se dedica a vender en su tienda, vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, pollo, etc.  la cual está ubicada en su casa desde hace doce años, trabaja todos los días siete días a la semana. El dinero que solicito es para incrementar productos de consumo para la venta.
La señora Esperanza hace los créditos desde hace doce (12) años y le gusta la unión del grupo y la facilidad para acceder a los créditos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi and of its tenacious and enterprising people, buying and selling of merchandise for all types of special seasons (Carnaval, Holy Week, school season, Christmas, etc) has become widespread. Loans are the best friend of these salespeople and housewives who have come together in the common fight to succeed and bring their families with them. 

Esperanza is 72 years old, married, and has three adult children. Her husband no longer works as he is retired. She owns her house. Esperanza's job is selling out of her store: she sells rice, sugar, oil, meat, chicken, etc. The store has been located in her house for the past 12 years, and she works every day, seven days a week.  

The money she is requesting is to buy more food products to sell. Esperanza has been doing these loans for the past 12 years, and she likes the union of the group and the ease of accessing the loans.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Rosa Dinora

texts.es:
Rosa de 28 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es comerciante y tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal en el que venden frutas y verduras, su esposo es agricultor y le apoya en los tiempos libres. Desde muy joven Rosa trabajó en el mercado aprendió a ser comerciente y vio los buenos resultados que daba el negocio. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio, comprando  frutas de temporada y verduras que más le demandan aprovechando los últimos días de diciembre que que son los días que mejor se vende este producto. Rosa tiene pensado ampliar su puesto de venta, la vendedora de al lado saldrá de viaje y venderá su puesto y rosa quiere tener listo el dinero para ser ella quien lo compre.
texts.en:
Rosa is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a merchant, and she has a stand at the town market where she sells fruits and vegetables. Her husband is a farmer, and he helps her when he has free time. Rosa started working at the market at a very young age. She learned how to be a merchant, and she saw the great results of this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables that are in high demand, taking advantage of the last days of December, which are the days when these products are sold best. Rosa plans to expand her stand. The merchant next to her is going to travel and will sell her stand. Rosa wishes to have the money ready to buy this stand.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables that are in high demand.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor de 21 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos, es agricultor y tiene 10 años de experiencia produciendo granos básicos obteniendo siempre muy buenos resultados. Actualmente vive con sus padres y sus hermanas, pero nadie depende de él.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 terneros de repasto que piensa engordar y luego vender para sacar algo de ganancia. Victor piensa que trabajando con mucho esfuerzo logrará algún día construir su propia casa, pero espera contar con el apoyo de CrediCampo.
texts.en: Victor, 21, is single and has no children.  He is a farmer with ten years’ experience producing basic grains, and always obtains good results.  Currently, he lives with his parents and sisters, but no one depends on him.  He is requesting the loan to purchase two grazing calves, which he plans to fatten and sell later to make some profit.  Victor believes that he will manage to build his own home by working very hard, but hopes to count on the support of Credicampo.

loans.use: to purchase two grazing calves.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including ebony wood, and to bring on more carvers at his workshop. Bright has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: I am a wood carver who is objective and respectful. I started to learn the skill of carving at age 12 when I’d go to visit my father at his workshop when I returned from school. I observed closely what he and his team made and, I must admit, I was surprised at how they could turn wood into such beautiful items. I developed an interest in knowing more and was willing to learn how I could try my hand at it. I was a business student in senior high school but upon completion, my father could not further my education due to financial reasons. I worked with my father at his workshop for about three years. During this period, I was allowed to sell the items I could craft and this offered me the opportunity to buy my own tools to be able to set up on my own. I finally got a place of my own in a location where lots of people come to purchase hand-carved items. I did very well at this market through the sale of my work, which afforded me the opportunity to further my education, and also assist my younger siblings through school. Through this craft I have been able to build a shelter for my family. I have also had the opportunity to train several students who study art in school and want to improve their skills. My inspiration comes from my wife, children, and friends. My hopes, plans, and dreams for the future are to build an art and crafts college where interested youths can be trained to improve their standard of living in the country. I thank you for this opportunity. It will go a long way toward helping me craft more sculptures and increase my inventory. Use the link below to view Bright's hand-carved sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8759

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including ebony wood, and to bring on more carvers at his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her smallholder farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and medicine for his chickens.

loans.name: Maricarmen Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maricarmen del Pilar tiene 18 años, vive con su hermano en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Maricarmen se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, desde hace más de 03 años. Cuenta con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como pavos, patos, gallinas, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Maricarmen del Pilar espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maricarmen del Pilar is 18 years old. She lives with her brother in a house that she owns in the Cayaltí district, located in the Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. She lives in a community where the main employment is in trade, agriculture, and livestock.

Maricarmen has made a living by raising and selling small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc. for more than 3 years. She has regular customers in the area who provide very good personal and work references for her.

The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals such as turkeys, ducks, hens, chickens, etc. as well as to buy balanced feed for the fattening of these. With this, Maricarmen del Pilar hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her clients, satisfying their tastes and preferences, which will have a big impact on her income level and will enhance her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals such as turkeys, ducks, hens, chickens, among others, as well as to purchase balanced feed for these

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 38 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Everlyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011.
