This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Everlyne also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during the dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Everlyne's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, beans, boxes of soap, salt,and flour. Her major challenge include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van to transport her merchandise. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, beans, boxes of soap and salt

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN CHANCA,la socia continua  dedicándose a la  elaboración de pan , la socia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, la socia continua elaborando pan para todos sus clientes que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Chanca.” She continues dedicating herself to making bread. She is thanks to the lenders for the loan, and she feels happy with the support offered. She continues making bread for all of her clients, and she feels that in this way, she takes her family forward.

She requests the loan to buy flour and sugar, among other items.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Máximo de 55 años de edad esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. Su pareja es ama de casa y cría gallinas y pollo de engorde. Solo  su pareja y sus tres hijos viven con él.

Máximo es agricultor y albañil, la agricultura la aprendió desde pequeño trabajando con su padre y la albañilería aprendió primero trabajando como ayudante y luego de 5 años puso en práctica su conocimiento. Hoy en día quiere dedicarse a la ganadería pues ve en esta una forma de diversificar sus ingresos.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera que le venden, considera que es poco pero es una buena manera de iniciar. Espera le resulte la inversión pues solo piensa en dar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Máximo is 55 years old, has a partner, and has three children who are in school in his community. His partner is a housewife and raises hens and meat chickens. Only his partner and three children live with him. Maximo is a farmer and bricklayer. He learned farming as a small boy working with his father and bricklaying first as a helper and then 5 years as a laborer putting his knowledge into practice.

Today he wants to work in cattle as he sees this as a way to diversify his income. He seeks a loan to buy a milk cow, he considers that is is little but it is a good way to start. He hopes the investment results in being able to give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Veverly

texts.en:
Veverly is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Veverly dreams of having a bigger grocery store someday. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, who is 54, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Married to John Roger, a mason, she is a mother to her five children of whom four are already working while one is still in high school. She, together with her husband, manage their own household. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household expenses and the school needs of her child.

Myrna makes and sells "bagoong" (anchovies), a condiment made of completely fermented fish or shrimps. Filipinos love to eat their simple dishes like their vegetable salad and saucy meat with "bagoong" to make it more flavourful. She is shown in her photo with her bottles of "bagoong" for sale.  She also buys and sells fruits and biscuits for additional income. She sells them per order and on demand on special occasions and holidays. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, Myrna would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 which she will use to buy tiny fish and shrimps to make "bagoong", and to buy some biscuits and fruits from a wholesaler, which she will sell at retail. She is positive for a good turnout to her business and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be extended to her. She is wishing everyone a Blessed New Year!

Myrna aims to grow her business and dreams for a better life for her family. She wants her child to earn a college degree. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients to cook "bagoong" (anchovies), and to pay for biscuits and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of ten farmers in Webuye District. She is 47 years old, married, and has seven children.

Ruth likes to think of herself as a very hard-working individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learned a lot from farming training. Ruth plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Ruth’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nhóm 31-Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hung, a 55-year-old married mother of three children still in school, works in agricultural production, earning a monthly income of about VND 780,000.  She has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1994. Her husband is over 60 years old and weak. 

Hung's family, which experiences economic hardship, doesn't yet have a sanitary latrine. With this loan, Hung will build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health of her family and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community.

In the photo, Hung is pictured first on the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a sanitary latrine with a device for hand-washing with soap

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak is 18 years old, single and is a university freshman who is pursuing an associate’s degree in hotel and tourism in the city. Vannak is from Kandal province in Cambodia. Her father works in a company and her mother earns income from cultivating rice, corn, beans and fattening animals. Due to a lack of financial support to pay her two-year university fees, Vannak has decided to take out a loan. With the loan, she will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully with skills for her future job. In the future, she is going to find a job and pursue a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay her two-year university fees

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 45 años de edad, es casado. Tiene un hogar estable, vive con su cónyuge y tres hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña y se dedica basicamente a la agricultura y a la actividad pecuaria.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimor, con 3 años de experiencia en el sector. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, entre otros. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Con esto Rogelio espera tener una mejor producción de su cultivo, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende tendrá mayores ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 45 years old and married. He has a stable home. He lives with his partner and has three children. He owns his house, which is made of rustic material, and is located in the Santo Tomás district, in the province of Cutervo, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. His community is small and he dedicates his time to agriculture and livestock.

He cultivates a variety of coffee called catimor. He has 3 years of experience in this sector. Additionally, he raises bovine cattle and small animals, like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs, among others.

He has very good personal and work references in his area. The loan will be destined to buy manure and fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee crops. With this loan, Rogelio hopes to improve production of his crop, which will be seen in any increase in volume of sales and an increase in income, which will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Eduardo Benjamin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela las Orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital costera productora de leche, verduras y frutas (tomate, sandia, melón, pimiento, etc.), productos del mar (pescado, camarones, etc.) de clima cálido seco.
En este lugar vive don Eduardo, tiene  61 años, es casado con 5 hijos mayores de edad, la esposa trabaja tiene una peluquería, tiene casa propia.
El señor Eduardo siembra productos de ciclo corto (maíz) desde hace siete años, el inicio el negocio de siembra  y comercialización con los créditos desde hace siete años, trabaja solo todos los días durante cuatro horas al día.
El crédito es para hacer la limpieza del terreno y  comprar semillas de maíz.
texts.en:
The citadel of Las Orquídeas in the city of Portoviejo is the coastal capital for production of milk, vegetables, and fruits (tomatoes, watermelon, peppers, etc.) and of seafood (fish, shrimp, etc.) because of its warm, dry climate.

Eduardo lives in this place. He is 61 years old and is married with 5 adult children. His wife works in a hair salon, and they have their own house. Mr. Eduardo has grown products with short growing cycles, like corn, for seven years. He started the business of growing and selling crops with loans seven years ago. He works alone everyday for four hours each day.

The loan will allow him to clean the land and buy corn seeds.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and clean the land.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is a 30-year-old married woman with three children from Dulag, Leyte. Her oldest child is eleven and the youngest is three. 

Olive operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like canned goods, eggs, vinegar, chips, soap powder, soy sauce and beverages. She has been running this store for more than five years already. To augment her income, she also raises and sells hogs. Her husband earns a living by being a labourer.

Olive is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries and to purchase pig feed. These stocks will fill her store and could attract more buyers. These will also improve her hog-raising business. She could now raise and sell more pigs in the coming few months.

Olive would like to expand both of her businesses to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries and to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stones

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 47-year-old married mother of six children, ages 4 to 17. All of them go to school. She has farmed for 28 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Dorrice's Group

texts.en: Dorrice leads a loan group with ten members who live in the Kakamega South District in Kenya. She is married, the mother of two children, and is known in her community as very hardworking. Initially, she joined the One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Since joining the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot in farm trainings. With the profits she earns in the coming harvesting season, Dorrice plans to send her children to school. Among the ten farmers in this group, a total of 6.25 acres of land will be planted using maize seeds and fertilizer paid for with the loan. Additionally, farmers in the group will purchase two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Nanci Mariela

texts.es:
Nanci tiene 43 años de edad, es casada. Vive con su cónyuge en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado porcino y aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. Además su cónyuge se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi, contando así con ingresos adicionales que permiten solventar la deuda sin ningun problema. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos y pavos para su negocio. Con esto Nanci espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio, ofreciendo un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes y satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades. Esto tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nanci, 43, is married. She lives with her husband in their own home made of rustic materials in the rural district of Pucará, Jaén district, Cajamarca region, in northern mountains of Peru. The district’s population primarily makes a living in agriculture, cattle ranching, and business.

She makes a living raising and selling pork and poultry such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and other animals. In addition, her husband works by providing transportation services in his mototaxi. They count on this additional income to pay off debt without problems. This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of animals such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys for her business. With this loan, Nanci hopes to improve her business’s productivity, offering a better quality product to her customers and satisfying their preferences and needs. This will have a great impact on her income level and will allow her to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys for her business.

loans.name: Judith Jiovanna

texts.es:
Judith tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera. Vive en casa propia en el sector de Santa Rosa, distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es muy tranquila y armoniosa, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza como perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales, entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como perfumes, talcos, cremas corporales y ropa para su negocio. Con esto Judith espera aumentar el stock de productos de su tienda para poder satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old and single. She lives in her own home in Santa Rosa sector, Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Life n the community is very tranquil and harmonious. The inhabitants work in business, agriculture, and cattle.

She sells clothing and beauty products such as perfume, talcum powder, body cream and other items. Her business is located in her home. She has more than 3 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of products such as perfumes, talcum powder, body creams, and clothing for her business. With this, Judith hopes to increase her stock of products in her store in order to be able to satisfy the likes and needs of her customers. This will have a positive impact on her level of income and subsequently on her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of products such as perfumes, talcum powder, body creams, and clothing for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 50 años, es madre soltera. Vive en casa propia con su madre e hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Elena se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero (vacas) y a la venta de leche fresca, con más de 04 años de experiencia en el sector. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de alimento balaceado para el engorde de sus animales, con esto Elena espera mejorar la producción de leche de su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo cual tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elena, 50, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, in the region Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and animal husbandry.

Elena breeds milk cattle (cows) and sells fresh milk. She has more than four years in this sector. She has very good personal and work references in her area. The loan is destined to buy balanced cattle feed to fatten up her animals. With this loan, Elena hopes to improve the milk production of her business and satisfy her clients' needs, which will have a big impact on her level of income and will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy balanced feed for the fattening of her animals.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Ventura de 68 años de edad está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda en la venta de los productos. Ventura es agricultor de granos básicos y productor de frutos especialmente guineo majoncho y papaya, sus hijos le ayudan en la siembra y mantenimiento de la parcela.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y plaguicida para dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de frutas para asegurar una buena producción. Tiene pensado seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y ver de qué manera ofrece otro producto.
texts.en:
Ventura is 68 years old, married, and has 2 children. His spouse is a housewife and helps him sell products. Ventura is a farmer who grows basic grains and fruits, especially banana and papaya. His children help him with the planting and maintenance of his land.

He seeks a loan to buy fertilizers and insecticide in order to do maintenance on his fruit crop in order to ensure a good production. He plans to continue working doing what he enjoys and seeing how he can explore another product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en: Magreth, who is in her mid-30s, is a divorcee with four children who are still in school.  She has been a food vendor for the last ten years and works from 6am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Magreth's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more items to sell and has paid back all these loans successfully.  She is happy with the help she is receiving and appreciates the support Kiva provides to her group. Magreth has used her profits to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock her store. She dreams of owning a hotel someday. She will share this loan with her loan group Jitegemee, which has a total of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her food store.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis,and she has been in this business for the last 10 years. She gets additional income from selling charcoal, also at the market. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, and flour. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build her own house. She currently lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice, bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married, with four children. She is 47 years old and lives in La Union, La Libertad, ZDN. 

Rebecca plants corn and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase three sacks of fertilizer and melon and squash seedlings. 

Rebecca has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more melon and squash.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and melon and squash seedlings.

loans.name: Niño Salvador Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Niño Salvador forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Adelaida, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con una pobreza extrema, ella es una mujer que quiere superarse e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Adelaida  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de detergentes, lavandinas, suavizante de ropa, envases para cargar, y otros, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Niño Salvador is taking part in a program to eliminate poverty.  All the members are participating in a poverty elimination survey to be able to improve they and their family's living conditions.  One of the members is Adelaida, who scored within a poverty level of one the last time she took the survey, that is to say, a level of extreme poverty.  She is a woman who wants to better herself and improve her quality of life.  She sells cleaning products for a living, which gives her the means to help her family.  

Adelaida is requesting this loan to buy detergent, bleach, fabric softener, containers to fill and other items.  This will help her solidify her business plan, which will help her increase her income in turn.

loans.use: buy detergent, bleach, fabric softener, containers to fill and other items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood and corn to continue working with her business.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.

Doreen makes chips, beef, and chicken at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT– SACCO to buy a bag of irish potatoes, cooking oil, spices, beef and charcoal. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to get a better stall so as to improve on her sales. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bag of irish potatoes, cooking oil, spices, beef and charcoal.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace engages in a food-vending business. She makes and sells 'taho' - a favorite Filipino delicacy and a street food sold by traveling vendors. She also sells 'balot' - a developing duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell. She is a 24-year-old, single woman, living in the town of Dulag, Leyte.

Grace is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients, like sweet soy beans and balot. These will help her sell more taho and balot. With these items, she could earn more money and be able to settle her obligations.

In the future, Grace would like to expand her business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, like sweet soy beans and balot.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and a pig fattening business. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a shop and complete what she aspires to.

loans.name: Nashwan

texts.en: Nashwan used his first loan, which he is still paying back, to buy spare parts he needed to repair his bus. He thanks Kiva's lenders warmly for their support, and is requesting a second, concurrent loan for 200,000 YER to buy more spare parts because his bus needs additional repairs. Nashwan hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his bus.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en: Pha is 38 years old, and a mother of three dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she grows rice and weaves cotton scarves. She can earn additional income via working for others for a fee. This is the first loan for Pha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of a group of three who are getting a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and thread. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family's condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and thread.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Amigas De Pro Mujer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE PRO MUJER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de lubricantes, venta de polleras, venta de verduras, venta de mantas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de lubricantes; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia, conociendo el negocio por su hermano al que ayudo durante varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lubricantes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la atención del área de salud, que ofrece la institución, es rápida.
texts.en:
The "AMIGAS DE PRO MUJER" communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional hub. The group is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Miriam serves as a chairwoman.

The members of the communal bank run various businesses, which include selling food, selling lubricants, selling skirts, selling vegetables, selling blankets, and running a neighbourhood store.

The loan that the group will take out will benefit the owners of small microbusinesses, including Miriam. She says that it is the first time that she is working with Pro Mujer and that she became a member at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she runs a business selling lubricants. She mentions that she started this business on her own initiative many years ago and that she learned the business from her brother, whom she helped for many years.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her working capital by purchasing lubricants wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors from the city of La Paz. Then, she will sell the products at her store. This line of work allows her to generate the means to support her family financially as she is still married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the quick healthcare services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy lubricants wholesale.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 52 years old and does construction business in Kapsabet town. His business has been profitable, and he supplements his income by working as a dairy farmer. He used his previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to pay school fees for his children. He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow, and will use the income he expcts to earn to pay his children's school fees. This is his sixth loan term from VisionFund Kenya. He repaid previous ones successfully. His future hopes are to expand his business, make more income and support his children by paying for their education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jose Romulo

texts.es:
Jose Romulo tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas). Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado (vacas) para aumentar su negocio, con esto Jose Romulo espera hacer crecer su negocio lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Romulo is 51 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Querocotillo, located in Cultervo Province, in the Catamarca area in the northern mountains of Peru.

He is dedicated to raising and selling cattle (cows). He has experience in the business and has regular customers who provide very good personal and work references for him. He will use the loan to buy a greater number of cattle (cows) to increase his business which Jose Romulo hopes will make his business grow and generate more income. Therefore he will increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of cattle (cows) to increase his business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Esta inversión lo ayudará en la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna, por ende tendrá mayor producción y mejorará su nivel de ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 58 years old and he lives in his own rustic home with  his wife and his 3 children in the district of Pucara, located in the province of Jaen, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern sierras of Peru.  The population of this district works mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and in commerce.

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee.  He has 15 years of experience in this field. He has many very good personal and work references from the area.

The loan that will be granted to him will be used for the purchase of manure and fertilizers to maintain the coffee crop as well as to hire labour at harvest time. 

This investment will help so much in the improvement of his crop's physiology, morphology and productiveness as well as to also have a timely harvest.  Therefore, there will be greater production and it will improve his income level which will permit him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop as well as to hire labour during the harvest

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Prey Veng province and a mother of two children, Non is 48 years old. She grows rice as a single source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement income.

This is Non's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sreytoch's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Sreytoch is 29 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. To support her family, she earns an income by growing rice and cassava. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 38,900 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seeds for her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family and support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Los Anturios Group

texts.es:
Los Anturios es el nombre del grupo ubicado en una comunidad de clima fresco donde se cosecha caña de azúcar, árboles de hule, café y naranjas. Resulta sorprendente ver la cantidad de naranjas que hay en el lugar y que no se venden debido a que casi todas las familias tienen hasta cinco árboles de este fruto. 

El nombre del grupo se debe a la cantidad de anturios (plantas) de diferentes colores en la casa de los padres de uno de los integrantes:

Rafael –Tortillas 
Isabel-Abarrotes
Elia –Ropa Americana
Alma –Pollos Asados, Refrescos
Policarpo -Pan
Irma –Servicio De Costura
Guillermo -Pan

Doña Alma es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada con el señor Tomás, tienen 9 nietos de los cuales dos viven con ellos. Desde hace algunos años Alma se ha dedicado a la venta de carne de pollo, pollos asados y refrescos. Para preparar los pollos asados a la leña, Alma se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana pues los clientes comienzan a comprar a las 7 en punto. "Decidí vender pollo asado pues en una fiesta en casa ese fue el plato fuerte, los invitados me dijeron que debería dedicarme a venderlos al menos en fines de semana". 

La cena de navidad y fin de año serán días clave para doña Alma quien tiene de encargo 40 pollos asados a la leña, los cuales acompaña con arroz, salsa y ensalada, para ello ha solicitado el préstamo a VisionFund para invertirlo en la compra de 30 pollos, arroz, chiles y platos desechables (térmicos) para entregar en tiempo y forma sus pedidos. 

Ella se visualiza en un asadero donde no solo venda pollos asados, sino con diferentes salsas como chipotle, adobo, a la crema. Alma piensa que con sus ganancias, su esfuerzo y el apoyo de otros préstamos quizá en un año pueda hacer su sueño posible. 

“Gracias a las personas que nos ayudan con el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de la mercancía necesaria para nuestras actividades”

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Elia, en la foto se observa un anturio. Doña Alma viste blusa café oscuro, chaleco beige.
texts.en:
Los Anturios is the name of the group located in a community that has a fresh climate where cane sugar, rubber trees, coffee and oranges are cultivated. It's surprising to see how many oranges in this area don't sell because almost all families have up to five orange trees.

The name of this group comes from the fact that the number of anturios (plants) of different colors in the house of one of the group's members.

Rafael – Tortillas

Isabel – Hardware

Elia – American clothing

Alma – Roasted chicken, refreshments

Policarpo – Bread

Irma – Sewing service

Guillermo – Bread

Alma is a hard-working woman, who is married to Tomas and they have nine grandchildren of whom two live with them. For a few years, Alma has been selling chicken meat, roasted chicken and refreshments. To prepare the roasted chicken, Alma wakes up at 5:00am as her clients come to buy from her at 7:00am on the dot. "I decided to sell roasted chicken when I hosted a party, where it was served as the main course. The guests told me that I should sell chicken, at least on the weekends."

Christmas dinner and New Year's are key dates for Alma, who has orders for 30 roasted chickens with rice, salsa and salad. For this, she has requested a loan from VisionFund to invest in 30 chickens, rice, chilies and disposable plates (thermal) so she can fulfill her orders properly and on time.

She visualizes a restaurant where she not only sells roasted chicken, but also different sauces, like chipotle, adobo (chile, vinegar, herbs and spices) and cream. Alma thinks that with her income, her efforts and the support of other loans, in one year she may be able to make her dream come true.

"Thank you to the people who help us with a loan so we can invest in the merchandise we need for our activities!"

*The photograph was taken at the home of Elia. In the photo you can observe the anturio (plant). Alma is dressed in a dark brown shirt and a beige vest.

loans.use: buy 30 chickens, rice, chilies and disposable plates (thermal).

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Valientes está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde seis señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con una pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Miriam es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, y por medio de este trabajo lucha día a día a poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, como también poder ir superando su situación de pobreza extrema.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de variedad y más cantidad de prendas para la venta de las mismas, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Valientes group is in its third cycle of the of the Women’s Committee program where everyone works and helps to get ahead. They are doing the survey in the Poverty Stoplight program where six of the women are below the poverty level, that is to say extreme poverty.

Miriam is one of the members of this group. She sells various garments and through her work fights day to day to give her family everything she could not have and also to be able to overcome her situation of extreme poverty.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy a quantity and variety of clothing to sell which will help her firm up her business plan which will help her increase her income. They are grateful for the opportunity they receive to be able to continue growing and improving their lives and those of their loved ones.

loans.use: to buy various garments to sell

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella está casada, y tiene 4 hijos, es una mujer muy trabajadora que cada día lucha por poder ir mejorando.
Ella se dedica a las ventas, vende ropas de todos tipos y joyas varias, cabe destacar que tiene ya su clientela formada por los años de dedicación, ella es muy sacrificada y luchadora y quiere seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas de temporada, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ramona is from the city of Encarnacion. She is married with four children. She is a hardworking woman who struggles everyday to keep improving.

She works in sales. She sells all types of clothing and various jewelry. It is noteworthy that she has a client base due to her years of dedication. She is very self-sacrificing and a fighter that wants to continue growing.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy seasonal clothing so she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is single, with two children. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). 

Sarah has a business, selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 (shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy a bale of used clothes.  

Sarah works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her goal is to obtain a permanent business place. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Expedito esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir se encuentra en un nivel de pobreza extrema.
Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras, lucha por poder salir adelante e ir mejorando su situación de pobreza para dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudo tener y que no pasen por necesidades como las que tuvo que pasar.
La Sra. Lidia pide este préstamo para la compra de Verduras, Frutas y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y mas venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group San Expedito is making an investigation into the elimination of poverty.  They are very hard-working women who wish to move forward in life.  One of the members is Lidia, who in her last survey showed a level of poverty within “level one,” which is to say that she is in extreme poverty.
 
Through her continual work and efforts and through the sale of fruits and vegetables she strives to be able to get ahead and to be improving her situation of poverty in order to give to her loved ones all that she could not have and so that they do not go without necessities like those that she had to do without.

Lidia is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, fruits and other things which will help her to obtain more output and more sales which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francisca Guadalupe

texts.es:
Francisca de 27 años de edad está acompañada tiene dos hijos y está esperando el tercero. Francisca es comerciante y desde muy pequeña su madre le enseñó a trabajar para ganarse la vida, juntas salían a vender ropa a las comunidades vecinas, con el tiempo se hiso de sus clientes a tal grade que ahora que está embarazada y no puede hacer esa ruta de venta su clientes llegan a comprarle a su casa.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de diversas tallas y estilos para vender en la temporada, ya que es la época que las personas buscan estrenar ropa. Francisca espera seguir trabajando pues sus hijos crecen y tienen que ir a estudiar y espera darles el estudio con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisca, 27, is in a relationship.  She has two children and is expecting the third.

Francisca's a merchant, and her mother taught her how to earn a living for herself at a very young age.  They would go out together tho sell clothing in the neighboring communities.  In time she attracted customers to the extent that, now that she's pregnant and she can't do the route, her customers go to her at home.

She's requesting the loan to buy a variety of sizes and styles of clothing to sell during the season, because it's the time of year when people wear clothing for the first time.

Francisca hopes to keep on working because her children are growing and they have to go to school.  She hopes to provide for their education with her job.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sizes and styles of clothing to sell during the season

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mística se formo en la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas, todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, y luchan por ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Lilia es parte de este grupo, quien en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza ha mostrado que ha mejorado bastante, todo esto gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo, ella tiene una despensa bien variada con todo tipo de productos. Es una persona muy emprendedora, que con esfuerzo está mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, enlatados, carne, embutidos y demás, de manera a poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo, y así dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group, named "Rosa Mistica," is from the city of Encarnacion. They are hardworking and united women; they each partake in the mission to eliminate poverty, and they fight to better their condition of life.

Lilia is part of this group. In her quest to end poverty, she has demonstrated that she can always keep improving thanks to her hard work and effort. She has a shop that is stocked with all types of products. She is a very entrepreneurial woman, who, with great effort, is bettering her and her family's condition.

She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy fruit, canned goods, meat, sausages, and more; therefore, her shop will be able to continue growing as it has been. This will help her to give her family everything they need to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, canned goods, meat, sausage, and more.

loans.name: Carmen Odila

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo  un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras se reúnen cada quince días, en casa de una socia de banca Comunal.
La señora  Carmen tiene 61 años, casada, su esposo es chofer y de este matrimonio tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo menor de edad soltero en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la venta artículos por Catálogos (ropa, zapatos, bisutería, productos de belleza, etc.) su negocio lo sostiene sola y lo hace recorriendo en oficinas y casas, también vende en su casa donde tiene un  pequeño local. La señora Carmen invertirá este crédito en comprar mercadería (ropa, zapatos, etc.).
Los créditos  loa realiza desde hace 10 años y le gusta las facilidades que brinda la Fundación.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, a group of entrepreneurial women meet every 15 days in the building of a community bank.

Carmen, who is 61 years old, is married. Her husband is a driver for a living. From her marriage, she has five grown children. She lives with her husband, and one younger son (who is single) in her own house.

She makes a living selling articles from catalogs, such as clothing, shoes, jewelry, beauty products, etc. She manages her business alone; she does this in offices and houses, as well as sells from her home where she has a small work space. Carmen will invest this credit in purchasing merchandise, like clothing and shoes. 

She has been utilizing loans for the past 10 years, and really enjoys the service provided by "la Fundacion" (Kiva's partner in Ecuador).

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
Jose tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, con 07 años de experiencia en el negocio. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será utilizado para realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo así como para realizar reparaciones en la cochera donde guarda su mototaxi. Con esto Jose espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, aumentando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old and lives with his partner. He lives in his own home with his partner and their three children in the rural zone of the Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly make a living in agriculture, livestock and business.

He makes a living offering transport services in his mototaxi, with seven years of experience in the business. He has very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used to maintain his vehicle as well as to undertake repairs in the garage where he keeps his mototaxi. With this, Jose hopes to offer a better service to his clients, increasing his income level, and therefore his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle as well as to undertake repairs in the garage where he keeps his mototaxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Unidas, todas son mujeres muy unidas, que luchan por poder dar a su familia todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Todas a su vez también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nelida, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida e ingresos a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de sus ventas, que hace en la despensa que ella tiene, y que poco a poco ha ido montando y mejorando.
La Sra. Nelida pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como carnes, verduras, frutas, embutidos y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, named "Mujeres Unidas," is a group of very close women who fight to be able to give their families everything that they did not have. They are all a part of a program that seeks to eliminate poverty, and to know the life situation of each member of the group.

One of the members is named Nelida; in her latest survey, she demonstrated a level of poverty below level three. She has begun to improve her conditions of life and her income through a lot of effort and continued work. She works in sales, and has been getting by with what she has; little by little, she has pieced her shop together and it is improving.

Nelida is asking for this loan to buy various ingredients for her shop, such as meat, vegetables, fruit, sausage, and more. All of this will help her to attain the goals in her business plan, which will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, fruit, sausage, and more.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor  Miguel tiene 48 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, todos en pequeños, que son motivo de lucha de él y su esposa. El tiene una casa de Venta de Repuestos para todo tipo de vehículos hace varios años.
El se inició con un pequeño negocio de ventas de repuestos, ahora ya cuenta con un Negocio montado en la Ciudad, dicho local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de filtros, Lubricantes, Fluidos, Ruleman, Amortiguadores, Soportes, Gomas etc., para que de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 48, is married and has three small children.  They are the motivation for his and his wife’s self-sacrifice.  He has had a business selling replacement parts for all types of vehicles for several years.

He started with a small business selling replacement parts.  Now he has established a business in the city.  His place is in a strategic spot in the city.

He is requesting this loan to buy filters, lubricants, fluids, bearings, shock absorbers, brackets, and tires, etc.  He will purchase these items in order to be able to continue with his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy filters, lubricants, fluids, bearings, shock absorbers, brackets, and tires, etc.

loans.name: Assel

texts.en:
Aseel is an 18-year-old, single woman. She is one of six family members. 

She was a victim of her parent's divorce. Aseel could not complete her education because of the financial difficulties and she had to work to help her family with household expenses. 

She opened a small business, which is a beauty salon, and she also had to work in a boutique, selling dresses, to raise her income. Therefore, she obtained experience about selling dresses. 

Due to the high cost of living, Aseel wants to expand her work. She thinks she will buy some dresses to rent and sell -- that's why she requested a loan to buy what she needs for dresses and materials.

loans.use: to buy what she needs for dresses and materials, to expand her business.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities, like eggs, cooking oil, soap, toothpaste, sugar, biscuits, chips, and beverages. She is married, with five children. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is one year old. In addition to that, she also engages in a food-vending business. Her husband earns a living through farming. 

Lerma has requested a loan to buy more supplies for the store, like canned goods, noodles, and toiletries. These are very helpful in attracting more customers to shop and purchase. In this way, Lerma could earn more money and start to balance her finances. She can now provide her family with basic needs.

Lerma is hoping that she can properly manage her current sources of income for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store, like canned goods, noodles, and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: complete his university studies in Industrial Microbiology

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
San Agustín lleva por nombre un grupo integrado por 8 mujeres trabajadoras y con iniciativa, las cuales son originarias de una comunidad donde se encuentra una gran laguna donde a diario los habitantes acuden a pescar, lavar ropa o a distraerse. Las integrantes del grupo son:

Josefina – Muebles De Madera.
Francisca – Calzado Por Catalogo
Maria Del Carmen - Pollo
Mirna – Perfumes 
Marisela - Pan
Ruth – Antojitos 
Karina – Tortillas 
Gloria - Dulces 

Karina es una persona muy responsable desde hace tres años se ha hecho cargo de su sobrino quien la quiere como si fuese su madre. Karina aprendió a hacer tortillas a mano desde niña, su madre fue quien le enseñó y desde hace 2 años se ha dedicado a vender este tradicional alimento de la cocina mexicana. De lunes a sábado, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para lavar el maíz que coció la tarde anterior, después lo muele, prende la lumbre e inicia con su actividad; diario se venden cerca de 500 tortillas. Karina debe cuidar muy bien sus manos ya que son su herramienta principal. Además, Karina también renta su molino a otras personas que hacen sus propias tortillas. 

Con sus ganancias, Karina cubre el pago de luz bimestral que consume el molino, compra leña y aporta para los gastos de la casa. Al igual que sus préstamos anteriores comprará maíz por mayoreo, un comal nuevo y dará mantenimiento a su molino para poder mantener su negocio. “Estoy pensando en iniciar una nueva actividad  de esta manera emplear mi tiempo disponible por las tardes e incrementar los ingresos”.

*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de Francisca, Karina viste una falda gris y blusa azul.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Agustín" is the name of this group, which includes 8 hardworking women with initiative. They are from a community where there is a large lake where the residents go out daily to fish, wash clothes, or enjoy themselves.  The members of this group are:

Josefina – sells wooden furniture 
Francisca – sells shoe through a catalog
Maria Del Carmen - sells chicken
Mirna – sells perfumes
Marisela - sells bread
Ruth – sells snacks
Karina –  sells tortillas 
Gloria - sells sweets

Karina is a very responsible person.  Three years ago she took over the care of her nephew, whom she loves as if she was his mother.  Karina learned to make tortillas by hand when she was a little girl.  Her mother taught her, and she has been selling this traditional Mexican food for 2 years.  Mondays through Saturdays she gets up at 5am to wash the corn that she cooked the previous evening, and later she grinds it, turns on the light, and opens her business.  Each day she sells about 500 tortillas.  Karina must take good care of her hands, since they are her main work tool.  In addition to this activity, Karina also rents her mill to other people who make their own tortillas.

With her earnings, Karina covers the bi-monthly payment that covers the electricity that the mill uses, and she also buys firewood and contributes to the household finances.  As with her previous loans, she will buy corn at wholesale and a new griddle, and she will also do maintenance work on her mill so that she can keep her business running.  "I'm thinking about starting up a new business, so that I can make use of my free time in the afternoons and increase my income."

Note: the photograph was taken in front of Francisca's house.  Karina is seen wearing a grey skirt and a blue blouse.

loans.use: to buy corn and pay to sharpen the blade of her mill

loans.name: Prosperidad Leal Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Prosperidad Leal” conformada por 08 mujeres optimistas y emprendedoras. Vanessa de 34 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de conservas de filetes como conservas de atún. Hace más de 02 años que viene dedicándose a dicho negocio lo cual le va bien. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá para la compra de conserva de sardinas, conserva de filetes y conservas de atún. El grupo “Prosperidad Leal” agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su desarrollo. Vanessa es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo negro.
texts.en:
This is the Prosperidad Leal group which is made up of eight optimistic and enterprising women. One of them is 34-year old Vanessa who is married and has two children. She makes her living selling tinned fish fillets such as tuna. She has run her business for more than two years and all is going well.
Vanessa is seeking a loan to buy tinned sardines as well as tinned fish fillets and tinned tuna.

The Prosperidad Leal group is grateful for the loan money that makes the development of their businesses possible. 

Vanessa can be seen third from the left in a black top.

loans.use: buy tinned sardines as well as tinned fish fillets and tinned tuna

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive con su cónyuge y su hija en la provincia de Callayuc, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. En dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia.

Alcides se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales de corral como cuyes, gallinas, pavos, entre otros. Cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, gallinas, pavos, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Alcides espera aumentar la producción de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, lo cual tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alcides is 52 years old and has a life partner. He lives with his partner and their daughter in the Callayuc province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. In that district, the population works in agriculture and livestock.

Alcides makes a living raising and selling farmyard animals like guinea pigs, chicken and ducks, among others. He has over five years of experience in this field and has very good personal and work references in the area. The purpose of the loan will be to buy a greater quantity of animals like guinea pigs, chickens and ducks, as well as to buy animal feed for them. With this, Alcides hopes to increase his business's production and improve the quality of the products he offers his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and, therefore, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals like guinea pigs, chickens and ducks, as well as to buy animal feed for them.

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es:
Maria tiene 55 años de edad, es casada. Vive con su cónyuge en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Maria espera mejorar la productividad de su cultivo para poder brindar un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes, aumentando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and married. She lives with her husband in their rustic family home in the Pucará district, Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. The area's population makes a living in farming, commerce, and livestock.

She farms for a living, specifically growing rice. She has 10 years of experience in this field and has very good personal and work references.

The loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizer to maintain her crop, as well as to hire labor for the harvest season.

With this loan, Maria hopes to improve her field's productivity in order to provide her customers a higher quality product. This will allow her to increase her income and improve the quality of life of herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to maintain her crops, and to hire labor for the harvest season

loans.name: Deython Edgardo

texts.es:
Deython tiene 43 años de edad, es casado. Vive con su cónyuge en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de San Felipe, provincia Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la elaboración de pan y dulcería en general, cuenta con una panadería que se encuentra ubicada en su mismo domicilio, en la cual realiza la venta de sus productos. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de insumos como harina, utensilios de cocina, entre otros, así como para realizar reparaciones y mejoramientos en su panadería. Lo que Deython espera con esto es brindar un óptimo servicio a sus clientes mejorando la calidad del producto que ofrece, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos, aumentando así su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Deython is 43 years old and is married.  He lives with his wife in his own home, made of rudimentary materials.  His home is located in the rural part of San Felipe district, in Jaen province in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  The residents of this district work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.

Deython works making bread and sweets.  He has a bakery that is located in his home where he makes his products.  He has very good personal and work references from the neighborhood.  Deython will use this loan to buy supplies such as flour, cooking utensils, and other items to make repairs and improvements to his bakery.  With this investment, Deython hopes to provide optimal service to his customers and increase the quality of the products he sells, which will be reflected in a higher level of income. This way he can increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria tiene 45 años de edad, es casada. Su familia es unida, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población del distrito dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales como patos, cuyes y carneros. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de verduras para contar con un mayor stock en su negocio. Con esto espera poder aumentar su nivel de ventas, aumentando así sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and married. Her family, her husband and son, live together in their own house in the Lagunas district of Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú. The people of this district are reliant on agriculture, cattle raising, and commerce. 

Maria's business is selling produce. She has over three years of experience in this line of work and has very good personal and professional references. In addition, she raises livestock such as ducks, guinea pigs, and sheep. This loan will be used to buy greater quantities of produce so as to increase her business's stock. With this she hopes to increase sales, and thus her income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of produce so as to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo “JEHOVA ES MI PASTOR” es un grupo que se encuentra pasando al  segundo ciclo. Virginia tiene 30 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulatorio hace 07 años. Actividad que aprendió cuando trabajaba de ayudante.  Ella vende productos de toda variedad y por campañas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropas polos blusas damas y productos unión al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Virginia es la que tiene a su bebe en brazos.
texts.en:
“Jehová es Mi Pastor” (Jehovah Is My Shepherd) is a group going through it's second loan cycle. 

Virginia is 30 years old and lives with her three dependent children. Virginia has been making a living in informal commerce for the last seven years. She learnt this work when she was working as an assistant. 

Virginia sells a variety of products including seasonal products. The loan will be invested in buying wholesale clothes, shirts, women's blouses and union brand products.  

The group appreciates the Kiva lenders for providing this loan. Virginia is the one holding the baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shirts, blouses and union brand products

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero. Vive con sus padres en casa familiar en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en mototaxi, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo será utilizado para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo. Con esto Carlos espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, aumentando así su nivel de ingresos y con esto su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old and is single. He lives with his parents in the family home in a small community in the rural area of the Cayalti district, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He makes a living offering urban transportation services in mototaxi. He has more than three years of experience in this sector and very good personal and work references. The loan will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle. With this, Carlos hopes to offer a better service to his clients, in this way raising his income level and, with this, his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Ny is 34 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. 

Ny struggles to earn a living, farming cassava and rice as her main source of income. She also works for others to earn additional income. She has been involved in this business for a long time and earns around 40,000 KHR per day. 

For Ny, this is her first loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She leads her group of four members who together are requesting this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on the cost of labor to work her farmland. 

Ny hopes that she can earn more income to expand her cassava farm.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor to work her farmland.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
La cosecha más importante de la región donde se encuentra el grupo es la caña, casi todos los campos se encuentran cubiertos de este fruto aunque también se suele ver árboles de limón, papaya y naranja. Los integrantes de Las Tres Marías y sus actividades son: 

Francisca -Costuras
Martina - Tacos
Sonia -Antojitos
Maria Angelica-Abarrotes
Maria R. -Pan
Eleazar -Pan
Ma Filiberta -Tamales
Antonio –Hielitos, Gelatinas, Chicharrones

Doña María R. es una persona demasiado comprometida, está casada con el señor Filiberto y tiene tres hijos, el mayor de ellos de 15 años. Ella no sabe leer ni escribir debido a que no estudió, así que desafortunadamente tuvo que comenzar a trabajar desde muy pequeña para apoyar a sus padres a mantener a sus hermanos. 

María R. se dedicaba a comprar y revender pan con el firme propósito de brindarle a sus hijos la calidad de vida que ella no tuvo, “Jamás olvidare el día en que mi hijo me dijo mamá porque no haces pan para vender en lugar de comprarlo" cuando Filiberto llegó a casa después de un día de trabajo, le comentó la idea del pequeño y fue como iniciaron su propia panadería hace 5 años invirtiendo sus ahorros en la compra de material para construir un horno de piedra donde el pan se cose con leña, además de comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, colorante.

Al principio, el mayor temor de María R. era no tener éxito y que su inversión fuese en vano. Hoy en día su panadería es fuente de empleo de 7 personas, ella, su esposo y su cuñado se encargan de la preparación del pan, “A mí me gusta vender por eso después de terminar de hacer el pan cargo en mi canasta 80 piezas y salgo a venderlo a las comunidades vecinas”.

Gracias a los dos préstamos que ha recibido anteriormente logró comprar canastos, azúcar, manteca, harina y leña, continuando de esta manera con su panadería. Debido a que se acercan los meses más fríos de la región, los habitantes tienden a comprar más pan y por ello María R. necesita comprar más ingredientes y material para aprovechar la temporada.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Ma Filiberta, María R. viste playera azul y está recargada sobre algunos trozos de leña.
texts.en:
The most important crop in the region where the group is located is sugar cane. Almost all of the fields are covered with this fruit, although one also tends to see lime, papaya, and orange trees. The members of Las Tres Marías [The Three Marías] and their occupations are:

Francisca – Sewing
Martina – Tacos
Sonia – Antojitos [Traditional corn-based Mexican dishes]
Maria Angelica – Groceries 
Maria R. – Bread
Eleazar – Bread
Ma Filiberta – Tamales
Antonio – Popsicles, jellies, pork rinds

María R. is an extremely committed person. She is married to Filiberto and has three children. The youngest of her children is 15 years old. She does not know how to read or write due to the fact that she did not study. Therefore, she unfortunately had to start working from a very early age to help her parents take care of her siblings. 

María R. used to make a living by buying and reselling bread with the purpose of giving her children the quality of life that she did not have. “I will never forget the day in which my son told me: ‘Mom, why don’t you make bread to sell instead of buying it?’” she says. When Filiberto arrived at the house after a day of work, she told him the little one’s idea and that was how they started their own bakery 5 years ago. The invested their savings to buy materials to build a stone oven where the bread is cooked over a wood fire. They also bought flour, sugar, butter, and food coloring. 

At the beginning, María R.’s biggest fear was to not be successful and that her investment would be in vain. Today, her bakery employs 7 people. She, her husband, and her brother-in-law prepare the bread. “I like to sell. For this reason, after I finish making the bread I carry 80 pieces in my basket and I go out to sell them to the neighboring communities,” she says.

Thanks to the two loans that she received before, she was able to buy baskets, sugar, butter, flour, and firewood, continuing her bakery in this manner.
