Due to the fact that the coldest months in the region are arriving, the inhabitants tend to buy more bread. For this reason, María R. needs to buy more ingredients and materials to take advantage of the season. 

*The photograph was taken in Ma Filiberta’s house. María R. is wearing a blue t-shirt and is leaning against some pieces of firewood.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, sugar, food coloring, brown paper, and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and bricks and pay labor costs to build a bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo tiene 62 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive con su familia en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, etc. Su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como patos, gallinas, pollos, entre otros. Esta inversión le permitirá tener una mayor variedad de animales y mayor productividad en su negocio, lo que tendrá una gran influencia en su nivel de ingresos y aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Camilo is 62 years old and his marital status is Partnered. He lives with his family in the rural area of the Oyotún district, which is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. The primary activities that are carried out in this district are agriculture, livestock breeding, and commerce.

He makes a living buy raising and selling animals such as ducks, hens, roosters, chickens, etc. His business is located in his residence. He has more than 10 years of experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals such as ducks, hens, and chickens, among others. This investment will allow him to have a greater variety of animals and greater productivity in his business. This will have a large influence on his income level and will increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals such as ducks, hens, and chickens, among others.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Vive en casa propia de material rústico en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura y la ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera nesecidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros. Con esto Lucrecia logrará tener una mayor variedad de productos en su negocio satisfaciendo así los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá aumentar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 52 years old and in a civil union. She lives in her rustic home in the rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Farming and stock-breeding are the main occupations in this district.

She sells basic groceries for a living, such as rice, sugar, oil, and noodles, among others. She operates her business right out of her own home. She has experience in the business and enjoys very good personal and professional references in the region.

The loan will be used to purchase more products for her business, such as rice, sugar, and oil, among others.

With this loan, Lucrecia will succeed in having a greater variety of products for her business, satisfying the desires and preferences of her customers. This will be reflected in her level of income, and it will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her business, such as rice, sugar, and oil, among others.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in her family house, where they have access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family.

Sarah has a business selling used clothing. She operates her business on a retail basis selling her used clothing door-to-door 7 days a week. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. One of her major challenges is seasonal demand. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to buy a bale of used clothing. Her goal is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila y armoniosa, la población se dedica principalmente al cultivo de frutales, café y cacao, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, su tienda se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su tienda, con esto Bertila espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos satisfaciendo los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bertila is 61 years old, she lives with her daughter in the Pucará district, located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this district is calm and peaceful, the population’s occupation is mainly growing fruits, coffee, and cacao, retail, and raising livestock.
She works in the sale of groceries such as milk, rice, sugar, oil, among others. Her store is located in her home. She has more than 15 years of experience in the business with loyal clients who give her very good personal and professional references. The current loan will be to purchase a larger amount of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, among others, to increase the stock in her store. This way, Bertila hopes to offer a larger variety of products, satisfying the tastes and preferences of her clients, which will increase her income level and will allow her to improve her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, among others, to increase the stock in her store.

loans.name: Javier Edgardo

texts.es:
Javier de 29 años de edad estudió hasta bachillerato, luego abandono sus estudios porque no podía pagar los gastos de la universidad. Esta acompañado y tiene un hijo, su pareja es comerciante de ropa y ambos trabajan para mantener el hogar.

Javier es comerciante desde hace 5 años, elabora y vende pan todos los días por las calles de su pueblo y comunidades cercanas, antes tenía una venta de helados, pero le va mejor con la venta de pan. Solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, moldes y demás para su negocio.

Javier ve una gran oportunidad de crecer en este negocio y sueña con establecer  una gran panadería y poder así generar empleo a personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Javier is 29 years old and studied through high school. Later he stopped studying because he could not pay university costs. He has a life partner and one child. His partner sells clothing and both of them work to support their home.

Javier has been in sales for 5 years. He makes and sells bread everyday in the streets of his town and the surrounding communities. Before, he sold ice cream but the bread sales are going better. He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, molds, and more for his business.

Javier sees a great opportunity to grow in this business. His dream is to establish a big bakery and create jobs for people who need them.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, molds, and more for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: complete his university studies in Business Law

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.es:
Atanacio tiene 60 años de edad, es soltero. Vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Además el cliente también se dedica a realizar labores de panadería, lo que le permité generar ingresos adicionales. El préstamo será utilizado en realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo (mototaxi), esto le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, aumentando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Atanacio is 60 years old and single. He lives in the Pomahuaca district, Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The area's population makes their living in farming, livestock, and commerce.

He makes his living providing public transport. He has his own motorcycle taxi that he uses to provide this service. He has 10 years of experience in the business and enjoys very good personal and professional references in the region. The borrower also works at a bakery, which provides him with additional income.

The loan will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle (a motorcycle taxi). This will allow him to provide better service to his customers, increasing his income and therefore his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle (a motorcycle taxi)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, wooden sheets and nails to build a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana tiene 51 años de edad, es casada. Su familia es unida, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y su nieto en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y chupetes así como comidas preparadas, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende en su negocio. Con esto Juana espera aumentar la cantidad de clientes y con esto su nivel de ingresos, mejorando así su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 51 years old and is married. Her family is together. She lives in her own home with her husband and her grandson in the Zana district in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture, livestock and business.

Juana makes a living selling drinks and fruit ices as well as ready to eat meals. She has experience in the business and very good personal and work references. The loan will be used to buy ingredients for the preparation of the food she sells in her business. With this, Juana hopes to increase her customers and with this her level of income, in this way improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of the food she sells in her business.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
María es una joven barbera de 21 años de edad que gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre y a capacitaciones inicio su propio negocio, por motivos de que quiere tener su propio capital, aportar en su casa y poder pagar sus gastos de educación superior.
Su principal inconveniente es que hace poco empezó en un local rustico algo feo y desea adecuarlo y hacerlo más hermoso, por ello solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías, pintura, muebles y uniformes para su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a young barber who is 21 years of age. Thanks to the lessons from her mother and training classes she attended, she was able to start her own business. For these reasons, she wants to have her own capital so that she can contribute to the household and pay for her higher education expenses.

Her main challenge is that she started in a basic location that is a bit unattractive, so she wants to equip it so that she can make it more beautiful. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of shelves, paint, furniture, and uniforms for her business.

loans.use: to buy shelves, paint, furniture, and uniforms for her business.

loans.name: Los Cuates Group

texts.es:
En un cerro, cerca de donde se solía extraer piedra, se integró un grupo llamado Los Cuates debido a que cerca del lugar de reunión viven dos adolescentes gemelos muy conocidos. Los miembros activos del grupo y sus actividades son:

José Miguel -refrescos
Raquel –pollo 
Irán -albañilería
Modesta -antojitos
Irene –bolsas de mano
Cristina –pan 
Bernardina –refrescos 

Irán es un joven muy trabajador, estudió la preparatoria y actualmente tiene 19 años; es el menor de tres hermanos. Los tres se dedican al oficio de albañilería el cual han aprendido de su padre quien tiene más de 30 años de experiencia. Hace poco, entre los cuatro le cumplieron uno de sus sueños a su madre pues reconstruyeron su casa. 

Desde que Irán era un pequeño, le llamaba la atención el trabajo de su padre por eso en sus ratos libres acudía con él al proyecto en el que estuviera trabajando lo cual le ayudó a aprender rápidamente todos los procesos y apenas hace un año también se dedica a esta labor. El sueldo que percibe del servicio que presta lo emplea en la compra de herramienta de trabajo, apoya a sus padres con los gastos de la casa y satisface sus necesidades personales. De vez en cuando también se dedica a pintar casas, muchas veces son las mismas que él ayuda a construir. “No sólo somos una familia, mis hermanos y yo somos un gran equipo de trabajo”. 

Actualmente, Irán quiere renovar su herramienta de trabajo y necesita invertir en un nivel, un metro, un marro, cincel, alambre, pala, pico,  taladro y una pulidora para seguir facilitando su trabajo. Aunque por el momento, la familia trabaja en conjunto en sus proyectos, Irán no descarta la idea de de brindar trabajo a dos o tres personas para que ellos estén a su cargo.

“Gracias por confiar en nosotros, no quebrantaremos la confianza que han depositado en nosotros al contrario aprovecharemos al máximo esta gran oportunidad” comenta Irán.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la que será la calle principal, detrás se puede apreciar el cerro donde sobre una gran piedra esta una ermita de la virgen de Guadalupe, Irán viste camisa de manga larga a cuadros.
texts.en:
On a hill, close to where stones used to be extracted, a group called Los Cuates [The Twins] was formed. The group was named this due to the fact that there are two very well known adolescent twins close to where they meet. The active members of the group and their occupations are:

José Miguel – Soft drinks
Raquel – Chicken
Irán – Carpentry
Modesta – Appetizers
Irene – Handbags
Cristina – Bread
Bernardina – Soft drinks

Irán is a very hardworking young man. He studied through high school and currently is 19 years old. He is the youngest of three siblings. The three of them work in the carpentry business, which they learned from their father who has more than 30 years of experience. A little while ago, between the four of them, they made one of his mother’s dreams come true by rebuilding their house.

Ever since Irán was little, he was interested in his father’s work. For this reason, in his free time he went with him to whatever project he was working on at the time. This helped him quickly learn all of the processes, and just a year ago he also started making a living in this line of work. He uses the salary that he receives for his services to buy tools for work. He helps his parents with the household expenses and he takes care of his personal needs. Every once in a while he also paints houses. Many times, they are the same houses that he helped build. “We are not only a family. My brothers and I are a great team on the job,” he says. 

Currently, Irán wants to update his work tools and he needs to invest in a level, a tape measure, a mallet, a chisel, wire, a shovel, a pick, a drill, and a polishing machine to continue facilitating his work. Although in the moment his family works together on their projects, Irán has not discarded the idea of giving work to two or three people so that they can work under him.

“Thank you for trusting us. We will not break the trust that you have placed in us. On the contrary, we will take full advantage of this great opportunity,” Irán comments.

*The photograph was taken in the main street. In the background, one can see the hill where, on a large stone, there is a shrine to the Virgin Guadalupe. Irán is wearing a long-sleeved plaid shirt.

loans.use: to buy a level, a tape measure, a mallet, a chisel, wire, a shovel, a pick, a drill, and a polishing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase several cell phones to resell.

loans.name: Gie Faggu Group

texts.fr:
Le G.I.E Faggu, est un groupe de crédit qui regroupe 05 membres qui se unies grâce à des séances de causeries sur le » planning familial » qu’ils partageaient souvent. 
La présidente s’appelle Mame Boulane, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont son ainée âgée de 16 ans et la cadette, de 2 ans. Mame Boulane est enseignante de profession et sert dans un village situé à 40km de la ville principale. Elle a aussi une activité parallèle qui est le commerce depuis plus de 2 ans. Elle achète des habits pour les revendre à ses collègues dans la zone où elle est et qui est assez éloignée ; cela est une opportunité de vente car les produits qu’elle propose sont rares là bas. Comme charges, elle s’occupe de sa location et de son manger.
Elle a comme projet d’acheter une moto  djakarta pour faire du transport et augmenter ses sources de revenus.
texts.en:
G.I.E. Faggu is a credit group comprising five members who became acquainted through family planning talk sessions they often shared.

The President named Mame Boulane is married and the mother of four children: her eldest is 16 and the youngest is two years old. Mame Boulane is a teacher by profession in a village situated 40 kilometers from the main city.

She has also been running a parallel commercial activity for the past two years: she buys clothes for resale to colleagues in her area, which is quite isolated. This is an opportunity because the products she offers are hard to come by in that location.  She takes care of her rental and food expenses

She has a project to buy a Djakarta motorcycle, to offer transportation services and increase her income.

loans.use: buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Wendenda Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur LASSANE est le représentant du groupe WENDENDA. Marié, il est  père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé à 05 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Monsieur vend des téléphones portable depuis plus de 02 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son quartier. 
Il veut s’acheter  06 téléphones portables.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et épargner. Il ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Lassane represents the Wendenda group. He is the married father of two children: the eldest is five and the youngest is three years old. Neither of them attend school, and he has in total three persons under his care.

He has been selling mobile phones for the past two years. He resupplies at local markets, and wants to buy six cell phones.

He intends to use his profits to strengthen his business and increase his savings. His ambition is to expand his business and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: buy six cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish her college degree and work in the field of marketing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish his degree in Banking and Finance.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza; está en su ciclo número  1  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Leticia; a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante.
La Sra. Leticia  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de harina, aceites, leche, entre otros; lo que le ayudará a seguir haciendo sus comidas, y con ello ir mejorando su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named "Nueva Esperanza" ("New Hope") is in its first cycle of the women's committee program. All of the members work and help each other to get ahead. 

One of the members is Leticia; she is improving her situation through effort, continuous work and the application of behavior vital to a successful woman. She makes a living by selling food that she makes herself and then goes out to sell in an itinerant fashion.

Leticia is asking for this loan to buy flour, oil, and milk, among other items. This will help her to keep making her foods and improving her business plan, which will help her to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, and milk, among other items.

loans.name: Adelfa
loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a buy and sell of clothing business in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

Anecita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like t-shirts, pants, and shorts to sell

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín, de 49 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel académico, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene tres hijos, el mayor trabaja en la agricultura y los otros dos hijos estudian.

Efraín desde hace más de 6 años es vendedor de sorbetes, pero en temporada de la siembra es agricultor.- La distancia que recorre para ir a sembrar los granos básicos para el sustento de su familia, está a 1 kilómetro y su hijo mayor es quien le ayuda.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más sorbetes y venderlos, porque al comprar por mayor cantidad le sale más barato y le quedan mejores ganancias.

El sueño de Efraín es, ampliar su negocio y ser distribuidor de sorbetes para no tener necesidad de hacer 2 trabajos para tener el suficiente dinero para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Efraín is 49 years old and was not able to receive an education. He is married and his wife takes care of the household duties. They have three children. His oldest child works in agriculture and the other two are in school.

Efraín has been selling sorbets for more than six years. During the planting season, he works as a farmer. He must walk a distance of one kilometer so that he can plant basic grains in order to sustain his family. His oldest son is the one who helps him.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more sorbets that he can sell. By purchasing in bulk quantity, he will be able to get a cheaper price and obtain better profits. Efraín's dream is to expand his business and become a sorbet distributor so that he no longer has to work two jobs. This will give him sufficient income to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sorbets in bulk that he can sell.

loans.name: Asoncion

texts.en:
Asoncion works hard to support her family. Asoncion is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Asoncion has been in this business for 18 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 50 years old and married with 11 children, five of whom are in school. Crisanta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Crisanta has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Maria Sorangel

texts.es:
Ella es María una simpática, sonriente mujer, que junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos conforman una feliz familia que lucha cada día por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
El aporte que realiza María para mejorar las vidas de sus seres queridos lo da gracias a su tienda de miscelánea, ofertando productos y accesorios para hombre y dama, ropa interior, pijama entre otros.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en accesorios para dama y ropa interior.
texts.en:
This is María, a likeable and smiling woman. Her happy family includes her husband and their three children. Each day she strives to improve their living conditions.

The support that María provides to improve the lives of her loved ones exists because of her variety store. She offers products such as men's and women's accessories, undergarments, pajamas, and other items. María is requesting a loan in order to buy a stock of women's accessories and undergarments.

loans.use: to buy a stock of women's accessories and undergarments.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ready to wear to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Seferina

texts.es: Seferina tiene 27 años de edad es madre de tres hijos y está casada. Sus tres hijos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados. Como fuente de ingreso económico ella se realiza trabajos de campo (Agricultura) quien se desempeña en la siembra de maíz, frijol y café lo cual aprendió de sus padres quienes le enseñaron con mucho esfuerzo y esmero a realizar las diferentes actividades de campo. Como medio extra de ingresos económicos ella también se dedica a la elaboración de pan de casa y tamales siendo sus clientes los mismos vecinos, amigos y demás personas que habitan en la comunidad. El terreno donde tiene construida su casa de habitacion y tiene sus cultivos de café es un patrimonio por parte de su esposo quien le apoya a varias actividades agrícolas y en lo económico. Seferina como toda mujer luchadora y deseosa de salir adelante tiene planeado un proyecto de sembrar 3 tareas más de café para continuar creciendo en este rubro comercial que es de mucho beneficio y ayuda para su familia además de comprar 5 cerditos para engordarlos y revenderlos en la temporada navideña. Ella manifiesta que luchara hasta el final para hacer su sueño realidad y también en apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que se preparen profesionalmente y tengan un mejor futuro con mejores oportunidades y una mejor calidad de vida. Por ello Seferina solicita apoyo financiero para poder llevar a cabo sus metas y al mismo tiempo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, foliares, entre otros que serán de mucho provecho para proteger sus cultivos de café en este inicio de temporada esperando ser apoyada y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Seferina is 27 years old and married. She is the mother of 3 children, who study at the community school and are in different grades. She makes a living doing field work (agriculture), cultivating corn, beans, and coffee. She learned this work from her parents, who taught her how to perform different farming activities with great effort and care. She also works making bread and tamales in her home as an additional source of income. Her customers are neighbors, friends, and other people that live in her community.

The plot of land where her house is built and where she has her coffee crops is her husband's inheritance. He supports her agricultural work as well as economically. Seferina, a hard-working woman who wishes to move forward, plans to cultivate 3 more tareas of coffee in order to continue expanding in this business sector, which is of great benefit and help to her family. In addition, she will buy 5 pigs to fatten and sell during the Christmas season. 

Seferina will fight until the end to make her dreams come true and to support her children with their studies. She hopes that they will attain professional training so that they can have a better future with better opportunities as well as a better quality of life. Seferina is requesting financial support so that she can achieve her goals. She will buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, compost, and foliars, among other things. She will use these to protect her coffee crops at the start of a new season. She hopes to be supported so that she can move forward.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies as well as 5 pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Letecia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years. Melinda earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Ronela

texts.en:
Ronela is 36-years-old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

Ronela has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Beatriz works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Beatriz is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like canned goods, egg, vegetables, meat, etc. for her restaurant business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like canned goods, eggs, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Sucett

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sucett works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Sucett is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sucett has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
As a widow parent of two children, Crispina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Crispina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like pants, shorts, etc. to sell for her ready to wear products business.

Crispina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothing like pants and shorts to sell.

loans.name: Un Futuro Brillante Group

texts.es:
La localidad donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo llamado Un Futuro Brillante se encuentra escondida entre plantaciones de caña, colinda con el cerro de donde los habitantes obtienen leña para la cocción de los alimentos. Los integrantes del grupo consideran que el mayor atractivo de la comunidad es un ojo de agua ubicado en el cerro.

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron pensando firmemente en lo que ellos quieren alcanzar con cada una de sus actividades. Los integrantes del grupo son:

Ángela – Frutas Y Verduras	
Salome – Calzado Por Catalogo	
Maribel - Cosméticos	
Delfino – Hot Dog	
Susana - Antojitos	
Estela - Tacos

Doña Estela está casada con el señor Herminio con quien ha procreado 2 hijos, una chica de 11 años y un chico de 8. Hace 15 años, al ver que en casa hacían falta ingresos para solventar los gastos comenzó a vender tacos al vapor afuera de su casa donde colocaba, con ayuda de su esposo, una lona, 3 mesas y el cajón de los tacos para ofrecer tacos al vapor calientitos. Gracias al éxito obtenido hoy vende otras variedades de tacos: de tripa y de carne enchilada. La atención al cliente y el sazón de la carne es lo que le facilita continuar vendiendo, además de ser la única persona con este negocio en la comunidad ya que otras personas han incursionado pero no pueden continuar. 

Con las ganancias obtenidas ha apoyado a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, reinvierte en la compra de carne, servilletas, verdura, tortillas y refrescos. “Mi familia es el motor principal pues el contar con su apoyo es lo que ha mantenido la chispa en mi y las ganas de continuar con mi actividad”. Esta vez necesita comprar más carne, chiles, tortillas y refrescos  siendo estos los insumos que más utiliza, 

Estela da las gracias por el apoyo para continuar otorgando los préstamos que hacen posible que prosperen los negocios de todos los integrantes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Maribel, doña Estela aparece cargando a su sobrino.
texts.en:
The "Un Futuro Brillante" group is based in a town hidden among sugar cane plantations and adjacent to the hill where the inhabitants obtain the firewood to cook their food. The group members consider that the community's main appeal is a spring located in the hill.

The members chose the name of the group believing very strongly in what they wanted to achieve with each of their businesses. The group members are the following:

Angela – sells fruits and vegetables
Salome – sells shoes by catalog
Maribel – sells cosmetics
Delfino – sells hot dogs
Susana – sells typical Mexican snacks
Estela – sells tacos

Estela is married to Herminio, with whom she has two children: an 11-year-old girl and an 8-year-old boy. Fifteen years ago, seeing that they needed more income to cover their household expenses, she began to sell steamed tacos outside her home. With the help of her husband, she set up an awning, three tables, and a crate where she kept the steamed tacos warm. In view of her success, now she sells other types of tacos such as tripe and meat marinated with hot peppers.

Her customer service and the flavour of the meat are what makes it easier for her to keep on selling. Furthermore, she is the only person in the community with this type of business. Other people have ventured into this field; however, they have been unable to carry on with the business.

With her profits, she has helped out her husband with the family expenses. She reinvests in the purchase of meat, napkins, vegetables, tortillas, and soft drinks. "My family is my driving force because by having their support, I have been able to keep myself motivated and eager to continue with my business." 

This time she needs to buy more meat, hot peppers, tortillas, and soft drinks, which are the inputs that she uses the most.

Estela is grateful for the support to keep on granting the loans that will make possible for the businesses of all the group members to flourish.

*In the photo, which was taken at Maribel's, Estela can be seen holding her nephew.

loans.use: to buy meat, hot peppers, tortillas, and soft drinks.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Dila

texts.es:
Dila, de 52 años de edad, solo estudio hasta primer grado, debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, está casa y tiene 3 hijos, pero solo 2 viven aun con ella.

Dila, tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa desde hace varios años, una de sus hijas es quien le ayuda.- Anteriormente, Dila trabajaba como empleada doméstica en una casa y fue ahí en donde le enseñaron a cocinar.- 

Años después, ella decidió colocar su propio negocio de venta de comida para obtener de ahí los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia.

Dila, necesita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, pollo, carne, tomates, chiles, cebollas, entre otras cosas necesarias para el negocio.- En época de fin de año la demanda incrementa, es por eso que el crédito le ayudará a comprar más rápido todo lo que necesita.

Los sueños de Dila, son construir otra casa en donde pueda tener más espacio para el negocio y espacio para que sus hijos vivan cómodamente y tambien, ayudarle a su nieta para que estudie.
texts.en:
Dila is 52 years old and only studied through the first grade because her family had limited financial resources. She is married and has three children, but only two of them still live with her.

Dila has a small diner in her home that she has managed for several years. One of her daughters is her assistant. Dila previously worked as a domestic employee at a private home, which is where she learned how to cook. Years later, she decided to establish her own business of selling food so that she could have the necessary income to support her family.

Dila needs a loan in order to buy rice, beans, chicken, beans, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, and other necessary items for her business. Demand increases during the year-end season, so this loan will help her to quickly acquire everything she needs.

Dila dreams of building another house where she has more space for her business and enough space for her children so that they can live comfortably In addition, she wants to help her granddaughter with her studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, chicken, beans, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, and other necessary items for her business.

loans.name: María Olimpia

texts.es:
María, de 69 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de veinte años, pero el matrimonio no duro mucho tiempo; tiene tres hijos, los que ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven en el extranjero y una hija ya está casada, pero vive cerca de su casa.

Actualmente, María cuida a unas de sus nietas, sus hijos son los que la sostienen hoy en dia.- Ella no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, debido su avanzada edad, no le permiten trabajar; anteriormente, trabajaba en la agricultura, pero ahora solo se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus animales de corral.

El préstamo es solicitado para comprar granos basicos como: maiz y frijol para sembrar y pagar la mano de obra que le ayudará a sembrar.- María, tendrá la satisfacion de poder tener su siembra para la alimentación diaria y para obtener algunos ingresos de la cosecha.

Ella desea arreglar mejor su casa, y sueña con tener las comodidades que no tuvo cuando era joven.
texts.en:
María is 69 years old and has a sixth-grade education. She married at the age of 20 but the marriage did not last long. She has three children who are now adults. Two of them live outside the country and a daughter is already married and lives near her home. Currently Maria is looking after some of her granddaughters. Her children are the ones who support her nowadays.

She has no type of business, due to the fact that her advanced age does not allow her to work. Previously she worked in agriculture but now she just looks after the home and her farmyard animals. 

The loan is requested in order to buy basic grains such as corn and beans to plant,  and pay for labor which will help her with the planting. Maria will have the satisfaction of being able to have her crop for her daily diet and obtaining some income from the harvest. 

She wishes to do improvements to her home, and dreams of having the comforts she didn't have when she was young.

loans.use: To buy basic grains such as corn and beans to plant, and pay for labor which will help her with the planting.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sokheang is 35 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. She struggles for a living via rice cropping and pig-raising to earn extra income. For Sokheang, this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee and buy pig feed. She hopes that she can get more income to update her family’s living so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay the plowing fee and buy pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Wendmangda 01 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur ISSAKA est le représentant du groupe WENDMANGDA 01 SAPONE. Marié, il est  père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé à 08 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 01 va à l’école. Il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l'agriculture depuis plus de 08 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  01 motopompe.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Mr. ISSAKA is the representative of the group WENDMANGDA 01 SAPONE. A married man, he is the father of two children. The oldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 4. One goes to school. Mr. ISSAKA has seven persons to support. He has been farming for over eight years. He gets his supplies from nearby villages. He wants to purchase a motorized pump and use his profits to bolster his work. His ambition is to ensure his children’s education.

Daryl has been in this business for four years.

In the future Daryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.name: Conse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 27 membres fait parti du banc villageois depuis le 13 Décembre 2008. La plupart des femmes font de l’embouche, de l’élevage et du commerce.
Ndeye debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et est mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles.
Elle envisage d’acheter du mil pour le revendre. Elle achète 03 barils de 100kg à 200fca le kg. Elle revend le kilo de mil à 275f.
Les bénéfices lui permettront d’épargner dans le banc villageois et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 25 members has been part of the 'banc villageois' since December 13, 2008. Most of the women work in the fattening of livestock, raising livestock, and commerce. 

Ndeye, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 48 years old and a married mother of seven children (4 boys and 3 girls). She envisions purchasing some millet to resell. She is buying three 100-kg barrels at 200 francs CFA per kilo. She resells a kilo of millet at 275 francs. The profits will enable her to save money in the 'banc villageois' and to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase millet

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling dried fish. Rowena is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional equipment like fishing net, gasoline, etc., for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment like fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:

Mylene has been in this business for five years. Mylene earns more income from food vending and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Natasha products to sell.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en:
Josepha is 56 years old. She is married with three children between 5 and 15 years old. All of them go to school. She has farmed for 28 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice and then sell the rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice and to sell the rice.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 55 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell.

Susana has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Susana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leny

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leny has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tinh

They sell a range of products from household items to personal use products. Tinh would like to get a loan to buy new products such as different kinds of drinking water, beverages, and confectionery to sell in his store to better meet his customers' needs. He hopes that he will be able to increase his income and set aside some savings through the loan.

Ruby has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 44 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Glenda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional new varieties of seeds and other farm supplies.

Glenda has been farming vegetables for fifteen years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional new varieties of seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old and married with 11 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, spices, etc., to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from videoke (entertainment).

Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, spices, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
His name is Raymund, 37, and he is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Angeline, a house helper and he has children. He works hard to support the family's daily expenses and the schooling of his children who are still in the elementary level.

Raymund operates a buy and sell business. He buys various products such as plastic ware, household items, slippers, and toys from wholesalers and sells them for a little profit. He goes around their town and customers are attracted to buy because of the low price and convenience. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 900 (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy additional products and merchandise to expand his product inventory. This will definitely boost his earnings and enable him to meet the family's daily needs and to support his children's education. He wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Raymund desires to have a place of his own to display his items. He wants to give his family a better life and send his children to good schools. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for plastic ware products and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Lenin Alberto

texts.es:
Lenin es reconocido por sus amigos y compañeros de trabajo como el creativo, el responsable y por el emprendedor, quien a sus 30 años de edad no deja una oportunidad para seguir aprendiendo. Actualmente estudia el segundo año de la licenciatura en Economía, ya ha visto las oportunidades que provienen de este campo. Él ya tiene una licenciatura en Arquitectura, la cual ha servido de mucho en su trabajo como diseñador en un centro cultural de idiomas muy importante en el país. 
Lenin quiere seguir creciendo profesionalmente, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora portátil, la cual es muy importante para poder elaborar sus trabajos universitarios y laborales. Él cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana, de su trabajo fijo y extras como conductor o diseñador. Entre sus metas está terminar con honores su carrera, desarrollarse profesionalmente en ese campo y ayudar en su actual trabajo a mejorar el estudio de mercado.
texts.en:
Lenin is known among his friends and co-workers for his creativity, responsibility, and entrepreneurship. At the age of 30, he never misses an opportunity to keep learning. He is currently studying in his second year toward a degree in Economics because he has already seen opportunities come to him in this field. Lenin already has a degree in Architecture, which has served him well in his work as a designer at one of the most important cultural language centers in the country.

Lenin wants to keep growing professionally. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a portable computer, which is very important for him to do his university work and assignments. He has the support of his sister, who has a stable job and also takes on extra jobs as a driver or a designer. His goals include finishing his degree with honors, developing professionally in his field, and using his studies to help the current job market.

loans.use: to buy a portable computer.

loans.name: Zhyrgalbubu

texts.ru: Жыргалбубу, 53 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей, младшей дочери 4 года, старшей - 32 года. Образование Жыргалбубу- средне-специальное, она на дому шьет шторы на заказ, также уже 14 лет она занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Жыргалбубу имеет 1 корову, 1 лошадь и 15 овец. На участке мерою 2,10 Га она выращивает фасоль. Жыргалбубу хорошо знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего животноводческого бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 13 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Жыргалбубу намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на обучение младших детей и свадьбы старших.
texts.en: Zhyrgalbubu is 53 years old, married and a mother of 6 children, the youngest of whom, a daughter, is 4 years old, and the oldest is 32 years old. Zhyrgalbubu has a specialized secondary education and sews drapes to-order. She has also been involved in animal husbandry for 14 years and today has 1 cow, 1 horse and 15 sheep. She grows beans on 2.10 hectares of land. Zhyrgalbubu knows the techniques of running an agricultural business well and can invest money as needed. Her monthly combined income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, she requested a loan in the amount of 115,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 1 cow and 13 sheep to increase her livestock headcount. Zhyrgalbubu intends to increase her livestock headcount, and the earnings from the loan will allow her to save money for her younger children's education and weddings for the older ones.

loans.use: to buy 1 cow and 13 sheep to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 46 years old and married with two daughters. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income through running an internet shop. 

She started her business nine years ago. She intends to take a loan to repair and upgrade the computer system to better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To repair and upgrade her computer system

loans.name: Sineat's Group

texts.en: Sineat, 32, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in university and the other two are too young. Because of her living conditions, she grows rice as the main source of income. In addition, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emilia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emilia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional box of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a farming sugarcane business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emily is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming sugarcane business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 64 years old and married with six children, She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, spices, etc., to sell.

Emma has been in this business for ten years.

In the future Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, spices, etc., to sell

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 59 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, milk, etc., to sell.

Enriqueta has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell livestock.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, milk, etc., to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Erlinda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Muhadamin

texts.ru:
Мухадамин мужчина 35 лет , женат,молодой отец троих детей.Он имеет свой участок земли в пятнадцать гектаров , где выращивает урожай. У него на поле растут фрукты и овощи такие как картошка , морковь,помидоры,огурцы , зелень и фруктовые деревья . Весь урожай Мухадамин собственноручно собирает и отвозит для продажи на рынок.Его товар всегда хорошо скупается,потому что Мухадамин выращивает свой урожай с любовью и заботой.У него трое маленьких детей,и он работает не покладая рук,чтобы отложить деньги для их будущего.
Мухадамин хочет,чтобы его дети получили хорошее образование и могли обеспечить свою жизнь.Он планирует закупить семена для посадки и облагородить землю минеральными веществами.Но на данный момент у него нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому МУхадамин обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он заранее благодарит организацию Арванд  за поддержку и доверие к своим клиентам.
texts.en: Muhadamin is a 35-year-old man, married and a young father of three children. He has fifteen hectares of his own land, where he grows crops. He grows fruits and vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, cucumbers and fruit trees, on his field. Muhadamin gathers the entire harvest by himself and transports it to a market for sale. His product always sells well because Muhadamin grows his crops with love and care. He has three small children, and he works tirelessly in order to save money for this children's future. Muhadamin wants his children to get a good education and be able to provide for their lives. He plans to purchase seeds for planting and treat the land with mineral fertilizers, but at this moment, does not have a full amount of money. This is why Muhadamin came to MDO Arvand for financial support. She thanks the Arvand organization for trusting and supporting their clients.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 61, is widowed and has five children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store and a cafe in front of her house. 

She started this business 14 years ago. She sells food products and household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular rice, sugar and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular rice, sugar and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young fish and expand her fish farm

loans.name: Zhumakhal

texts.en: Zhumakhal is 48 years old. She lives in the Shahrituz district, located in the south-western part of Tajikistan. Zhumakhal is married. Her husband is involved in repairing houses. They have four children, two of whom are working in the Russian Federation. In her homeland, Zhumakhal, just like many of her village neighbors, is involved in farming. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She works on the land and earns money honestly. Today, Zhumakhal and her land are ready to plant the new crop, but financially Zhumakhal is not able to plant her crops. She is requesting this loan to buy potato seeds. Zhumakhal requested a loan with this intent and hope.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 25-year-old divorced woman with one child who lives with her family. She started her own business selling cosmetics in her house. She also works as a coach in one of the taekwondo clubs after she had to retire as a player because she had an injury.

Haya wants to live comfortably with her son and achieve her son's needs so she wants to develop her work and buy more cosmetics to sell. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy what she needs.

loans.use: to pay for more items of cosmetics to sell to get more profit.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 57 years old. She is married with two children aged between 15 and 25 years old. Both of them go to school. She has farmed for 28 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hollow blocks making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed like cement, sand etc. for her hollow blocks making business.

Esther has been in this business for 15 years. Esther earns more income from direct selling Tupperware products, fish vending and buying and selling nipa roofing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed like cement, sand etc. for making her hollow blocks

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Magreth, who is in her mid 40s, is a widow with grown-up kids. She has been a tailor since 1996. She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Magreth has had so many loans taken from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy three sewing machines and materials for making ladies' dresses and men's suits and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy a plot of land, bought a TV set, a deck, iron sheets, a radio, clothing materials and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy a zig-zag machine, to increase her stock of material and to start selling secondhand clothes. She dreams of expanding her tailoring business.

Magreth will share this loan with her loan group "Karafuu" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a  zig-zag machine, to increase her stock of material and to start selling secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Chanraksmey's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Chanraksmey is 32 years old and the mother of two children. To tackle her family’s living, she earns income via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. For Chanraksmey, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can improve her family's condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Francisca has been in this business for 11 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Jamila Al- Kadsia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Jamila Al- Kadsia. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB.

Jamila is the leader of the group and a mother of four children, living with her family in an old house. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and works as a bus driver to transport people. He earns a daily wage. The income from his business is not enough to make the necessary renovation for the house. Jamila wants to help him. She applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement and sand to make the necessary renovation for the house from the inside.

Jamila looks forward to expanding the house more and complete all its renovations.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to make the necessary renovation for the house from the inside.

loans.name: Jules Group

texts.fr: Jules et son épouse se sont lancés dans la culture du café après le constat que la banane et le manioc ne donnaient plus un bon rendement. Toutefois, cette activité rencontre les difficultés liées aux maladies et au rabais du prix sur le marché d'écoulement. Avec ce crédit, il va exécuter les travaux d'entretien et ceux liés à la récolte; il espère avoir une bonne production afin de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Président du groupe portant le même nom que lui,Jules porte un chapeau blanc et a une houe dans sa main.
texts.en:
Jules and his wife embarked on coffee growing after finding out that banana and cassava no longer gave good returns. However, this activity encounters difficulties related to diseases and the low prices on the sales market.

He will use this loan to carry out maintenance work and work related to harvesting. He is hoping for a good crop yield to meet his family's needs. 

President of the group bearing his name, Jules is wearing a white hat with a hoe in his hand.

loans.use: Maintain and harvest coffee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase his working capital and buy many pairs of shoes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: with maintenance and harvesting (of coffee)

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando es una persona, sencilla, humilde, trabajadora, un padre soltero de 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, en pocas palabras es un hombre que goza de la sencillez y no necesita grandes cosas para ser feliz, disfruta lo que tiene.
Se dedica a vender frutas, jugos, frituras, tintos, refrescos en un pequeño local ubicado en las calles e inicio su negocio por necesidad económica y hasta el momento este le ha sido suficiente para llevar el sustento a su hogar, en vista de que quiere incrementar sus ganancias, su surtido y ser más competitivo en el sector donde han venido nuevos puestos de venta de frutas quiere solicitar un crédito para abastecerse de frutas, frituras, vender buñuelos, empanadas, pasteles de pollo, etc., y seguir con su normal desarrollo de vida que lo ha hecho tan feliz y saludable.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is a person who is straightforward, humble, and hardworking. He is a single father of two adult children. Luis is a man of few words who enjoys simplicity and does not need expensive things to be happy. He enjoys what he has.

Luis Fernando sells fruits, juices, fried foods, black coffee, and soft drinks from a small street stall. He started his business out of financial necessity and so far it has been enough to sustain his household. Luis wants to increase his earnings and his inventory so that he will be more competitive in an area where new fruit stands can be seen.

Luis Fernando is requesting a loan so that he can restock his business with fruits, fried foods, fried dough balls, empanadas, chicken turnovers, and other products so that he can continue with the normal course of his life, which makes him happy and healthy.

loans.use: to buy fruits, fried foods, fried dough balls, empanadas, chicken turnovers, and other products to restock his business.

loans.name: Eulogio Ramiro

texts.es:
Eulogio es un hombre de 38 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, generoso, amable, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ un área caracterizada por encontrarse en cercanías al lago sagrado Titicaca, los habitantes del lugar se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y producción de derivados de la leche. De clima frío y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados, y a una altura aproximada de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Eulogio es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con sus padres que son muy mayores y no trabajan, vive en una casa de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado, labor que realiza los días sábados a partir de las 4 de la mañana en la feria del lugar. Decenas de comerciantes se agrupan a vender o intercambiar sus productos, como; ganado ovino, vacuno, papa, chuño, leche, queso, quinua, totora, etc., todos los productos que se elaboran en el lugar. En su establo guarda; vacas lecheras, gallinas y una llama, que se encarga de cuidar el establo de todo intruso. “el establo lo heredé de mis padres, toda mi vida me he dedicado a alimentar vacas, gallinas y algunas llamas, es una labor que requiere mucho trabajo porque hay que conseguir su alimento …” comenta. Su sueño es tener un establo más grande y con más ganado. Él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de 2 vacas lecheras para engordar, debido a la temporada de buen pasto y forraje. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Eulogio solicita un préstamo para la compra de 2 vacas lecheras para engordar en la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Eulogio, 38, is single and has no children.  He's an independent, enterprising, generous, friendly, active, responsible, and hardworking man.  He lives with his parents, who are very old and don't work.  They live in an adobe house that has electricity and potable water.  

Eulogio is short and dark and has short black hair.  His native language is Aymara, which is spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish because of his level of education and for business.

His business is selling cattle.  He works in the town of Batallas, an area known for being near the sacred Lake Titicaca.  The residents of the area work in agriculture, ranching, and dairy products.  The climate is cold and dry, at an altitude of 3,800 meters above sea level and a temperature that varies from 2 to 12 degrees centigrade during the day.

He sells cattle on Saturdays starting at 4 in the morning in the local market.  Dozens of merchants get together to sell or exchange their products, including sheep, cattle, potatoes, chuño, milk, cheese, quinoa, and totora reeds--all the products grown in the area.  In his stable he has dairy cows, chickens, and a llama that's in charge of protecting the stable from intruders.  "I inherited my stable from my parents.  My whole life I have worked feeding cows, chickens, and some llamas.  It's a job that requires a lot of work, because you have to get their food" he said.

Eulogio's dream is to have a bigger stable with more cattle.  He wants to expand his business with the purchase of two dairy cows to fatten, because it's the season for good pasture and forage.  This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the seven years he has been working independently in this line of work.

For those reasons Eulogio's requesting a loan to buy two dairy cows to fatten during the summer season.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to fatten during the summer season

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre soltero y trabajador independiente que se dedica a brindar soporte técnico a domicilio, su mayor fuerza de trabajo se encuentra en las veredas y muchas de ellas son de difícil acceso por lo que una motocicleta sería un complemento ideal para su trabajo y pensando en esta quiere solicitar un crédito para completar el dinero para comprarla, en la foto se ve el vehículo que quiere adquirir y de verdad lo necesita por que el capital que gasta en pasajes es muy alto y esto mermaría sus gastos increíblemente permitiéndole invertir en herramienta o comenzar un ahorro para comprar una casa en un futuro.
texts.en:
José is a single man and an independent contractor who provides home technical support services. A large part of his work involves traveling down country roads, many of which are difficult to access. However, a motorcycle would be an ideal vehicle for his work, so he plans to request a loan in order to add to his existing funds so that he can buy one. The vehicle he wants to acquire is shown in the photo.
