José is in true need of capital because his travel expenses are very high. His expenses would decrease considerably if he could invest in a vehicle, which would allow him to save some money toward the purchase of a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop in bulk

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de six femmes a été composé depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois. Elles sont issues de quartier différents et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques. Madame Seynabou est la responsable,elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont 01 fille et deux garçons. 
Elle s'active dans le commerce de poissons frais depuis bientôt  dix ans et dispose d'une bonne expérience .Son nouveau crédit de  300 000 francs CFA lui permettra de se payer des paniers de poissons pour les revendre au détails au niveau des marchés de la localité et des quartiers environnants.Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et engagé la construction d'un bâtiment.
texts.en:
This group of six women has been established since the first round of the "banc villageois" loan association. They come from different areas and are linked by good social and economic relations.

Mrs. Seynabou is the person responsible (for the group). She is married and has three children: one girl and two boys.

She has been active at trading fresh fish for nearly ten years and has acquired solid experience. Her new credit loan of 300,000 CFA francs will enable her to buy baskets of fish for retail sales in local markets and the neighboring areas.

Profits from her activity will enable her to manage her children's school, health care and nutritional needs, and start the construction of a dwelling.

loans.use: buy crates of fresh fish to conduct an income-generating activity

loans.name: Yorlene Lisbet

texts.es:
Si se trata de ayudar a los demás, Yorlene siempre ha estado pendiente y más que apasionada en hacerlo. Es por esto que ella decidió estudiar Enfermería hace tres años en el curso dominical, ya que su trabajo en una empresa privada no se lo permite, además que tiene un hijo de cuatro años de edad a quien debe cuidar. A sus 24 años de edad ella está casada y afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, sin embargo esta ayuda viene desde afuera, ya que su esposo trabaja en el extranjero.
No obstante ese no ha sido ningún obstáculo para continuar con sus sueños, ya que también cuenta con el apoyo de su madre quien es docente y de su padre quien es vigilante. Yorlene está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una computadora y un tensiómetro, pues con lo aprendido no es suficiente para poner en práctica sus conocimientos, con estas herramientas se podrá equipar mejor y realizar trabajos de mayor calidad. Entre sus metas está mantener su excelente rendimiento académico y ser una profesional sobresaliente.
texts.en:
When it comes to helping others, Yorlene has always been expected to do so and is very passionate about it. For this reason, she decided to study Nursing through a three-year program offered on Sundays since her job at a private company won’t allow her to attend school at any other time. In addition, she has a four-year-old child that she must care for. At 24 years of age, Yorlene is married and fortunate to have the financial support of her husband. However, this assistance comes from the outside since her husband works abroad.

No obstacles have prevented her from continuing to pursue her dreams. She also has the support of her mother who is a teacher and her father who is a security guard. Yorlene is requesting a loan so that she can buy a computer and a blood pressure cuff. Learning is not enough to put her knowledge into practice, so having these tools will allow her to be better equipped to do work of the highest quality. Her goals include maintaining an excellent academic record and becoming an outstanding professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a blood pressure cuff for her Nursing studies.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes et a été crée depuis il y a cinq cycles. Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations de voisinages.Madame Seynabou la responsable est une femme marie âgée de 52 ans et mère de 03 garçons et 1 fille scolarisés.Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de céréales locales.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 300 000 francs CFA elle va payer des sacs de mil d'arachides et de niébé pour la revente au détails au niveau du marché de sa localité.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This women's group was created five loan cycles ago. They are united through good neighborly relations.

The person responsible (for the group) is Mrs. Seynabou. She is a 52-year-old married mother of three boys and one girl, all in school. She is an active merchant of local grain cereals.

She will use her new 300,000 CFA francs loan to buy sacks of millet, groundnuts and cowpeas for retail sales in her local market.

Profits from her activity will enable her to take charge of her children's school and nutritional needs, and enhance her savings in the "banc villageois" loan association.

loans.use: buy bags of cereals to conduct an income-generating activity

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre de 60 años de edad, casado, tiene una hija de 26 años y su negocio es la artesanía en hoja lata.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, responsable, constante y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘los andes’ caracterizada por concentrar a artesanos que se ocupan de confeccionar trajes de baile tradicionales, como; la diablada, el caporal, morenada, etc. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 6-16 grados centígrados.
Andres es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymará el cual sólo habla con familiares y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza, vive con su esposa que se dedica al comercio y con su hija que estudia; en una casa alquilada construida de Ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la artesanía en hoja lata, realiza máscaras folclóricas, cetros para danzas, adornos para pared de estaño y otros. ‘la entrada folclórica de carnaval es la más famosa; para ese evento nos preparamos con 3 meses de anticipación…’ comenta. Su sueño es consolidarse como un fabricante artesano con contratos fijos para muchos grupos de baile. Él desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo como hojas de lata y estaño, para poder trabajar de manera continua. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Andres solicita  un préstamo para la compra la compra de material de trabajo para fabricar mascaras para las fiestas de carnavales.
texts.en:
Andres is a 60-year old married man who has a 26-year old daughter and a tinplate business. He is an entrepreneur and an independent, responsible, constant and hard-working man. He works in the area of "Los Andes", which is known for its artisans who make traditional clothing such as "la diablada", "el caportal", "morenada", etc. The weather is cold and dry with a temperature of 6-16 degrees Celsius during the day. 

Andres has dark skin and black short hair, and is small. His mother tongue is the "aymará", which he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish for general culture and for the business he runs. He lives with his wife, who works in retail, and with his daughter, who studies, in a rented house made of brick and corrugated iron in the ceiling. The house has drinking water, electricity and sewage system.

His business involves working with tinplate. He makes folklore masks, scepters for dances, tin ornaments for the walls, and other items. "The carnival folk dance is the most popular one; we get ready for this event with 3 months in advance", he explains. His dream is to consolidate his business with ongoing contracts with many dance groups. 

He wants to buy working material, such as tinplate and tin, so that he can work continuously. This is his 4th loan with the institution since he started the business 30 years ago. Andres is requesting a loan to buy working materials to make carnival masks.

loans.use: to buy working materials to make carnival dance masks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a course for her degree.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina tiene 63 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija y nieto en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces, golosinas, confitería, arroz, azúcar,leche, etc, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El presente crédito será para realizar reparaciones y ampliación de su tienda así como para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio. Con esto Regina espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo de esta manera sus gustos y preferencias, lo que le permitirá aumentar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Regina, 63, is married and lives in her own home with her husband, a daughter and a grandson in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.  She lives in a community that works in commderce, agriculture and livestock farming.

She sells sweets, pastries, rice, sugar, milk and other goods in the store she has set up in her home.  She has experience in the business and very good personal and work references within her district.  The current loan is to carry out repairs and to expand her store, as well as buy more goods for her business.  Regina hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To repair and expand her store and to buy more merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Los Agricultores De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Ronaldo (joven de camisa celeste) es un joven muy activo tiene 28 años de edad, vive con sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Ronaldo desde pequeño siempre se ha destacado con  la agricultura,  es un trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre y de sus hermanos,  en el lugar donde vive él es una zona muy fértil y da buena cosecha, pues años atrás Ronaldo sembraba muy poco porque no contaba con capital de trabajo,  su siembra incremento porque en Adicla le dieron un préstamo, es así como Ronaldo mejoro sus ingresos. 
Ronaldo viendo los resultados del crédito anterior, ahora nuevamente  necesita de un préstamo para volver a sembrar  papa y zanahoria y mantener la siembra que tiene ahora.   Con los ingresos que genera Rolando ayuda a sus padres en los gastos de la casa, Ronaldo tiene esperanzas de conseguir el préstamo, ya que él  quiere aprovechar los primeros meses del año ya que son épocas de muy buenas cosechas.  
La meta de Ronaldo en cada cosecha es que con las ganancias pueda tener un ahorro para  cubrir sus necesidades en el fututo y el anhelo de Ronaldo es construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ronaldo, (the young man in the blue shirt) is a very active 28-year-old who lives with his parents in the community of Sololá.  Ever since he was a little boy he has stood out in agriculture, which he learned all about from his father and siblings.  The land where he lives is very fertile and produces a good harvest.  Several years ago Ronaldo planted very little because he did not have work capital.  Buth with a loan ADICLA granted him he was able to increase production and improve his income.

Having seen the results form the previous loan, Ronaldo now is requesting a new one so he can plant potatoes and carrots and provide maintenance for the crop he has now.  Rolando will use his income to help his parents cover household expenses.  He hopes he can get the loan so he can take advantage of the first few months of the year which is a very good harvest season.

Ronaldo's goal is to save some money for the future and one day build his own home.

loans.use: To provide crop maintenance.

loans.name: Osmin Arturo

texts.es:
Osmin, de 35 años de edad, estudió solamente hasta sexto grado, está soltero, aun no a formado una familia, ya que con lo poco que el gana, no es suficiente para sostener un hogar.- Él se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en ésta área; con el no vive nadie.

Osmin, desde siempre se dedicó a la siembra de maiz y frijol, esto lo aprendio de su padre, ya que el le enseño como trabajar de esta manera y como poder llevar a casa los alimentos diarios.

Osmin, cuando tiene tiempo libre tambien, utiliza su tiempo en buscar leña para venderla y de ahi obtener unos dolaritos más, la necesidad de obtener dinero, lo llevo a él a dedicarse a estas labores; una parte de lo que siembra, es para venderla y la otra es para el consumo de el. 

El lugar donde cultiva está aproximadamente a 8 kilómetros de distancia y lo hace caminando, sale de su casa a las 5:30 de la mañana y regresa a casa a las 12:00 del mediodia.

Osmin, necesita el crédito para comprar cemento y arena para afinar las paredes de su casa, con la ayuda de este préstamo, él tendrá una casa bonita y digna donde vivir.

Él sueña con tener una casa digna en donde a futuro, pueda formar una familia y pueda darles las comidades necesarias.
texts.en:
Osmin is 35 years old and has just a sixth grade education. He is single and has not yet started a family as the low income he earns is not enough to support a household. He lives alone. Osmin has been working in farming for 14 years. 

Osmin has always made a living growing corn and beans, having learned the trade from his father. His father taught him how to do this work and bring home food to eat every day.

In his spare time, Osmin also looks for firewood to sell and earn a few dollars more. Osmin needs to earn money, hence why he does these jobs. Osmin sells part of his harvest and keeps the rest to eat himself.

Osmin's land is around eight kilometres from his home. He arrives there on foot, leaving home at 5.30am and returning and midday.

Osmin needs this loan in order to buy cement and sand to finish building the walls of his house. With the help of this loan, he will have a pretty and decent place to live.

Osmin dreams of having a decent house where he can one day start a family and provide them with everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to finish building the walls of his house.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Maria Alicia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labial y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Alicia continues to make a living selling beauty products, such as lipsticks, creams and perfumes. María wants to move forward in life with the help of this business. María is enterprising and plucky. She is applying for this loan in order to buy creams, lipstick and perfumes.

María is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipstick and perfumes.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN, la socia Julissa tiene 25 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora almuerzos para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al transporte, maestro constructor, venta de comidas, tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julissa is 25 years old and is a member of the "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian" communal bank. Julissa has a partner and two children. She looks after the home and has a restaurant business. Julissa has had the business for a number of years and it is going very well thanks to her determination. Julissa prepares lunches for customers and, through the work, is helping her family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy rice, oil and other products.

Julissa is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

The other members of this group work in transport, building, selling meals, and running grocery shops.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other products.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 44 años de edad, es casado tiene 7 hijos vive junto  su familia en una comunidad llamada San Andrés Semetabaj.
Diego  para generar los ingresos y mantener  a su familia, desde hace 24 años se dedica a la albañilería, él es muy reconocido por la comunidad y algunos lugares circunvecinos.   Pues sus hijos desde pequeño ayudaban  al papá, con la experiencia que obtuvieron ellos ahora también se dedican al mismo trabajo, ahora las hijas se dedican al tejido, pero solo trabajan media jornada porque por las tardes ellas salen a estudiar. 
Esta familia se apoya para generar sus ingresos. Diego manifiesta que  cuando empezó con este trabajo era muy rentable, pero al pasar de los años ahora existen muchas personas que realizan este trabajo, y ya no es muy bien remunerada.  Pues Diego con el apoyo de sus hijos van cubriendo sus necesidades.
Diego para sembrar su maíz el alquila terreno, pero la renta cada día es más cara, entonces entre familia han decidido mejor buscar un prestamo  para comprar un lote de terreno y lo van pagando poco a poco y que al final ese terreno será de ellos, y se evitan de seguir alquilando.
texts.en:
Diego is 44 years old, married and has seven children. He lives with his family in a community called San Andrés Semetabaj.

In order to earn an income and support his family, for 24 years Diego has been a builder. He is very well-known in the community and neighbouring areas. From a young age, Diego's sons have helped him and, with that experience, are now also working as builders. His daughters do sewing work, but only in the mornings as they go out to study in the afternoons.

This family supports each other in earning an income. Diego says that when he started building, it was very profitable. As the years have gone by, however, there have been more people working in the trade and it is now not very well paid. With the help of his children, Diego is able to pay for necessities.

Diego rents to sow corn but renting it every day is expensive. Therefore, the family has decided to apply for a loan in order to buy a plot of land and, by paying it off little by little, they will have their own land and stop renting.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Jenny Margoth

texts.es: Doña Jenny gracias a su primer financiamiento logro comprar los fertilizantes necesarios que fueron aplicados en sus cultivos de café los cuales desarrollaron muy bien su función protegiendo la planta, el grano y manteniendo la tierra y la planta bien cuidada. Además ella logro pagar mano de obra calificada con la cual asistió la plantación limpiando de maleza la propiedad. Gracias a ello su producción de café fue un éxito logrando vender el grano a muy buen precio en el mercado y entre los intermediarios de la zona con lo cual percibió ingresos que fueron utilizados para pagar el compromiso con la institución entre otros compromisos que anteriormente no podía cancelar. Actualmente doña Jenny solicita ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para nuevamente invertir en sus cultivos de café los cuales después de la corta del grano y recolección del mismo quedaron deteriorados y expuestos a ser contagiados por la roya o por plagas que conlleven a la tala de los mismos una vez dañados. Es por esa razón que ella solicita un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprara los abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para cuidar de estos en esta nueva temporada y lograr una mejor cosecha este nuevo año.
texts.en:
With her first loan, Jenny was able to buy the needed fertilizers for her coffee crop which worked very well protecting the beans, caring for the plants and maintaining the soil.  Also, she was able to hire qualified workers to help clean the land.  Thanks to all this her coffee harvest was successful and she was able to sell the beans at a very good market price among the dealers in the area.  The income she earned was used to pay back the loan and other previous debts.

Jenny is currently requesting support from Kiva lenders so she can invest once again in her coffee crop.  After harvesting the beans the plants have deteriorated and run the risk of being contaminated with a disease, meaning they would have to be cut down.  Therefore she is requesting a new loan to buy the fertilizers necessary to protect the plants in the new season and obtain an even better harvest this year.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Doña Gloria agradece el apoyo económico brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL y los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA ya que gracias a él pudo fertilizar su propiedad en el año 2013 logrando obtener una buena cosecha pero teniendo problemas con el precio del grano al momento de su venta que el mismo no fue muy beneficioso pero aun así con mucho compromiso, responsabilidad y honestidad logro salir de su compromiso en el tiempo establecido. También gracias al financiamiento brindado logro mejorar la cosecha y mantener sana la plantación en el año 2013 cubriendo con esto los gastos para la graduación de su hijo por lo cual está muy satisfecha y agradecida. Nuevamente ella regresa con la frente en alto a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para volver a solicitar una vez más apoyo económico con el cual pueda asistir su propiedad de café en esta nueva temporada comprando los insumos agrícolas necesarios para evitar que la plantación sea dañada o afectada por factor clima o alguna plaga por lo cual espera ser apoyada en esta nueva ocasión ya que los ingresos para el hogar dependen de la temporada de café de forma fuerte y salir adelante con cada una.
texts.en:
Gloria is grateful for the financial support received from COMIXMUL co-op and KIVA lenders because thanks to them she was able to fertilize her land in 2013 which gave her a good harvest.  But she ran into problems with the grain price at the time of sale, which was not very profitable.  But, even so, with much commitment, responsibility and honesty she was able to pay back the loan on time.  Also, she was able to improve her harvest and keep her crop healthy in 2013, and was able to cover graduation costs for her son, so she is very content and grateful.

Now she returns to COMIXMUL with her head held high to request a new loan.  The loan will be used to buy needed farm supplies for her coffee plantation to avoid climate damage or plant disease.  She hopes to receive the loan again because her household depends greatly on each season's coffee production.

loans.use: To buy new farm supplies for her seasonal coffee crop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La socia Eva se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de tortas,bocaditos y pasteles para eventos como matrimonios,bautizos y cumpleaños,  la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las tortas y bocaditos.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar harina,mantequilla y huevos para la elaboracion de tortas y bocaditos.
texts.en: Eva continues with her bakery business, making cakes and pastries for events like weddings, baptisms and birthdays.  She has been in business several years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to open a shop where she can sell the cakes and pastries.  The loan she is requesting is to buy flour, butter and eggs to make cakes and pastries.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and eggs to make cakes and pastries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make room divisions for her children since they are growing and they need their own space.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es Juli Karina,la socia continua con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo chompas, casacas, a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familiares entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, brindando el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “NUEVA VIDA” communal bank. It is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco.   

This member's name is Juli Karina. She continues with her clothes selling business. She thanks the people who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time. She continues to sell sweaters, and jackets to her customers who order from her, such as friends, family, and others. She is a responsible and hardworking person and this is the way she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy sweaters, among other things. The other members works at the businesses of selling clothes, selling shoes, a convenience store, and a taxi service.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, and more.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,blusas y polos,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas,blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita continues to work in the clothes selling business. She sells pants, blouses and t-shirts. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman and she wants to get ahead through this business. 

She is asking for the loan to buy sweaters, blouses, and pants.

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia  Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is called Marina. She continues to sell beauty products such as lipsticks, creams and perfumes. She works from 08:00 am to 07:00 pm and has been doing it for some years now. Her dream is to have her own establishment, where she can sell her beauty products.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes. This loan makes her feel happy and she promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Muchas personas migran con la esperanza de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y María es una de ellas. Esta comerciante de 48 años se movió de México con la esperanza de tener un mejor futuro junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo, fue entonces cuando usó sus ahorros y construyó unos pequeños módulos para alquilar, donde luego invirtió en una pulpería para aumentar sus ingresos. Ahora ya tiene dos años con este negocio, al cual le ha agregado el servicio de comida rápida. 
María cuenta con un gran carisma y un inigualable espíritu emprendedor, ya que  tras haber perdido una pierna ella sigue adelante con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes ya son independientes. Ella está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar pasta de dientes, harina, arroz, frijoles, dulces, entre otros productos para vender en su pulpería. En un futuro piensa comprar un refrigerador y una concina industrial para facilitar su área de trabajo.
texts.en:
Many people migrate with the hope of improving their living conditions and María is one of them. This 48-year-old merchant moved from Mexico in hopes of a better future, along with her husband and two children. She used her savings to build small units to rent out, where she later invested in a mini market to increase her income. She's had the business for two years now, and she has added fast food service. 

María is very charismatic and has an unparalleled entrepreneurial spirit, and she moves forward with the support of her now independent children, despite having lost a leg. She is requesting a new loan to buy toothpaste, flour, rice, beans, sweets, among other products to sell in her store. In the future, she hopes to buy a refrigerator and an industrial kitchen to improve her work area.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, flour, rice, beans, sweets, among other products.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS GIRASOLES, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yanet Marlene continua con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz  entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican  la venta de ropa, restaurante y docentes.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: Yanet Marlene is a member of the "Los Girasoles" communal bank, in the Cusco province and department. Yanet still has her grocery store business and is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time. She continues selling rice, sugar, milk, among other products to her customers. She is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how she provides for her family. She is asking for the loan to buy oil, rice, and more. The other members make a living selling clothes, have restaurants, and are teachers. The women who appear in the smaller photos asked permission to be late to the meeting due to work commitments.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, and more.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de celulares,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por medio de estos negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los celuares.La socia solicita el credito para comprar celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues working in her business selling cell phones. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman and through this business she wants to get ahead. The borrower's dream is to have a retail space where she can sell her cell phones. The borrower asks for a loan to purchase cell phones.

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela  es una mujer que lucha para cada dia para generar su ingresos, ella tiene 4 hijo ya todos casados y viven aparte, Manuela vive con su esposo en una comunidad de Santo Tomas la unión.
Manuela para sobrevivir  y generar sus ingresos ella se dedica a la venta de cortes típicos, la venta que ella tiene es una venta ambulante, no tiene un lugar fijo donde vender, no lleva mucho tiempo con el negocio pero gracias a Dios siempre vende, y ya es reconocida por la gente por la calidad de cortes que vende,  pues Manuela es  una mujer que no le gusta estar sin hacer nada, pues hace poco pensó en otra fuente de , ahora ella tiene una venta de granizadas de frutas, estas actividades lo entretienen a Manuela además le generan sus ingresos para satisfacer otras necesidades. 
Pues Manuela a pesar de que sus hijos estén casados,  siempre piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos, ella solicita un prestamo que le servirá para comprar  un terreno, para darles a sus hijos como herencia, para que ellos puedan tener un lugar donde poder construir sus propias casas.
texts.en:
Manuela is a woman who struggles each day to generate her income. She has 4 children, all married and living on their own. Manuela lives with her husband in community of Santo Tomas La Union.

To survive and generate her income, Manueala works selling cortes [traditional skirts]. She does her sales as a street vendor. She doesn't have a set space to sell from. She hasn't had this business for long but, thanks to God, she always makes sales, and she is already recognized by people by the quality of the cortes she sells. Since Manuela is a woman who doesn't like to be without anything to do, a little while ago, she thought of another source of income. Now she sells fruit granizadas [shaved ice]. These jobs entertain Manuela and also generate income for her to satisfy her other needs.

Despite her children being married, Manuela always thinks of the well-being of her children. She asks for a loan that will serve her to purchase land to give to her children as an inheritance, so that they can have a place to build their own houses.

loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia, la socia continua con el negocio de ferretería, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo clavos, pinturas, entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de regalos, ferretería, tienda de abarrotes y artesanía. 
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD communal bank group. This bank is located in Cusco district, belonging to Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Alicia, she continues to work in her hardware business. She is grateful for the offered loan and promises to make the established payments. She continues selling nails and paint among other items to all the customers who ask her for them. She is a responsible and determined person, being in this way that the member gets her family ahead. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase paints.

The other members work in business selling gifts, a hardware store, grocery store, and in crafts.

The members who appear in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to purchase paint.

loans.name: Ana Raquel

texts.es: Ana de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz  por mayor y cal para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has worked for some years selling tortillas and her business is located in her home.  With the sales that she makes, she manages to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to purchase corn in bulk and lime powder to continue with her work an din this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and lime powder.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children, and two of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, oils, shampoo, and rollers. Her major challenges include power shortages that interrupt business. Her goal and aspiration is to get permanent business premises. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy hair relaxers, treatments, oils, shampoo, weaves, and rollers

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el socio vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to work in his grocery store business. He sells basic pantry items such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. He works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. The borrower has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well.  His dream is to expand his grocery store business. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. 

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lay tile on the floor of his home so that it does not get muddy when it rains and ensure that their home is sanitary.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 54 años de edad, es separado, vive en una zona rural en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica a la ganadería, comercio y agricultura.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de albañilería, contando con herramientas propias, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El presente crédito será utilizado para realizar mantenimiento a sus herramientas así como para la compra de herramientas nuevas para su negocio. Esta inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, lo que tendrá una gran influencia en el negocio incrementando su nivel de ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 54 years old and is separated. He lives in a rural area of the Oyotún district, which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the Peruvian north coast. The people from this district work in livestock, trade and agriculture. 

Miguel makes a living as a bricklayer and relies on his own tools. His business is based from his own home. He has more than 15 years of experience and has loyal customers that give him very good personal and professional references. This loan will be used to perform maintenance on his tools and to purchase new ones for his business. This investment will allow him to have tools and equipment that are in better condition, which will, in turn, have a large influence on his business, increasing his income and improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his tools and to purchase new ones for his business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer que tiene muy clara su visión para el futuro, ella tiene 26 años, vive felizmente con su familia en una comunidad llamada Guineales. 
Manuela cada día que pasa  siempre vive pensando en su futuro y más en el  el bienestar de sus hijos, esta señora para ayudar a su esposo, lo que se le ocurrió  es instalar una pequeña tienda de consumo diario, y la tienda dio resultado pero era muy pequeña, le faltaba muchos productos, que la gente pedía,  entonces manuela tomo la decisión, para agrandar su tienda era buscar un prestamo para compra más productos por la demanda que tiene, gracias a Dios puedo tener el prestamo. Pero la demanda del mercado cada día es más, ahora Manuela decide nuevamente buscar un prestamo para  invertir más, de los   ingresos  que genera lo utiliza para complementar los gastos de su hogar. La meta de ella ahora es poner una segunda tienda y con las ganancias pueda más adelante comprar terrenos para que cuando sus hijos sean grades pueda darles como herencia. Manuela espera en Dios conseguir el prestamo para alcanzar estos sueños
texts.en: Manuela is a woman who has a very clear vision for the future. She is 26 years old and lives happily with her family in a community called Guineales. Each passing day, Manuela is always thinking about her future and, also, in the wellbeing of her children. This woman, to help her husband, had the idea of starting a small store with staple products.  The store was successful, but it was very small and lacked many products that her customers asked for, so she made the decision to expand the store. Thus, she sought a loan to buy more products to satisfy customer demand, and she gave thanks to God that she received a loan. However, the demand in her store increases every day, and again Manuela has decided to look for a loan to be able to invest more. She uses the income she generates to make up what is missing to pay household expenses. Currently, her goal is to put in a second store and, with her earnings, she will some day be able to buy land that her children, when they are older, could inherit. Manuela prays to God to receive the loan in order to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy staple products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy, 44 years old, lives with her two children and husband, who works as a painter in the local community. For the past 9 years, Thuy has been running a business sewing clothes to earn an income to support her family. Thuy is the leader of a 4-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the second from the left, wearing a purple t-shirt. Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Thuy is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality sewing machine to make more clothing to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality sewing machine

loans.name: Teegawende Group

texts.fr:
Mme KOUDEMA représente le groupe TEEGAWENDE. Elle se porte bien ainsi que les autres membres. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 04 vont  à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’haricot, 01bidon d’huile (20l) et une rangée de bois.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son champ d’activité et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Koudema is the representative of Teegawende Group. She's fine and so are the other members. She's married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 27 years old, the youngest is 18. All four go to school.

Mrs. Koudema has been in the restaurant business for 11 years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. She wants to buy one bag of beans, one barrel of oil (20 liters), and one bundle of firewood.

With her profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. She ambitions to expand her line of business and to better provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of beans, 20 liters of oil, and firewood

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, 50, is a farmer and a mother of two children living in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows rice and various kinds of vegetables. Sophal has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 26,400 KHR per day. This is Sophal's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

Sophal leads a group of three to get a new loan. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer, to plow and to pay for labor. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to plow and to pay for labor

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 60 años de edad, esta separada de su marido,vive en casa propia en la ciudad de La Paz, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, y ella trabaja como profesora de primaria en dos colegios, con esta actividad ella se mantiene y cubre todas sus necesidades.

El credito que solicita es para poner cemento al piso de su vivienda ya que por la epoca de lluvias se llena de barro, lo cual puede ser peligroso para cualquiera persona que viva en el lugar. Blanca aparece en la foto en las afueras de su casa y como pueden comprobar, esta sigue en obra bruta
texts.en:
Blanca, 60, is separated from her husband.  She lives in her own house in the city of La Paz.  Her children are adults.  She works as an elementary school teacher in two schools, and she supports herself and covers all her needs with this job.

The loan she's requesting is to be able to put cement on the floor of her home because during the rainy season it gets muddy, which can be dangerous for anyone who lives there.

The photo shows Blanca outside her house and, as you can see, the construction is rough.

loans.use: to cement the floor of her house

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Babra lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of them in school. She has no additional family members. For the past 5 years, Babra has operated a retail business selling used shoes. She moves door-to-door, selling the shoes six days a week. Babra generates additional income from selling piped water. 

Babra has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes to sell. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Babra's goal and hope is to get a permanent business premises. She resides in the family house with access to electricity but not to piped water. Babra's monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, 30 years old, is a hardworking mother living in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is engaged in farming; she grows and sells beans. As an additional source of income, Liza raises and sells hogs.  She is married and has four  children; the oldest is 12 and the youngest is 8 months. Her husband's income as a driver helps defray the family's daily expenses.

Liza is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, pig feed and pig supplements.  These items are essential in restarting her livelihood and allowing her to raise more pigs. Her farming business will improve its yield, resulting in higher income. Liza will be able to provide her children with proper diets and better living conditions. Liza is hopeful to become more proactive in managing her resources properly to improve her livelihood and to become more sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pig feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok, 40, is a mother of three dependent children living in Kampong Cham province. To tackle with her family’s hardship, she grows cucumber for resale as her main source of income and raises cows to earn extra income. This is Sok's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan. Sok is the leader of this 3-member loan group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her cucumber farm. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her cucumber farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Al-Raja'a Group

texts.en: Al- Raja'a group consists of four members who requested another loan for 90,000 YER. Latifa, the leader, will use her portion of the loan to purchase potatoes and sandwiches in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and sandwiches

loans.name: Isaura Lizeth

texts.es: Isaura es una joven de 29 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos, ama de casa y agricultora desde hace muchos años con un grado de educación secundaria completa graduándose como bachiller en ciencias y letras. En compañía de su conyugue se dedican a la agricultura, siembra y cultivo de café actividad practicada en su familia por generaciones y medio de ingreso económico para el sustento del hogar. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto con calidad e higiene. Como todo ella encuentra desafíos los cuales son los cambios climáticos, la baja de precio de café en el mercado, las plagas y enfermedades que lo deterioren queriendo evitar mediante la solicitud que en su primera ocasión está solicitando de poder ser apoyada económicamente por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva y la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizantes (18-46-0, formula cafetalera, abonos) y el pago de mano de obra calificada para dar una excelente atención al mismo. Sus planes son que con las ganancias ella genere salir de su compromiso y pueda re invertir un poco más en sus cultivos de café y ampliar un poco más sus cultivos de café sembrando y mejorando la cosecha para generar ingresos y darles a sus hijos un mejor estilo y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Isaura is a 29 year old young woman. She has 2 children. She is a housewife and has been a farmer for many years. She finished high school with a specialty in science and humanities. Together with her husband she works in agriculture, sowing and cultivating coffee. This activity has been practiced by her family for generations and is the means of financial income for supporting her household. Her customers are diverse buyers who come to the area looking for a product that is good and clean. Like everybody, she finds challenges because of climate change, the decreasing market price of coffee, plagues and diseases which deteriorate it. In order to avoid these obstacles and for the first time, she is requesting a loan to the different Kiva lenders and to the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy fertilizers (18-46-0, coffee formula, manure) and to pay for qualified hand labor to attend the coffee. Her plans are to repay her loan with the earnings she generates and to be able to reinvest a little more in her coffee crops. Also, she wants to increase her coffee crops by sowing and improving the harvest in order to generate income and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, leaf absorbed fertilizers, and to pay for hand labor to help the coffee crops.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es un muchacho adolescente de 33 años de edad tiene un hijo de siete años, viven en una comunidad de Nahuala Sololá.

Lorenzo  con el apoyo de sus padres tuvo la dicha de estudiar, él es profesor de educación primaria trabaja, en una  escuela de su comunidad y trabaja por contrato  él anhela conseguir su plaza presupuestada, Lorenzo lleva 7 años trabajando como profesor, le gusta este trabajo porque se relaciona mucho con los niños y se siente comprometido con su comunidad formando a la niñez.
  
El trabajo que tiene Lorenzo es media jornada, pues para sacarle provecho al día, él también se dedica al cultivo de frijol y milpa, este cultivo una parte lo consume  y la otra lo vende, cuando da buena.
Pues como cada padre de familia siempre vela por las necesidades de su hogar para que su familia vivan en armonía  Lorenzo para este año necesita construir su baño y repellar su casa, este es uno de los proyectos que tiene Lorenzo, es por eso que él está buscando un prestamo para empezar con estos trabajos Lorenzo según su presupuesto el necesita  siete mil quetzales. El sueño de este papá es tener su baño y  terminar con el acabado de su casa.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is young 33-year-old man. He has a seven-year-old son, and they live in a neighborhood in Nahuala Sololá.

Lorenzo, with the support of his parents, had the good fortune to be able to study. He is a primary school teacher, and he works by contract for a school in his community. He aspires to get a budgeted position. Lorenzo has been working as a teacher for 7 years. He likes this work because he connects with the children and he feels committed to his community by educating the youth.

Lorenzo works part-time, so to take advantage of the rest of his day, he also makes a living cultivating beans and corn. He eats what he produces, and also sells some when his production is good.

As every father does, Lorenzo always takes care of the necessities of his household, so that his family lives in harmony. For this year, Lorenzo needs to build a bathroom and plaster walls in his house. This is one of his projects that he has. He is looking for a loan to start this work. According to Lorenzo's budget, he needs 7,000 quetzales. His dream is to complete his bathroom and put the finishing touches on his house.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and plaster walls.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador, 40, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Baby Rose, a sewer, and has two children. He and his wife work together to continually provide income to meet their family’s daily personal and household needs.

Salvador operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Salvador earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. Salvador has a charming personality so people prefer to buy at his store. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him improve his income, Salvador is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, corn, charcoal, sugar, cooking oil and beverages. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him and for a good return on his investment which will greatly help provide for his family's needs and his children's school needs.

Salvador dreams that his children will become professionals. He aims for his store to grow so he can provide a better life for his family. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all attending school. She does not look after any other family members. Amina has been selling raw food, vegetables and charcoal on a retail basis at the market for the last two years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

Amina has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas, tomatoes, Irish potatoes and charcoal to sell. Her main business challenge is the seasonality of her supplies. Amina's dream is to increase the variety of food she sells at her stall. She joined MCDT because it is not costly to join the organization. Amina rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Claudia Cinthia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el lavado de autos.
Ella es dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un área caracterizada por el comercio mayorista; camiones cargados de frutas, verduras y carne llegan desde el norte para ser comercializados en el lugar y por mayor. De clima frío y seco con fuertes vientos que llegan de la cordillera.
Claudia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su mamá que atiende una tienda de barrio, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el lavado de vehículos; todos los días ella se acomoda en la esquina de un surtidor de gasolina para recibir automóviles y realizar su lavado, interior como exterior, lava las llantas y aspira los asientos, dejando para el final una pulida a la carrocería. “tengo clientes constantes que vienen 1 o 2 veces por semana, mi tiempo promedio es de 30 minutos por carro, los días de lluvia no tengo trabajo…” comenta. Su sueño es ser profesional y trabajar en una gran empresa. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una aspiradora y una pistola de agua para trabajar de manera más eficiente. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la compra de 1 aspiradora y 1 pistola de agua para lavar autos con mayor rapidez.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 19-year-old woman who is single and has no children. Her business involves washing cars. Claudia is sweet, loving, sensible, sincere, generous, understanding, responsible, and hardworking. She conducts her business in the District of Villa Fátima, an area that is known for wholesale trade. Trucks carrying fruits, vegetables, and meats arrive from the north in order to be sold in this place in bulk. The weather is cold and dry as a result of the winds that blow from the mountains.

Claudia has a dark complexion, long black hair that is tied back, and dark eyes. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish in order to integrate into the general culture and to conduct business. Claudia shares her life with her mother, who manages a store in their neighborhood. They live in a rented brick house that receives running water, electricity, and sewage services. Her business involves washing cars. Every day she sets up her business at the corner of a gas station where cars line up and wait to be washed.  She cleans the interior and exterior, washes the tires, and vacuums the seats. At the end, she polishes the body of the vehicle. “I have regular customers who come once or twice a week. The average time I spend for each car is 30 minutes.  On the days when it rains, I have no work,” says Claudia. Her dream is to become a professional and to work at a large company. Claudia wants to invest in her business by purchasing a vacuum cleaner and a water sprayer so that she can work more efficiently. This is her second loan cycle with Emprender. She has been in this business for three years.

For the reasons, previously mentioned, Claudia is requesting a loan in order to buy a vacuum cleaner and a water sprayer so that she can wash cars at a faster pace.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner and a water sprayer for her car wash business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 51 años de edad, divorciada, tiene 1 hijo varón de 5 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 12 y 8 años.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable  y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el centro de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por encontrarse negocios de todo tipo. De clima templado durante todo el año.
Juana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello lacio hasta los hombros, usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el Quechua, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos, las niñas estudian en la escuela el hijo varón todavía no está en edad escolar. Viven en una casa de la familia que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de librería, como; lápices, bolígrafos, cuadernos, hojas blancas, papel de colores, reglas, marcadores, etc. Labor que realiza durante todo el día de lunes a sábado, los domingos se dedica a su familia; realizando paseos, y limpieza del hogar. Su librería tiene ventas constantes debido a que se encuentra cerca de un colegio, las ventas bajas un poco en época de vacaciones, utilizando esas fechas para realizar el inventario y reposición de los materiales faltantes. “incentivar la lectura en los jóvenes es un reto diario que me inspira a continuar, buscando la manera de lograrlo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una cadena de librerías. Ella desea abastecer su librería con material escolar como libros, textos escolares, cuentos, cuadernos y otros, para recibir el nuevo año escolar preparada con todos los materiales necesarios. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de material escolar para abastecer su librería para el nuevo año escolar
texts.en:
Juana, 51, is divorced and has a son, 5, and two daughters, 12 and 8. She's an independent, enterprising, patient, supportive, responsible, and hardworking woman, and she's a good mother and a good listener.  She lives with her children. The girls attend school and the boy is too young to go to school yet. They live in a family home that has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system. She works downtown, an area known for having all types of businesses. The climate is temperate throughout the year. 

Juana is short and dark and has straight, shoulder-length hair, and she wears glasses. Her native language is Quechua and she speaks Spanish for work.

Juana's business is selling bookstore supplies such as pens and pencils, notebooks, white paper, colored paper, rulers, markers, and so on. She works all year from Monday through Saturday and devotes her Sundays to her family, taking walks, and cleaning the house. She has constant sales in her store because it's near a school.  Sales decrease a little during vacations, and she uses that time to take inventory and restock the supplies she's lacking.

Her dream is to incentivize young people to read and to have a chain of bookstores.

Juana wants to stock her store with books, textbooks, stories, notebooks, and other school supplies so she can start the new school year prepared with all the materials she needs.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the five years she has been in this line of work.  For those reasons she's requesting a loan to stock her store for the new school year.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to stock her store for the new school year

loans.name: Viva Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento VIVA compuesta por nueve integrantes de las cuales todas son mujeres, ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios.

Flora es una mujer de 35 años de edad en la foto (es la persona que se encuentra sentada), vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 10, 14, 6, 4 y 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Flora es de tez morena, cabello negro baja estatura, habla español, Sus hijos estudian en la escuela pública y viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional cruceña, como ‘Pacumuto’ que son trozos de carne de res que se ensartan en brochetas con otros ingredientes, como pimientos rojo y verdes, cebolla,  generalmente se sirve con arroz cocido con queso, yuca , Ají. “tengo muchos clientes a los que le gustan estos platillos y acuden a diario a mi venta…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante y servir solo pacumuto en todas sus variedades. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una cocina, mesas, sillas e insumos de cocina como; arroz, aceite, diferentes tipos de carne, etc. Para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta  actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para la compra de una cocina, mesas, sillas e insumos de cocina para cocinar comida tradicional.
texts.en:
Viva Communal Bank is made up of nine members, all women, who work in a variety of jobs to request a loan and expand their businesses, including vehicle upholstery, smoothie sales, mobile phone coverage, juice sales, perfume sales, soft drink sales, and clothing sales.

Flora, 35, is an enterprising, independent, and hardworking woman, and a good mother.  (In the photo, she's the person who's seated.)  She lives with her husband and has five children, ages 10, 14, 6, 4, and 2.  

She works in the southern part of the city of Santa Cruz.  The tropical climate is warm and humid, with a temperature that varies from 21 to 35 degrees centigrade throughout the year.

Flora is short and dark-skinned, and she has black hair.  Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and for business.  Her children attend public school and they live in their own home, a brick house with potable water and electricity.

Her business is selling traditional Santa Cruz food such as "pacumuto," strips of meat on skewers with other ingredients, such as red peppers, green peppers, and onions. There are more than ten types of pacumuto, including beef, pork, chicken, udder, tripe, and hump. Beef is the best known. Generally it's served with boiled rice with cheese, yuca, and hot pepper. Flora's dream is to have a restaurant and serve only pacumuto in all its varieties.

She wants to invest in her business with a purchase of a stove, tables, chairs, and cooking ingredients such as rice, oil, different types of meat, and so on, so she can expand her business.  This is her seventh loan sequence with the institution in the ten years she has been in this line of work.  For those reasons Flora's requesting a loan to buy a stove, tables, chairs, and ingredients to make traditional dishes.

loans.use: to buy a stove, tables, chairs, and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en:
Kry, 51 years old, is a mother of six children living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she earns an income through rice cropping and cucumber growing. This is Kry's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to gradually improve her living conditions. 

Kry is the leader of this 3-member loan group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cucumber farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cucumber farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 43 years old, widowed, and has five children. She owns a rice farming business, which she has been doing for 25 years. For the last harvest season, she earned a net income of 35,000 PHP, which was spent on her family's daily expenses. 

Thelma requested a loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de puertas ventanas, vitrinas, etc. sus dos hijos le ayudan en el negocio, ya tiene clientes fijos por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas mercadería por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 47 years old. She lives in her own house with her two children. She works selling doors, windows, display cabinets, etc. Her two children help her with the business. She has regular clients due to the quality of the products and good prices. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, to continue with her sales since this is her only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase doors, windows, display cabinets, etc wholesale

loans.name: Kelin Yolivet

texts.es: Kelin gracias a su primer financiamiento logro comprar los fertilizantes necesarios que fueron aplicados a sus cultivos de café evitando el contagio de plagas en estos y el deterioro del mismo por factor clima. Además ella logro pagar mano de obra calificada con la cual asistió la plantación limpiando de maleza la propiedad. Gracias a ello su producción de café fue un éxito logrando vender el grano a muy buen precio en el mercado y entre los intermediarios de la zona con lo cual percibió ingresos que fueron utilizados para pagar el compromiso con la institución entre otros compromisos que anteriormente no podía cancelar. Actualmente Kelin solicita ser apoyada nuevamente por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para re invertir en sus cultivos de café los cuales en esta nueva temporada necesitan ser protegidos nuevamente aplicando insumos como fertilizantes, abonos entre otras fórmulas que su función es evitar la planta se contagie de ojo de gayo, roya y sea deteriorada por el factor clima (helada en el grano).
texts.en:
Kelin, thanks to her first loan, was able to buy the necessary fertilizers to apply to her coffee crop, avoiding the contagion of plagues and the deterioration of her crop due to the climate.  In addition, she was able to pay for qualified hired laborers who helped with planting and cleaning up the property.  Thanks to the loan her coffee production was a success, allowing her to sell the grain at a very good price in the market as well as to intermediaries in the area.  She earned income that was used to repay her loan with Kiva's field partner as well as to repay other debts that she had not previously been able to repay.  

Currently Kelin is asking for assistance once again via Kiva's investors in order to reinvest in her coffee crops during this new season.  She needs to protect her crop again by applying fertilizer and feed, amongst other formulas, that will help her plants avoid contagions like "ojo de gallo," often brought on by heavy rains, or roya, another common disease for coffee crops, as well as to protect her crops from all climate related deterioration.

loans.use: To purchase coffee fertilizers and formulas for coffee such as 18-46-0, and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica  a la venta de productos de uso personal su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene 15 años de tener el negocio y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como cremas, lociones, cosméticos, gelatina para el cabello, esmaltes para uñas, etc. todo por mayor para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Consuelo is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her son.  She works selling personal care products and her business is located in the municipal market.  She has been running this business for 15 years and she has many customers.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy more products such as cremes, lotions, cosmetics, hair gel, finger nail polish, etc.  She will buy everything in bulk in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy cremes, lotions, cosmetics, hair gel, finger nail polish, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Marlenne Concepcion

texts.es: Marlene se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de electrodomésticos de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas electrodomésticos por mayor para poder asi tener mejores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marlene has been working for the past five years selling electrical appliances as a walking saleswoman in different neighborhoods. She has many customers due to the quality of her products and the good prices.  With her earnings she has been able to get ahead.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her two children . She is asking for a loan in order to buy more small appliances in bulk so that she can have better earnings and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase electrical applicances in bulk.

loans.name: Sivkek's Group

texts.en:
Sivkek is 49 years old and has five children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. She grows rice and various kinds of vegetables. Her group consists of three members.

Sivkek requested her second loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer to support her vegetable farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farm and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Paz De Jesus

texts.es: Paz de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, golosinas, dulces, refrescos, granos básicos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para surtir su tienda y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Paz, 31, lives in her own home with her family. She has run a small store from her house for several years, and she has many customers, especially her neighbors. She uses the money that she makes from sales to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of soups, snacks, candy, soda, staple grains, oil, etc, in bulk to stock her store and thus make more money.

loans.use: to purchase soups, snacks, candy, soda, staple grains, oil, etc, in bulk.

loans.name: Juana Evelia

texts.es: Juana de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, etc. para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son.  She has worked for the past several years making and selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas). Her business is located in her home and she has many clients.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, etc., in order to continue to make pupusas and in that way increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, etc., in order to continue to make pupusas

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 21 years old. He is a single guy who has four brothers and his father works as a truck driver. Amin lives in Irbid and is a diploma student who is majoring in electricity. He depends on himself, and he is ambitious guy who also wants to help his father provide for household expenses. Therefore, Amin is working part time while in school.

Amin is requesting a loan to help him pay his university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Luz De Maria

texts.es: Luz tiene 41 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her son.  She has run a small store for the past ten years located in her home.  She has many customers due to her good prices and the kindness she displays when making sales.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc., and thus be able to increase her income and obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc.,

loans.name: Susana Carolina
