texts.es: Susana de 32  años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 7 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Susana is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  She works selling personal care products and has been in this field for 7 years.  Her business is located in her home and she also sells products as a walking saleswoman in different neighborhoods.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase perfumes, lotions, cremes, shampoo, deodorant, etc., all in bulk, and thus be able to continue with her work and have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, cremes, shampoo, deodorant, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is a 19-year-old freshman who is studying medicine at the university. She is a daughter of a family from Pursat province in Cambodia. Yan’s father is a teacher and her mother cultivates rice and beans for a living. 

Yan is requesting a loan to pay her tuition because she is short of finances. Her loan will help her graduate successfully with skills to build a good future. For her dream after graduation, she hopes to have a job with a decent salary so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
A mother of three dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Yim is 56 years old. Nowadays, she earns income via rice cropping on one hectare area and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 36,100 KHR per day. 

This is the second cycle for Yim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pay the harvesting fee. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle and improve her rice farm and make it better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
An old woman who lives in Kampong Cham province, Saroeun is 62 years old and a mother of three children. She is a farmer who earns an income to support her family by growing rice and various kinds of vegetables. This will be Saroeun’s second loan cycle with the Kiva partner VisionFund. She fully repaid her past loan. 

Saroeun is the group leader of a three-member loan group. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, plow her land, and pay labor fees. In the future, Saroeun hopes to expand her farmland to get more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plow land, and pay labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Marina Amanda

texts.es: Mariana de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mariana is 47 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband. She has made a living by selling tortillas for various years. Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers. With what she obtains from her sales she is able to pay some of her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime to be able to continue making tortillas. In this way she will be able to have greater earnings to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to by corn by the quintal and lime

loans.name: Wendmangda 02 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur PATRICE est le représentant du groupe WENDMANGDA 02 SAPONE. Marié, il est  père de 04enfants. Le plus âgé à 13 ans et le moins âgé a 06 mois. 02 vont à l’école. Il a 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l'agriculture depuis plus de 12 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Il veut s’acheter  01 motopompe.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Patrice is representing the Wendmangda 02 Sapone group. He is married and has four children ranging from 13 years to six month of age. Two of his children go to school. He has nine dependents.

Patrice has been working as a farmer for over 12 years. He stocks up in the nearby villages.
He would like to buy a motor pump. He wants to use his revenues to reinvest in his business. His goal is to be able to pay for his children’s’ schooling.

loans.use: to buy a motor pump.

loans.name: Norma Esmeralda

texts.es: Norma de 36 años de edad tiene un puesto de venta de comida ubicado en su lugar de residencia  desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: pollos, carne, arroz, frijoles, verduras, frutas y demás productos para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: For two years, Norma, 36 years of age, has run a food stall out of her home. She has a lot of customers because of her great prices. With her sales, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase raw materials, such as chicken, beef, rice, beans, fruit, vegetables, and other products to continue her work and thus have more income.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, rice, beans, fruit, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados,  tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Juana está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 38 year old single mother who lives with her son in her own home. She makes a living selling clothing by foot in different markets. She has many regular customers due to the quality of the clothing and good prices.

Juana is asking for a loan to buy more clothes wholesale so she can continue with her sales and have better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Dominga Marlene

texts.es: Dominga de 35 años vive con su grupo familia en casa propia, se dedica a vender ganchos para el cabello de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, Dominga solicita crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería para obtener mejores ganancias y así seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Dominga, 35, lives with her family in her own home. She makes her living selling hairpins as a street vendor near her home. She uses to money she earns to help out with household expenses. Dominga requests this loan to purchase more merchandise in order to generate more profits so that she can make more money and continue to help out with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more hairpins wholesale.

loans.name: Khy's Group

texts.en:
Khy, 34, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children. For the main source of income, Khy grows rice on a one hectare area. In addition, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is Khy's first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other members of her family.

She operates a food stall selling green bananas, sweet potatoes, and cassava on a retail basis at the market. She has been doing this work for the last three years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other sources of income.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas, sweet potatoes and cassava for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to buy land to start farming. She joined MCDT because of their good customer care.
She rents a house with access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Paz Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Paz de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 15 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paz, 55 years of age, lives in her own house with her two daughters. She has had a small store in her home for 15 years. She sells a variety of products such as snacks, soft drinks, staple foods, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc., and she has a lot of customers because of her good prices.

She is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, since this is her only source of income, and this way, she will be able to have greater earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, staple foods, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 29 years old and is married with a three-year-old son. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as biscuits, flavored juices, soft drinks, chips and spices. Aside from running her store, Mary Rose also raises and sells hogs. 

Mary Rose is requesting a loan to buy groceries such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and toiletries. These stocks would be very helpful in augmenting her daily income. With more buyers to shop at her store she could slowly start to settle her obligations and begin to set aside some savings for emergency purposes. In the future, Mary Rose would like to do her best to successfully manage her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, and toiletries

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with three children, all of whom are attending school. She does not look after any other family members. Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda. For the past three years, she has sold charcoal at the market, working six days a week. Edith’s business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She rents a house with access to electricity but does not have running water. Edith’s major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Edith is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to sell. She joined MCDT because of good customer care.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 39 years old, married, and has two children. He is a farmer from Kiamuthambi village, situated in the central province of Kenya. He is dedicated to his work and only thinks about going forward and delivering good products. He knows that many people consume his products, and because of this, he is determined that his products are pure and of good quality. 

Anthony lives on a small piece of land where he keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops, which he has been doing for 10 years. His primary sources of income are milk and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases. Anthony joined Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. 

Anthony requested a loan, which he will use to expand his horticulture farm. This loan will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go toward his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, children are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With this loan, Anthony's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their future.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all the ingredients.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su carro desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco, 63 years of age, lives in his own house with his life partner. He has made his living offering transportation services in his car for several years. He has a lot of customers who prefer him because of how responsible he is when driving. With what he earns from his work, he is able to cover any expenses that arise at home.

He is applying for a loan to buy tires and to maintain his vehicle, since it is his only source of work, and so that he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She operates her own beauty salon, which she has been doing for one year. Nazira is a very hardworking woman and she addresses each customer's needs individually. Her high quality of service has enabled her to attract regular clients. 

Nazira requested a loan for 2,500 Somoni, which she will use to buy equipment for her beauty salon. The loan will help her to increase her working capital and offer higher quality services.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 21-year-old single lady who lives in Irbid with her family. She is a college student studying childhood. Yasmin chose her major based on her love for children and she hopes to work a school someday. She has five brothers and her father, who is the only breadwinner in the family, works on a truck. The increasingly high cost of living makes it difficult for Yasmin to complete her education as her family cannot pay university fees. 

Yasmin is requesting an education loan to help her pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Soeurng's Group

texts.en:
Soeurng is 44 years old and a mother of one child; she is living in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she grows rice on one hectare area and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is Soeurng's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is leading a group of five members to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living conditions and buy a decent motorbike.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Phor

texts.en:
Phor is 31 and a mother of three children. Two of her children are in school and one is too young. Phor lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She grows rice on three hectares area as the main source of her income and she also raises pigs.

Phor is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner VisionFund to pay for harvesting fees and to buy rice seed to support her farm. This will be her fist loan. In the future, Phor hopes to earn more income to update her lifestyle and improve her rice farm bigger than before.

loans.use: to pay harvesting fees and buy rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is in her fifties and she still has the passion to succeed. She is married and has two children. Virginia’s husband is a driver while she manages her market stall where she sells a variety of vegetables. She has been in this business for eight years and her income serves to help meet her family’s basic needs. 

Virginia is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy carrots, beans, lettuce, potatoes, and many other vegetables to sell. Her dream is to have future savings to be able to provide for her needs in times of emergency. Virginia hopes for the continuing growth of her business and to earn a higher income. She will do her best to save some of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy carrots, beans, lettuce, potatoes, and many other vegetables

loans.name: Vilma Ivonne

texts.es: Vilma de 37 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ganchos para el cabello de manera ambulante por lo mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, Vilma vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, solicita un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería para obtener mejores ganancias y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vilma is 37 years old. She works selling hair clips itinerantly in the markets close to her house. With the money she makes she manages to pay some of the household expenses. Vilma lives in her own house with her life companion and her daughter. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise in order to generate more profit and be able to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy hair clips.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is 47 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. She is a local who lives in the Kampong Cham province. Lim works growing cassava and rice to help overcome her family’s hardships. 

Lim is requesting a loan to buy seed for her cassava farm. This will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. In the future, Lim hopes that she can get more income to renovate her house to become better off than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Savi's Group

texts.en:
Savi, a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is 26 years old and a mother of one child. For her living, she can earn income via rice cropping on one hectare area and she works for others for a fee. She can earn about 35,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third cycle for Savi with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradually pace. She is leading a group of two to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and pay labor fees. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living conditions and make them better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Carlos  Antonio

texts.es: Carlos de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa  y sus dos hijas, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been working making trips in his pick-up truck for the past 15 years. He has many clients who prefer him for the responsibility he shows when driving. With what he makes from his work he manages to pay the expenses for his household. He is requesting a loan to buy tires and do maintenance on his vehicle as this is his only source of work and so that he can have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es: Reyna de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reyna is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter and her husband. She has had a small store located in her place of residence for 3 years. She has many clients due to her good prices and her friendliness when it comes to selling. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries etc. so as to be able to have more income to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is a 38-year-old married mother of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. She is a resident of a trading center in the city suburbs in Uganda, and this is her second loan with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. 

Mike has been making use of her 100,000 UGX loan, which helped her business expand. And now she intends to take a 400,000 UGX loan so she can add stock to her charcoal trade business and increase her sales and profit.

Mike is so grateful for the support given to low income earners. Her future plan is to venture into alternative energy sources because forests are dwindling.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie has owned a sari-sari (variety) store in Estancia, Iloilo for five years now. In her store, she sells items such as canned sardines, meat loaf, corned beef, chips, candies, noodles, seasoning, bath soap, and shampoo. In addition to her store, she also buys and sells squid to earn an income. This is her way of supporting the needs of her four children between the ages of 2 and 10. Connie is asking a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more inventory to replenish her shelves, such as noodles, canned sardines, beef loaf, corned beef, chips, candies, detergent, bath soap, shampoo and more squid. Connie dreams of sending her children to school until they graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned sardines, beef loaf, corned beef, chips, candies, detergent, bath soap, shampoo and more squid

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Happiness, respect, and collaboration are some of the values country people have. These women work the earth so that thousands of people can benefit from healthy foods. One such individual is Virginia, who is one of the most dedicated and hardworking farmers from Kerugoya, Kenya. She has been working in agriculture for six years now. She makes money selling products from her farm, which include milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity. 

Virginia is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help to increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving, and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way toward permanently changing the life of Virginia and her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Domingo Soriano

texts.es:
Domingo Soriano tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café de variedad Catimor y con fincas de café en buen estado, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha, con esto Domingo Soriano espera mejorar la productividad de su cultivo de café y ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo Soriano is 51 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his spouse and children in the district of Cañaris, located in the province of Ferreñafe, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. Life in the district is peaceful, it's inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

He works in agriculture. He has Catimor varietal coffee crops and a coffee plantation in good shape and also he works raising cattle. He has more than 15 years experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the area. The present loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his crops as well as to contract labor for harvest time. Doing this Domingo Soriano hopes to raise the productivity of his coffee crops and offer a better product to his clients. This would allow him to increase his level of income and in the end improve the quality of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his crops and to pay for labor at harvest time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay this semester's tuition fees so that he can complete his education.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida es una señora que da clases en una escuelita de primaria y vende comida los fines de semana de esta manera se gana la vida honradamente, así es como ha sacado adelante a sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las divisiones de la sala y cuartos para hacer de su hogar una vivienda digna y poder disfrutar de ella en su vejes junto a su familia.
texts.en: Aida is a woman who teaches in an elementary school, and sells food on weekends. This way she makes a decent living, and she has been able to raise her children who are now adults and independent. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials to build panel divisions in the living room and bedrooms, to make her house into a respectable home where she will be able to enjoy her old age along with her family.

loans.use: Aida is requesting a loan to build panel divisions of living room and bedrooms. She wants to improve her house to enjoy her old age in a respectable home.

loans.name: Sewar

texts.en:
Sewar is a single lady who lives in Salt with her family. She has four brothers. Her father is retired and her mother works as a teacher.

Due to the increasingly high cost of living, her family is facing financial problems. They cannot pay university fees, which makes it difficult for her to complete her education. That’s why she applied for an education loan: to help her pay the university fees.

loans.use: To pay for next semester's fees.

loans.name: Nua Ngam 12 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Uong is 55 years old and lives in an old, Thai traditional home in a remote village, with five other family members and they rely on agricultural production for a living. Despite the advanced age, Uong works very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry, including cultivating rice, raising pigs, chickens, ducks, and musk ducks. She is a really hard-working woman and has always wanted to expand and diversify agricultural production. 

This is the third time Uong has received a loan from the Entrepreneurs du Monde - Anh Chi Em program and she will use it to have enough capital to buy a buffalo for ploughing. She hopes that her effort will be requited, so that her family’s income will be improved and they will have a more abundant life. 

In the picture, Uong stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to have enough capital to buy a buffalo for ploughing.

loans.name: Kongowe Kati Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her late 30s, is a single mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are still in school while the other 2 are now grown.  

Rehema has been running a grocery store for 6 years. She works daily from 3:00 pm to 12:00 midnight and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to start selling chicken feed and increase her stock of groceries. Her profits went towards paying her children's school fees and her household expenses.  

Rehema will use this current loan to purchase supplies of drinks for her grocery store and chicken feed to resell. She dreams of building a chicken shed and starting a business selling chickens.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group Kongowe Kati which consists of 2 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy both drinks to supply her grocery store and chicken feed to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir e zona de alto riesgo se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de papas fritas de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sacos de papas por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young lady, whose face has been pixelled for being 28 years old and for living in a high risk zone, has worked for the past few years selling french fries on the street in the different neighborhoods. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children. She is asking for a loan to buy bags of potatoes wholesale to be able to continue selling and have better earnings.

loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Delphine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 02 membres fait partie du banc villageois mis en place depuis le 13 Décembre 2008.La plupart des femmes font du commerce et de l’élevage.
Mélanie debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et est mère de 03 garçons et 04 filles.
Elle compte faire de l’embouche avec le prêt reçu. Elle achète 20 porcs à 10000Fcfa l’unité. Elle paie pour le transport 30000Fcfa .Elle dépense 150 000Fcfa pour l’entretien et 220 000 FCFA pour l’alimentation. Elle revend les porcs à 35 000Fcfa l’unité.
Elle renforce son épargne au sein du banc villageois et assure la nourriture au niveau de la famille grâce aux bénéfices réalisés.
texts.en:
This group of 2 members has been part of the 'banc villageois' set up on December 13, 2008. Most women work in commerce and livestock farming. 

Mélanie, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 53 years old and a married mother of three boys and four girls. She plans on using the loan received to fatten livestock. She purchases 20 pigs at 10,000 francs CFA each. She pays 30,000 francs transport. She spends 150,000 francs for maintenance and 220,000 francs for feed. She resells the pigs at 35,000 francs each. 

Mélanie bolsters her savings within the 'banc villageois' and ensures her family has food, thanks to the profits made.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of the tricycle and to buy spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, and chains.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo en casa de material rústico en la provincia de Callayuc, ubicada en la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Los habitantes de este distrito se dedican al comercio, ganadería y agricultura como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente (bebida que se obtiene de la caña de azúcar), cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será utilizado para invertir en la ampliación de las áreas donde siembra la caña de azúcar la cual destila para obtener el aguardiente, de esta manera incrementará la cantidad de producto que ofrecerá a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus niveles de ingreso y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Pablo is 51 years old. Along with his partner and their young child, they live in a rustic house in the province of Callayuc, in the Cajamarca region, in the mountains north of Peru. People in this district work in commerce, livestock, and agriculture as their main economic activities. He works distilling alcohol (obtained from sugar cane.) Pablo has 10 years of experience in this business and has regular clients who provide very good personal and professional references of him. The loan will be used to expand the planting areas for his sugar cane crops used to distill alcohol. This way he will increase the quantity of product to be offered to his clients, which will allow him to increase his earnings thus improving his and his family's quality of lfe.

loans.use: To invest in the expansion of sugar cane fields, used to make distilled alcohol.

loans.name: Nada Group

texts.en:
Nada is a 51-year-old, married woman and the mother of two daughters and one son. One of her children is, Mai, 19 years old. She is a married woman, without children.

Mai has helped her mother work since childhood. They work in goat-breeding. They start working in the morning. The mother goes to the farm to collect the grass to feed the goats and the daughter takes care of the sheep.

Nada and Mai want to improve their standard of living and they work hard to live comfortably with their family. They have a vision of becoming productive women. They have hope to reach the level of better living and each one of them has dreams -- the mother wants to complement the studies of her children and the daughter wants to establish a stable life with her husband. 

Now they have four goats. They have a goal of expanding the work and to buy more goats, so they requested a group loan to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a 30-year-old married mother of 4 children, all of whom go to school. She is a resident of Wakiso town council in Uganda. This will be her 2nd loan with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd.

Jesca has requested a 1,000,000 UGX loan to invest in her business selling used clothing.

Jesca is so grateful for the support given to low income earners. She has been able to borrow money and earn a profit, allowing her to pay her children's school fees. 

Jesca's future plan is to continue seeing her children through school.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: Fotima was born in 1967. She is married and has two children. She always looks out for the well-being of her family. She works hard every day to earn a living. Fotima has been busy buying and selling fruit in a local market. Fotima buys fruit in bulk and sells it in the local market. She has been busy with this business more than 20 years, and she has great experience in this field. Fotima is going to buy furniture for her house. She hopes in this way she will offer her family good living conditions. She awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en: Guliston is 52 years old, married and the mother of two children and grandmother of two grandchildren. Guliston has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 15 years. She knows how to run an agricultural business and can effectively invest finances into it. Her son and daughter-in law help her in work. She requested a loan in the amount of $550 (USD) to buy calves and livestock feed. Guliston intends to use the earnings from the loan to further develop her business, which will allow her to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and calves

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 49-year-old man from Concepcion, Iloilo in the Philippines. He earns a living through a catering business that he has been running for more than 10 years. 

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy more catering materials like cooking pans, plates, and kitchen utensils, amongst other things. 

With this loan, Joseph will be able to improve his business as well as his income. In the future, he hopes to make his business more stable and productive.

loans.use: to buy catering supplies such as cooking pans, plates, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married father of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. He runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business selling various goods and items to the people in his community. Michael has been in the business for more than eight years now. This is the source of his income. Michael is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, rice, bread, biscuits, soap, detergents, soft drinks, beverages, candies, condiments and cooking oil. Through this loan, Michael will be able to improve his inventory, thus attracting more buyers to his store. In the future, Michael hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: o buy more stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, rice, bread, biscuits, soap, detergents, soft drinks, beverages, candies, condiments and cooking oil

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, sugar, noodles and bath soap. She a mother of two children, ages 20 and 17. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy assorted stock for the store like soft drinks, condiments, canned goods and toiletries. With this additional inventory, she could meet more customers' needs for higher earnings.

In the future, Mamerta would like to expand her business for the success of her livelihood and continue to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store like soft drinks, condiments, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Hael Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Hael Al- Hodeidah group is composed of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. This community is hard working and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. The group took out a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Hadia is the leader of the group. She is 52 years old, married with six children, and the family lives in a small house. She is a hard-working woman who dreams of providing her children with better living conditions. In 2009, Hadia started a humble business sewing traditional women clothes inside her own house. Her income, however, is very limited and not enough to cover the main expenses of the family. She doesn't have sufficient money to expand her business. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase stylish women fabrics to sew and sell as a ready- made women clothes.

Hadia looks forward to providing her family with a promising future.

loans.use: To purchase stylish women's fabrics to sew and sell as a ready-made women's clothes.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has been in the business for more than four years now. Rita sells various goods ranging from foodstuffs to cooking ingredients and toiletries. This has been her source of income. Rita is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, soap, detergents, candies, bread and biscuits. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Rita hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, soap, detergents, candies, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Kelin Johana

texts.es: Johana tiene 24 años de edad quien es perito mercantil y contador público por lo cual está muy agradecida con sus padres por haberla apoyado en sus estudios. Ella es una joven soltera no tiene hijos y muy trabajadora pues ella es la encargada de la administración del negocio de su familia y la encargada de velar por el mismo la siembra y cultivo de café siendo este rubro la principal fuente de ingresos en su hogar por muchos años. La propiedad que ella administra y tiene a cargo es propia la cual la heredo su padre y está ubicada a pocos metros de la casa de habitacion donde habita la cual pertenece a sus padres. Sus planes y metas como productora de café es la ampliación de la propiedad fortalecer aún más el negocio y generar mayores ganancias las cuales con el tiempo sean beneficiosas para sus futuros hijos. En este momento ella solicita apoyo económico para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos de esta manera ella abonara una parte que no está en el punto de corte y al mismo tiempo con este apoyo económico ella podrá pagar la mano de obra para la recolecta del grano y poder empezar a generar las ganancias que necesita para poner en práctica sus planes y metas esperando ser apoyada para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Johana is 24 years old and is a commercial expert and public accountant. She is very grateful to her parents for supporting her with her education.

She is single and does not have children. She works hard and is in charge of the administration of the family business which is a coffee plantation and its harvest.  This has been the main source of income of her home for many years. She owns the land she manages which she inherited from her father. It is located a few meters from the house she lives which belongs to her parents.

Her plans and goals as a coffee producer are to expand the property and strengthen the business to generate more profit.  With time this will benefit her future children.

She is asking for financial help to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and fertilize an area which is not ready for the harvest yet.  At the same time, with this financial help she will be able to pay for manual labor to collect the grains and start generating the profit she needs to put into effect her plans and goals. She hopes she receives the support to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay manual labor to help with and clean the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a 59-year-old married mother of four grown-up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Vilma has been a rice retailer for more than 15 years now. This is her main source of income. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell. A loan will help her improve her rice stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Vilma hopes of making her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
Neriza engages in the food vending business. She prepares and sells homemade ice cream. She is a 26-year-old married woman with three children from Dulag, Leyte. Her oldest child is eight and the youngest is one. To improve her earnings, she also engages in balut vending. Balut is a developing duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.

Neriza is asking for a loan to purchase ingredients like sugar, flavoring, ice cream cones and many others. These ingredients will be used in producing more ice cream and could reach a huge volume of output. It could create higher earnings and she would be able to roll over her capital. In the long run, she will be able to manage her income and start to settle her obligations.

She would be grateful that she could slowly recover from her previous situation and hopefully these results would be more productive and she is willing to exert much effort in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients  like sugar, flavoring, ice cream cones and many others.

loans.name: Marylene

texts.en:
Marylene is an ice cream vendor. She sells homemade ice cream to the people in her place, using her motorcycle. In addition, she is also an Avon dealer. She sells ladies' apparel, beauty soap, lotion, body spray, and kitchenwares. She is a married woman, with four dependents. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is two.

Marylene is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients, like milk, sugar, ice cream cones, and various flavorings. These ingredients would be of great help in preparing more ice cream to sell. Because of additional output, Marylene would earn more money and be able to start paying her dues. In this way, she can now provide for the needs of her growing children.

Marylene hopes that she would be able to handle her sources of income, be more sustainable, and improve her livelihood status in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, like milk, sugar, ice cream cones, and various flavorings.

loans.name: Ilir

texts.en: Ilir is seeking your financial help again. This time he will use the loan to prepare the land for seasonal planting. Ilir also wanted to take this opportunity to thank his lenders again.

loans.use: to prepare the agricultural land for seasonal planting

loans.name: George

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet George, a hard-working, 54-year-old go-getter. He hails from KiIne, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must be tough. George has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past three years. He keeps dairy cows, poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables to sell. He also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses his path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, George is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. George is seeking a loan for his horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for him. With your loan, George seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kerugoya and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses he has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, he will finally be able to satisfy his family’s basic needs. He stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children."

George is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in his life. However, he has always had the strength to move forward for the sake of his children.

loans.use: To grow his horticultural farming business

loans.name: Srorem

texts.en: Srorem is an 18-year-old freshman who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in hotel and tourism at university. She is from the Kandal province in Cambodia. Her mother is a farmer who cultivates corn to sell and her father is a teacher. Her great aunt is a farmer and she also helps to support Srorem to earn the bachelor’s degree. Due to the fact that she is short of finances to pay her four-year tuition fees, she would like a loan. With this loan, she will be able to graduate and earn skills for her future job. After graduation, Srorem dreams to have a favorite job to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay her four-year tuition fees

loans.name: Faeda

texts.en:
Faeda is a 38-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. Her husband is a construction worker earning a low and unstable income. He also works with his family on their agricultural land and Faeda helps him with the farm work. They grow seasonal fruits and vegetables. It is a very good business and supports the family with a good income. 
Faeda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm. By taking out this loan, Faeda will be able to improve the family farm and increase its productivity. 
Faeda appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Murodaly

texts.en: Murodaly, who was born in 1994, is single and is from the capital of Tajikistan. Murodaly is a student of the 3rd course of Tajikistan. Murodaly is studying finance. He is one of the best students and he reads a lot of books. He lives with parents who are workers. Murodaly must pay for his tuition but his parents do not have enough money. He is asking for a loan of $2,000 (USD) to pay for tuition. He awaits your support. His dream is to be a good financial specialist .

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Jona

texts.en: Jona is a 40-year-old married mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been a fish vendor for more than 10 years now. Fish vending is her main source of income. Jona is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Jona  hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of four children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business with her husband for more than four years now. Marilyn is asking to take a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. She believes that a loan will help them maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a businesswoman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has two children. For more than a year, Yolanda has operated a business raising hogs, which is her main source of income. Yolanda is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for the family farm

loans.name: Bibirayhon

texts.en:
Bibirayhon has been engaged in farming for over 10 years. She has a piece of land where she plants and gets a good harvest. Bibirayhon is always happy when she gathers good quality crops. She sows mainly wheat and vegetables.

Bibirayhon is 30 years old. She's a wonderful wife and the mother of two children. She lives in a village of Vakhsh district with her family. Bibirayhon now is preparing the soil for planting a new crop. For this reason, she applied for a loan to buy fertilizers, and wheat, melon and watermelon seeds. This loan will help her to hold early sowing and get a good harvest in the spring. Bibirayhon hopes for your responsiveness. You can support her now.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, melon and watermelon seeds, as well as mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo, who was born in 1982, is an industrious woman and the mother of three children. She lives with her family happily. Marhabo has been busy in the agriculture business for more than nine years. She has land where she grows vegetables and crops. Marhabo also earns additional income from sewing. Marhabo is the only income source for her family so she works hard. Marhabo lacks money for sowing seeds so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy seed and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for the new sowing season

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Elsa has been in this business for more than four years now.

Elsa is asking to take a loan to replenish her stock of items such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, candies and snack foods. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, candies and snack foods

loans.name: Mark Joseph

texts.en: Mark Joseph is a 27-year-old married man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business for more than five years now. This is his source of income. He also earns an additional income through food vending. Mark Joseph is requesting to take a loan to pay for the repair of the motorcycle and additional ingredients for cooking like meat, vegetables, rice and soft drinks. A loan will help him to improve his business and income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the motorcycle and additional ingredients for cooking like meat, vegetables, rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Suyapa tiene una edad de 44 años madre de 2 hijos quienes estudian y trabajan en compañía de su padre mientras no están en sus estudios. La siembra y cultivo de café ha sido fuente de ingresos económicos en su hogar por generaciones siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Posteriormente decidió dedicarse a esta actividad cuando ella formo hogar con su pareja ya que él también es agricultor pues vio en él un apoyo más para no trabajar en esta actividad sola ya que es un poco pesado y muchas veces se necesita el pago de mano de obra para dar el mantenimiento a su plantación. Doña Suyapa desea que su plantación de café sea la mejor de la zona, abundante y muy rica en producto pues para ello solicita se le apoye económicamente para comprar los insumos agrícolas que son necesarios para asistir la plantación de café como fertilizantes, abonos entre otros como el pago de mano de obra para tener un mejor resultado en el menor tiempo. Sus metas como productora de café siguen siendo la ampliación de su propiedad, la mejora continua sobre su producto y sobre todo la diversidad de plantación de café para poder cosechar una diferente clase de grano de café por lo cual espera ser apoyada para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Suyapa is 44 years old.  She is the mother of two children who attend school and work together with their father when they are not in school.  Their household's income comes from planting and cultivating coffee.  This has been in her family for generations, and her parents taught her to work the land at a young age.  She decided to do this work when she formed a household with her partner, since he was also a farmer.  She saw him as a support so that she would not have to work alone, since it is hard work and she often had to pay laborers to maintain the crops.  

Suyapa hopes that her coffee plantation will be the best in the area and that it will be abundant and rich in production.  In order to do this, she is requesting financial support to purchase farming supplies that she needs to care for the coffee plantation including fertilizers, manure, and others.  She will also pay laborers to have a better result in less time.

Her goals as a coffee producer are to expand her property, continuously improve her product, and diversify her coffee plants so that she can plant a different type of coffee grain.  She hopes that she will be supported so that she can move forward.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to maintain her crops and to pay laborers .

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a married woman and the mother of two children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Eufemia has been in this business for more than two years now.

Eufemia is asking to take a loan to replenish her stock of items to sell, like canned goods, rice, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, candies, bread, mosquito repellent coils, and others. A loan will help her to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers into her store. Eufemia hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, rice, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, toiletries, condiments, cooking oil, candies, and bread

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 42-year-old woman with seven children. She is from Mayorga, Leyte. Her oldest child is 19 and the youngest is three. She engages in making and selling tuba (coconut wine). She also raises and sells hogs as her other source of income.

Francisca has requested a loan to buy pig feed and pig supplement and to put additional capital toward her tuba vending. The feed and supplement will improve the way she raises her hogs. An abundance of feed could also have a positive impact on the growth rate of the hogs. With these inputs, her hogs will grow fast in the coming months, and this will cause the contents of her pockets to improve. She will also be able to sell more tuba to her respective customers. She will be able to provide for the needs of her family.

In the future, she aspires to be active enough in handling her sources of income for the sustainability of the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pig supplement and to put additional capital toward her tuba vending.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a 59-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has earned a living selling various goods and items to the community for 8 years. 

Gregoria requests a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, bread, biscuits, condiments, and other items. A loan will help her to improve her stock and increase sales. 

In the future, Gregoria hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, bread, biscuits, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Thirty-nine year old Rowena has sold dried fish for 10 years. She is a married woman with five children from Mayorga, Leyte. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 11.

She is asking for a loan to  buy more dried fish to reach various customers. She wishes to earn more money and provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

In the future, she would like to expand her current sources of income for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a rice retailer from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has a 20-year-old son. Mercy has been in the rice retailing business for more than 15 years now.

Mercy is requesting to take a loan to buy more rice to sell. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.  In the future, Mercy hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Nemer

texts.en: Nemer, a 47-year-old married man, lives in Marka. He is the father of six children. Nemer has an auto repair shop, and it is his sole source of income. He has many financial obligations, including his children's education and household expenses, that create difficulty for him in meeting his family's basic demands. So he has resorted to asking for a loan to expand and develop his work, helping to improve his family's standard of living and to employ people who need to work.

loans.use: To pay to expand and develop his work, helping to improve his family's standard of living and to employ people who need to work.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is from Estancia, Iloilo. For fourteen years, she has been a rice dealer in her community. She usually buys harvested rice from farmers, sends it to the milling companies to be ground and then sells it in the market for a profit. Victoria is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more rice from farmers to increase her income. Victoria hopes to make her business more profitable so she can improve her home and buy healthy food for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice from farmers

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a married woman and mother of two children, ages 6 and 4. She lives in Concepcion, Iloilo. For the past 4 years, Maricel has run a small sari-sari (convenience store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Maricel is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, detergents, toiletries, bread, snack foods, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, etc. to sell. A loan will help her improve her inventory, which will attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Maricel dreams of making her business more stable and profitable. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, detergents, toiletries, bread, snack foods, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Anamie is married and has two children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She operates a sari-sari, or general, store, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. 

Anamie requested a loan, which she will use to buy more canned goods, noodles, soda,  beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, coffee, and snack foods. This loan will help her improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Anamie hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soda,  beverages, soap, toiletries, rice, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, coffee, and snack foods

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small store business to sell various goods and items to her community.  She has been in the business for more than 8 years. This is her source of income. 

Hannah requests a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, condiments, toiletries, snack foods and other items. She believes that a loan will help her to improve her stock and attract more buyers.  

In the future, Hannah hopes to make her business more stable and productive.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, condiments, toiletries, snack foods and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and some materials for goats and also she hopes to buy cows besides goats.
